story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Noemi and I'm a poet and creative from South Texas. My borderlands tongue story begins centuries ago in Puerto Rico and Mexico  and more recently, how my parents met in Chicago. 

My dad came to the US as a bracero and was used for his labor. My mom and her family were displaced from Puerto Rico when she was very young.  After living in Chicago we moved to South Texas where the idea of being split biculturally and triculturally was even more pronounced.

I came to zines when I was about 20 and wrote my first zine "Making of a Chicana." Influenced by young punk women of color at the time who were making zines, I wanted to document my experience as a young brown crip mother in a little place called the Rio Grande Valley as I dealt with being a single parent, poverty, working/working poor, chronically ill,  depression/anxiety and all the feelings in between. 

This zine anthology includes the work I have done since then, beginning with "Making of a Chicana"  in 2001, the first issue of hermana resist from 2002 as well as other one offs and mini zines I did. 

-Including in this anthology:

 Hermana, Resist 1-5

-Aged Noise

-Making of a Chicana

-Lines from Acedia to Apatheia

-The blue metal kettle

What's inside this 8x10" collection: 

200 + pages filled with zines I've written in the last two decades. The cover is a beautiful design by visual artist and educator Celeste De Luna. Celeste De Luna is from the Rio Grande Valley and known for her relief prints, creative printing making and community work. Her site >> http://www.celestedeluna.com/

The Funding

  • The funding of this project will go directly to pay printing costs and other associated fees for a first print run. It will also go towards promotional materials and shipping fees. 
  • Anything above this amount will go towards travel fees and tabling. 

The Impact

Documenting our existence and history is vital and so many queer crip women and nonbinary zinesters and writers work is lost because it is not archived. 

The reality is that many presses don't want to take on a zine anthology project because of the cost and size. Many also believe that since zines are a dying lo-fi product, zine anthologies won't sell and won't have traction. Another reality is that collections by women of color and nonbinary zinesters of color just do not get produced. Documenting the existence of our work from decades past is vital to portraying a part of history that we were part of, and a testament that this medium of communication was important for us latinx, grrls, punks, and others trying to find our voice, and each other. 

The importance of zines and edu.punk in my formative years, coming into conocimiento, as we say,  means so much to me that I often cite then when giving readings and in writing. 

Many zines of decades ago vanish without being preserved. The flats are lost or their makers are no longer with us. I strongly believe, and have advocated for ever, that it's necessary to preserve our work both because it's culturally significant and because we are often missing from zine history and history itself. Writing and producing zines is one way of documenting our existence and writing our own history, but so is preserving these written histories. 

Challenges

There are challenges with this getting accepted at traditional indie presses. This is a large collection and comes in at about 200 pages, and after having shopped it around to different presses set a goal to get this printed and ready in 2018. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share my campaign with peer, friends and colleagues.
  • Get in touch with me if your institution can host a reading, zine fair, zine presentation and  host me!

The perks

I've created some cool perks for those that donate. These include: 

  • a perk where I come visit your school or class and talk zines!
  • a copy of my book Love Letters: South Texas Experience and this anthology. 
  • Copies of all my zines still have copies up (Will update with the titles!) and this anthology. 
  • and more!

 

Gracias!

Your donations and contributions mean the world to me. Your continued support for all my projects truly make me feel valued :)

[from the zine aged noise]

Questions & About Me

If you have any questions about the book, feel free to email me at hermanaresistpress@gmail.com

Hope you will donate to the campaign!

Noemi Martinez is a queer crip femme poet-curanderx, mixed media artist and writer with magical roots from Mexico and Puerto Rico. A single mami of 2, she lives in a multi-crip fam in deep South Texas. She created a small micropress Hermanx Resist Press in 2014 and edits the online space Poems & Numbers which produces #nof!ckingborderwall, a litmag. 

Some of her poems, essays and art can be found in Rest for Resistance, Bitch, TAYO Literary Magazine, Jellyfish Review, Alyss Lit Mag, The Deaf Poets Society, Hip Mama Zine, The Perch, Rigourous, Make/Shift and Motherhood: Love on the Front Lines. She spills secrets and poems, late night twitter style @hermanaresist.

story:
I AM

I am a woman, a child, a daughter, a sister, an artist, a yogi, a writer, a contemplator and a recovering addict. But most importantly, I am a girl asking for your help.

My name is Alyx, and I was born in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, but I grew up in Vancouver, Canada.

In my mid-twenties I left Vancouver, I was looking for more. I was trying to find my purpose or something like it. There had to be more to life than getting married, having two kids and a white picket fence. I grew up with the white picket fence, I wanted to know what was on the other side. The world was my playground. I wanted to learn, feel, see, and do, so I hopped on the hippy trail. That’s how I landed in India. 

India was a life-changing experience in so many ways. I've discovered that my home is everywhere and nowhere and so I've kept on traveling since that day. In the East, I discovered how we are all connected. That we are much more than our minds. 

Travel changes your perception, it allows you to grow in unimaginable ways. It opens your mind to new possibilities. 

These are a few of the countries I’ve been to in the last 15 years: 

Canada, USA, Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras, England, France, Italy, Spain, Greece, Turkey, Syria, Denmark, Sweden, Cuba, Nepal, India, Bali, Thailand, Cambodia, Singapore, and Malaysia. 

I struggled with addiction in all of those countries. One pill was too many and one thousand wasn’t enough. 

The summer of 2014, I fulfilled one of my dreams, I became sober. My Mom enrolled me in Rehab (yes, I was tired of being an addict). I was screaming at the top of my lungs for help. 

Rehab was the best and hardest accomplishment of my life. 

Being an addict has been my biggest learning experience on Earth so far. Sharing my story of addiction with people from completely different cultures, ages and ways of thinking has made me realize that our personal story carries a message. How truly connected we all are to one another. 

I am humbled to share my story with you. I am also super nervous and scared. 

Over the last 20 years, people pushed me to be quiet. I was told I wasn’t enough. That other people’s feelings are more important than mine. 

On the other hand, I had others tell me to write my story, but I didn't feel ready. I was too scared of being judged. 

This past Christmas 2017, I was ready to write my memoir. 

I slept and ate words. I felt alive and on fire, fulfilling my purpose. I was connected to the source. 

The reason I’m telling you all of this?

You guys have played a huge part in my memoir. 

Being an independent writer has a lot of benefits, but it also means that you do everything on your own. 

Writing a book requires money, which unfortunately I don’t have yet. But maybe with your help, we can fund this book together and share my story with the world. 

This memoir consists of 32 chapters. 

It starts the day I was born. 

I started writing this book with my friend Emilie Davies. 

I would write a chapter per day and email it to her. 

Emilie became my second voice, questioning me about how I felt and making sure my thoughts made sense on paper. 

This is not an easy task as I have dyslexia. 

Writing a memoir is a process. 

I had to put complete faith in Emilie that together, my thoughts, words, and feelings would stay raw and authentic. 

It was several intense months of writing together making sure I stayed on track. 

Making sure I didn’t feel shame, guilt or unworthy. As a result of writing this book, I worked through my emotions, grew, and now understand I’m not who I used to be. This kind of super intensive soul work is not easy. A lot of emotions bubbled to the surface. 

I feel privileged to have a friend and co-writer like Emilie. Someone who believes in me. 

Someone who believes my story will change lives. It has certainly changed mine. 

WHERE DOES ALL THIS MONEY GO TO?

We have chosen Tellwell Publishing - based in Victoria, BC to help bring this book to life.

Here is a breakdown of the costs associated with self-publishing this book.

* Tellwell Publishing - $6,300 USD

- ISBN (book number)

- Interior book layout and back cover design

- Upload book via Ingram to 39,000 booksellers

- Automatic printing & fulfillment

- Paperback edition

- Kindle ebook & Amazon look-inside

- Kobo ebook direct, Indigo & partners

- Expanded ebook platforms

- Book marketing consultation & strategy

- Targeted media list

- Copyediting

- Substantive edit (content & copy)

- Enhanced amazon.ca/.com distribution

* Graphic Designer - $2,000 USD

- Book cover design

- Video for this Indiegogo campaign

- Music for the video

* Website Design - $2,000 USD

- Website design

- Web hosting and domain name

* Writer fees - $2,400 USD

- Emilie and I have worked for months on this project and will share these fees together. Writing is an art and we believe artists should be paid.

* Book Printing & Shipping - $13,000 USD

- This will cover the initial print run for this campaign

* Indiegogo Fees - $2,750 USD

- Indiegogo charges 5% fees on the amounts raised plus another 3-5% in credit card/fee processing.

* Contingency - $1,800 USD

- We wanted to include a buffer in case there are unexpected costs or we need to print more books.

* GRAND TOTAL - $30,250 USD

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We realize not everyone needs to buy my book, or for some, it may not be possible to donate at this time... but maybe, just maybe, you know someone who does want to read my story. I'd really appreciate it if you would share this campaign with your friends:

- link: www.indiegogo.com/projects/memoirsofajunkieyogini

or

- link: http://igg.me/at/junkieyogini

- or use the share tools to spread the word on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and beyond!

- And lastly, wish me luck - I am truly grateful for your support!

Love Alyx & Emilie

story:
This campaign has now ended. Please visit www.sclass.org for updates and to get the book.

Setting Sail In America

Lifelong sailors, Alan and his son Cory have been always been passionate about the sea. In 2005, the duo joined the classic racing circuit by purchasing Firefly, a 1926 S boat, which they campaign together. Alan is currently the Vice Commodore of the Narragansett Bay Herreshoff S Class Association. While Cory's photographic specialty is superyachts and the luxury lifestyle market, traveling the globe on assignment for highly renowned ship builders and dedicated owners, he began his career focusing on wooden boats.

"Captain Nat" Herreshoff, who designed the S Class boat in 1919, is the most famous American yacht designer, with an accomplished history of boat building and innovation. From Bristol, Rhode Island, Herreshoff designed eight consecutive America's Cup defenders, from 1893-1934. The first owners of the S Class boats were also remarkable leaders of industry in the United States, and their stories are as intriguing as the boats are beautiful. 

2019 marks the 100th Anniversary of the S Class design. Setting Sail in America is an homage to Class, and takes the reader on a compelling journey through the history of the S boat- a journey that visits milestones in American society, politics, business, and social life. The Herreshoff S Class is the oldest American one-design fleet still racing the original boats, with active fleets in Cape Cod, Long Island Sound, and Narragansett Bay.

 

About the Book

It is a large format, 14"x11", hard cover, coffee table book, approx. 144 pages, filled with vibrant Cory Silken photographs. The book is written and is in the midst of the copy and image editing process. It is in press with Seapoint Books, an independent publisher in Brooklin, Maine. They specialize in producing small run nautical books, such as The New York Yacht Club: A History, by John Rousmaniere. The book on schedule for delivery during winter, 2019.

We are looking to raise $10,000 toward the editing, design, layout, and printing of the book. Should the book generate a profit, it will be donated to the Herreshoff Marine Museum, a 501c(3) nonprofit organization.

The first 25 copies are a signed, limited Exclusive Edition, with a special case and printing upgrades, available for those supporters looking for a uniquely collectible volume. The next 250 copies are the Bristol Edition, each individually numbered and signed by the Silkens. 

 

About the Authors

Before campaigning Firefly, Alan was an avid cruising sailor and an active competitor at the Yale Corinthian Yacht Club. Alan has been published in Sail Magazine and a number of poetry magazines, as well as editing The Curved Mast, the newsletter of the Narragansett Bay S Class. 

Cory Silken is one of the world's preeminent yachting photographers. From his Gallery in Newport, Cory travels the globe on assignment for some of the top superyacht shipyards and regatta sponsors, and accepts private book commissions from many discerning superyacht owners. His poster editions are distributed worldwide through vendors such as art.com and Ikea, and have appeared as set dressings on numerous TV shows and movies. He is honored as the 11th Hour Racing Visual Ambassador, promoting environmental sustainability through yachting.  Visit www.CorySilken.com to learn more.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you, we appreciate your support! It would also be great if you can please spread the word about this campaign- share it on your social media, with your yacht club and other organizations, and ask your favorite bloggers, vloggers, and news organizations to feature us. We are also currently scheduling book presentation and signing events for 2019 and 2020, so please reach out if your local club/store/museum/regatta/event may be interested.

story:
A könyv

 

Miért maradt le az Egyesült Államok az űrversenyben? Valóban csak néhány másodpercen múlt Neil Armstrong élete egy űrutazáson a Holdra szállás előtt 3 évvel? Ha az Apollo–1-en kitört tűzben nem veszíti életét három űrhajósuk, a NASA talán soha nem jut el a Holdra?

Gene Kranz lehet az egyik leghitelesebb forrás a fenti kérdések megválaszolására, hiszen az űrprogram kulcspozíciójában, a Houstoni Űrhajózási Központ repülésigazgatói (küldetésirányítói) székében ült a 60-70-es években. Mesél a hőskorról, a kezdeti kudarcokról és arról az elhivatottságról, amelynek köszönhetően a ma már megmosolyogtatónak tűnő műszaki fejlettségi színvonal mellett immáron 50 éve az emberiség máig is megdöntetlen csúcsteljesítményét vitték véghez. Természetesen külön fejezeteket szentel az első Holdra szállásnak és az Apollo–13 küldetésének, amelyek sikerében, illetve megmentésében ő maga is elévülhetetlen érdemeket szerzett.

Hidegháború, űrtechnológia, kalandok, dráma, történelem és nem utolsósorban vezetéstudomány – mindezekről szól a könyv, több mint 400 oldalon keresztül. 

 

 

Az ötlet

Másfél éve láttam egy filmet (Az alapító), ezután jutott eszembe, hogy a téma eredetijeként szolgáló könyvet – első ilyen projektemként – lefordítsam, és ha már lefordítottam, akkor saját kockázatomra ki is adjam. Ebből lett A McDonald's sztori című könyv, amelyről több információt itt találtok:

https://www.facebook.com/amcdonaldssztori/

A kaland egészen jól sikerült, és most összeszedtem a bátorságomat, hogy folytassam. Bár végzettségem alapján szakfordító is vagyok, nem hivatásszerűen csinálom, csak hobbiként fordítok, illetve tanulási és vállalkozási tapasztalatszerzés miatt döntöttem a magánkiadás mellett.

A mostani téma, az űrutazás régi kedvencem: Verne könyvein, az Alfa holdbázison, az Orion űrhajón és a Csillagok háborúján nőttem fel, ráadásul a Holdra szállással szinte napra pontosan egyidős vagyok. A szerzőt, Gene Kranzt, a NASA houstoni űrhajózási központjának repülésigazgatóját egyik kedvenc filmemben fedeztem fel. Az Apollo–13-ban Ed Harris alakította, szerintem zseniálisan.

  

 

1969 

Ebben az évben szállt ember először a Holdra, ekkor születtem, és ebben az évben jelent meg az a cipőmodell (Onitsuka Cortez, lásd lent :-), amelynek lekoppintásával a Nike későbbi világhódítását köszönheti. És ennyi darabból áll a LEGO tavaly kiadott szettje, az Apollo űrhajókat pályára állító Saturn–V hordozórakéta, amelyet kisfiammal egy álló napon keresztül raktunk össze... Szerencsére a családban eredeti sajtórelikviák sokasága is megmaradt 1969-ből, amelyeket most mind fel tudok használni szakirodalomként.  

 

Mi a terv és mi is ez az Indiegogo?

Az eredeti mű jogtulajdonosától megvásároltam a magyar fordítás és kiadás jogát.

Ezen és a fordításba beletett néhány száz munkaórán túl szükség van egy szerkesztő-lektorra, aki nyelvhelyességi és stilisztikai szempontból gatyába rázza a szöveget. A szakmai szöveg pontosságára nagyon ügyelek, komolyan beleásom magam a témába, de jó, ha a végén valaki segít egyeztetni az alanyt és az állítmányt...:-)

Szükség van egy tördelőre, aki a nyers dokumentumból profi módon könyvformátumot készít. Egy grafikusra, aki segít megtervezni a borítót. Aztán egy korrektorra, aki a nyomdakésznek hitt anyagot még egyszer átrágja, és kijavítja a még megbúvó hibákat.

És végül egy nyomdára, aki papírt és festéket nem kímélve létrehozza a könyvet.

A fordításon kívül ezeket a tevékenységeket a kiadók szokták elvégeztetni és finanszírozni, de ebben az esetben ezt mind-mind én fogom megszervezni és megcsináltatni.

Az Indiegogo ahhoz ad felületet, hogy egy születőben, folyamatban lévő projektet az ötletgazda bemutathasson, és ezen keresztül találjon érdeklődőket, akik – általában – a termék előzetes megvásárlásával szavaznak bizalmat a projektnek, és egyben beszállnak az így már közösséginek nevezhető finanszírozásba.

Ha segítetek nekem a könyv előzetes megvásárlásával, kicsit enyhítetek az előfinanszírozási terheimen, hozzájárulásotokat pedig a megjelenés előtt átadott könyvekkel, kedvezményekkel és exkluzív ajándékok felajánlásával hálálom meg. A lap jobb szélén felsorolt csomagokból tudtok válogatni.

A vásárláshoz nem kell regisztrálni, illetve eldönthetitek, hogy a kampány publikus oldalán a támogatók között fel legyen-e tüntetve a nevetek, vagy sem.

 

Ha csak egy könyvet olvastok el az űrhajózásról, miért ez legyen az?

A mostanában megjelenő könyvek nem ennyire átfogóak: az Első ember csak Neil Armstrongról szól, a Rakétaemberek csak az Apollo–8-ról. Gene Kranz viszont mesél a hőskorról, a Mercury-programról, a kezdeti kudarcokról, a szovjetekkel folyó rivalizálásról, az első emberes fellövésekről, az Irányítóközpont munkájáról és a Gemini-programon keresztül fordul rá az Apollo-küldetésekre. Ráadásul az Első ember egyik megnevezett forrása éppen Kranz könyve.

 

Beleolvasnátok?

Íme, egy néhány oldalas betekintő:

Mit kockáztattok?

Remélhetően semmit. Hacsak nem esik a fejemre egy tégla, akkor a fordítással januárig elkészülök, utána a nyomdai előkészítés és kivitelezés már nálam sokkal profibb szakemberek kezében lesz, és március közepéig, még a Holdra szállás 50-ik évfordulója előtt megszületik a magyar kiadás. És természetesen ti kapjátok meg az első példányokat.

 

Az Esti Hírlap

Néhány megvásárolható csomag része az Esti Hírlap a Holdra szállásról tudósító számának újranyomása. Az eredeti példányt még 1969-ben - az én születésem után néhány nappal - apukám tette el, aki mérnökemberként lelkes rajongója volt a kor technikai kutatási eredményeinek. Az ő gyűjteményéből kölcsönöztem ki az újságot, melynek rövidített változatát most egy kedves nyomdász barátom segítségével újranyomjuk. A tudósításokon kívül lesznek benne korabeli sporthírek, műsorok és hirdetések is.

 

Miért USD-ben kell fizetni?

Az Indiegogo rendszere Magyarországról csak USD fizetést engedélyez, ezért vannak dollárban beállítva az árak. Maga a fizetés az online felületeken megszokott biztonságos bankkártyás módszerrel történik, a napi árfolyamon számított forint összeget vonják le a kedves vásárlók számlájáról. A beérkezett összegeket a kampány időszak lezártával az Indiegogo a saját jutalékának levonása után juttatja el nekem. 

Updatekkel rendszeresen jelentkezem majd.

Köszönöm a bizalmat, a támogatást, a megosztásokat; és WORLDPEACE.

Kuti Zoltán, Budapest, 2018 november 5.

story:
Short Summary

This story has not yet been told. How was the very first Football Manager game created. - The one that defined the game format and started the genre of Football Manager games. This book details the history and creation of the very first Football Manager game, published by Addictive Games.

I am Kevin Toms, the creator and programmer of the game and founder of Addictive Games,  and this story contains many never before revealed details of the creation of a number 1 selling game, launched first in 1982, and it in its original form, -still beloved by many. 

Topics in The Origin of Football Manager Book

Just some of the topics covered are:

  • 1967, the deep roots of the game 
  • Discovering it was Addictive
  • The board games that were the first versions
  • Why each element of the game is built the way it is
  • The little flat where Football Manager was created. 
  • Milton Keynes, the birthplace of Football Manager 
  • The psychology that had an impact 
  • The 2 board games that inspired the game 
  • Every game software house was a newbie 
  • NO retail shops for games! 
  • How the first ad was designed? 
  • The influence of cereal packets ..
  • The 3rd game influence 
  • 99 to continue - why? 
  • Fun before simulation 
  • Marketing lessons from living in London 
  • Video Genie- What a waste of money 
  • Practising games design 
  • Making games rules 
  • My first computer game development 
  • Oh My! The ZX81! 
  • There was a mainframe trial 
  • Open University 
  • 8000 per year 
  • The first 300 
  • Orders through the mail 
  • Board games and ball games, it was a habit 
  • Throwball- the game that stuck 
  • 92 packages, this must change...  
  • I couldn’t drive 
  • Jimmy and his no wipers car 
  • Those ZX Microfairs. 
  • There was nothing like it 
  • How did the Bournemouth move come about? 
  • Iterations of the Addictive logo 
  • Please can I do this as a career? 
  • and much more..

 

What I need and what you get

The funds raised will be used for graphics design, illustrations, editing, and print runs for the book. 

What you will get is a signed copy of the book in the format you choose. (Even if you choose the ebook you will receive a signed certificate).

The Impact

The direct impact of your contribution is that the book will be published and the story of the creation of Football Manager will be told. 

Other ways you can help

If you are an editor or have experience in book publishing and want to help this project along, please get in contact.

If you are graphics artist with experience of book covers, or illustrations please get in contact.

One Final note:-

I renewed the game with a mobile/laptop version

Late 2015 I suggested online I could renew the game for mobiles. The strong response encouraged me to start that project and the result was Kevin Toms Football Star* Manager for iOS, Android, Windows, Mac OSX and Kindle Fire

This game has the same gameplay as the original with modernised match highlights. Players are enjoying hundreds of seasons on this game, and apart from being fun, and easy to use anywhere (wifi is not essential), it is also nostalgic, bringing back memories of times playing my original Football Manager game.

The book will tell you how the original game was written and this new game version will let you re-live those times.

The game, all 5 formats, is here:

https://blog.kevintoms.com/play-football-star-manager/

story:
Short Summary

If you're not familiar with my work as a forensic historian and conceptual artist over the past decade, click this link to see a short video introducing the value of my productions. You can click here to see my IMDB profile. To screen the 10-minute sample of my interview with Department of Justice whistleblower and author John Loftus click here.

I've dedicated my life to producing educational content about the ongoing agenda of "The New World Order" because it hurts me to see people being taken advantage of by predatory interests currently in control. I continue doing what I do because I constantly see results and feedback that my research enriches the lives of my audience.

  • I produce educational content to inspire Cognitive Liberty and to embolden Individual Freedom. Freedom is essential to happiness, and when society seeks to punish individuals - Freedom is the first thing they take away.
  • I'm publishing a book on the world's foremost international banking family because the general public is unaware of who controls the purse-strings on our society. I recently wrote the foreword for Sean Stone's book "New World Order: A Strategy of Imperialism", which motivated me to finish up my own book project which I've been chipping away at for a few years now.
  • I'm also in the process of conducting filmed interviews with whistleblowers and authors who risk their lives exposing how our world really works. Why? Because it needs to be done, and I have the work-ethic and cognitive acumen to do the job right.
  • I co-wrote and was featured in the documentary "State of Mind: The Psychology of Control" in 2013 which was distributed by InfoWars.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's my offer of quid-pro-quo / I'm not asking for a handout, I work hard, and I'll trade you my productions for your hard earned income:

  • I'm raising funds to finish my book "The Truth About the Rothschilds: A Manual of Resources and References Pertaining to the Rothschild Family Banking Dynasty", the funds will be used to finish the remaining chapters (which I've spent the past year researching), proof-read, create the index, and get the first edition into print and to the public.
  • Concurrent to finishing the book, I'm also seeking to produce my next filmed interview for my "Future of Freedom" documentary project, and the costs of production include (but not limited to) location expenses, travel, crew fees, post-production editing, and sound mastering. I do most of the work myself, but when I'm short on time and have the funds I do like to pay professionals to help me attain the highest levels of production value - the audience appreciates it.
  • As far as what you get- it's a combination of past productions & exclusive art and subscriber only content, as well as access to the various versions of the book, the next filmed interview, and my attitude of gratitude.
  • My perks/thank you gifts for contributors aren't reliant on my reaching the total goal for this fundraiser - I always figure out how to get things done regardless - and most of the perks are independent of the fundraiser so if I only raise a % of the goal you'll still win and be satisfied.

The Impact

The concept of individual liberty is in jeopardy, not just here in America, but all across the planet. Contributing to the educational resources I generate will help enrich the lives of others - last year individuals from 186 countries viewed my productions - where else can you achieve such reach for such a reasonable price? (...and you get perks!)

  • I focus on methodologies of freedom rather than ideologies of control.
  • I've funded my film productions over the past 12 years with individual fundraisers just like this, I've always exceeded my goals and over-delivered to my audience.
  • There's no risk, just reward... the perks are all worth more than my asking price.

Risks & Challenges

Earlier this year I became a father, which has presented the challenge of having enough time to meet my expectations of productivity - the balance to this is that I'm even more motivated to do the best I can to explore, research, and produce the highest level of quality content... and it keeps getting easier the more I apply myself.

  • I realize that there are always "unknowns" and "challenges" to any project, and knowing this I consistently improvise, adapt, and overcome because failure is not an option when it comes to defending Cognitive Liberty and Individual Freedom.

Summary

My daughter, Meghan, was diagnosed with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma in 9/2007 and passed 9 months later 7/2008, at the age of 13.

The above video is of her during take off on our flight to Phoenix seeking medical treatments.  (The music you hear is Meghan on the steel guitar, accompanied by her Poppy, during a practice session when she was 10).

My potential backers, I am leaning on you for your help to self publish a book in print form.  We want to remember Meghan in all her glorious details, and share our memories of her with you through our journal entries and her own writings.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart,                                                                                                                   Meghan's mom

 

DIVINE APPOINTMENTS

(journal entry 6/20/2008)

"Hello. For those that are not aware, Meghan was diagnosed in September with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma. It is a rare, aggressive and cowardly disease, attacking children mostly in the age range of 3-10.  Approximately 200 cases in US are diagnosed each year and over 90% will die within 18 months of diagnosis. Surgery is not an option because of the location (Pons area which controls basic vital functions) and the diffuse nature of the tumor (infiltrated into normal cells). In almost all cases, it's not even biopsied because the risks outweigh the benefits. Conventional medicine is offering us limited options and very little hope, forcing us to incorporate and turn to alternative methods. There is no cure for DIPG, conventional or otherwise. There's only the hope of buying time. Days, months, and hopefully, years. And living with acceptable quality of life.

People tell me they admire my strength in keeping my family strong through this. But it is  Meghan that's moving us forward. Last week was a very bad week for us and the closest I've been to despair since September.  As I bent down to tie her shoelaces, I started crying, thinking of the things, big and small, this disease is taking from her. She reached down and patted my head, and reassured me, and told me that everything will be alright. She's an incredibly giving person and how blessed am I to be her mom?! 

And so we are in Arizona. With our cats, Bonnie and Clyde (Meghan loves people's reactions when she tells them their names) and Ginger Rogers three! We were able to bring the cats onto the cabin as carry-ons.  We had to pay $100 each. Ginger is too big to be considered carry-on and so I had the doctors write a letter stating that Ginger is needed as an emotional support dog.  She sat on Meghan's lap and performed her job beautifully.

I am attaching the clip of Meghan during take off. It's the first time on a plane for her and Isabel. It's been about 12 years since Santo and I flew. The loud meowing you hear is Clyde, the big baby. So, that's it for now. Please forward this to anyone that may be interested in our progress. Keep us, and all the DIPG families, in your thoughts and prayers. Especially me. I pray for strength." 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding is needed for a cover design and to edit, format, publish and market the book.          What you receive in return depends on the perk you select.

 

Risks & Challenges

There is always the risk of unexpected challenges, resulting in the book not getting published.  But I assure you that with your help, I will do everything I can to bring this project to fruition and make my Meghan proud.

story:
We are: New Fairy Tales!


Hi Readers!

Once upon a time, I worked at the Library in my hometown for a span. There I discovered some excellent literature coming out for children about LGBT relationships. These were things like "Sarah Has Two Daddies!" which teaches children how to deal with their confusion or how to explain non-traditional parents. 

What I didn't see were books where the characters happen to be gay....and that isn't the plot point of the book. It isn't the problem, or a thing that needs to be overcome. Nowhere was gay shown as just..normal.

Dealing with our troubled feelings about change is an important part of growth, yet there comes a time when calling things to attention merely highlights it as Other. In light of this, the goal of NFT is to portray characters who just so happen to be LGBT. 

In addition, we'll will portray sensitive and caring men, powerful women, relationships built on trust, people of color in positions of power, integration of cultures, attractiveness not being automatically positive or redeeming and more. 

The more I write, the more I realize...there's a lot to do to bring classic Fairytales into the 21st century!


So Here's The Breakdown:

The format will be a short children's illustrated chapter book.

Caya Berndt has joined me as the artist that will bring this vision to life. She believes in the message and has the heart to bring it across.

Cinderella, the first book, is completely written and the main character concepts are drawn. Caya needs time to bring the art to life, as well as art materials($200). 

Once completely finished, we will need to pay for an editing service($30-$40/hour) and we will need to pay for a formatting service ($45-$85/hour). 

Before it goes to mass print, we intend to send the book in digital format to a (TBD) cultural group to check out how we did on not being accidentally racist. (We understand our privilege of being two white chicks, and we want these books to feel welcoming for everyone).

There's also: copyrighting and registering costs, travel and lodging to send Amanda around the Northwest shopping the book and also, a website for the New Fairy Tales business and a content map/plan for six months.  

Then finally, it's the cost of printing and distribution and away we go! (Printing will be about $1500 per 100 if printed from bookbaby, but we are going to try to get it cheaper!)


The Impact

LGBT youth suffer pain and violence at an astonishing rate. 

According to info from Youth Risk Behavior Surveys done during 2001‒2009, the percentage of LGBT students  who were threatened or harmed with a weapon on school property ranged from 12% to 28%. Not to mention...

  • 19% to 29% of gay and lesbian students and 18% to 28% of bisexual students experienced dating violence in the previous year.
  • 14% to 31% of gay and lesbian students and 17% to 32% of bisexual students had been forced to have sexual intercourse at some point in their lives.
  • LGTBTQ youth are also at increased risk of suicidal thoughts and attempts. Queer kids are more than twice as likely to attempt suicide than their straight peers. One study also showed that an astonishing 25% of transgender youth had attempted suicide. 
Our children are dying. Our children are hurting. They are hurting because they feel like they are different, somehow less than, their heterosexual peers. They deserve to see their own stories reflected in media. They deserve our time and our art. 


Risks & Challenges

There are several challenges with this project:

  • Social pressure: This campaign and the subsequent art and books will undoubtedly be protested by strong objectors that will attempt to ban us from libraries and schools. 
  • Printing costs: Without printing in bulk, the costs are much higher. 
  • Distribution and networking: We need to get the word out for this project. 
  • Is it gonna be any good?
Let's take these challenges one at a time.
Social pressure: It is critical that people are willing to stand up for what they believe in, especially in defense of their children. This project and these artists WILL NOT back down in the face of adversity, so don't worry about that. 

Printing costs: Currently the cost of printing is estimated at what we consider to be our maximum selling cost. $15/book is even higher than we want to go. We want this literature to be affordable. I believe that by having a large support network from this campaign, we will have the negotiating power to drive down our costs to a more reasonable level. 

Distribution and networking: Amanda runs fantasy/sci-fi literature conventions in her spare time and has worked with the city libraries in her area. She has created a network of contacts that can help her get the word out on this project, effectively leaping over the exposure challenge.

Is it gonna be any good: Caya's art, demonstrated here, is an example of the quickie sketches that she worked up in her free time. She is an art student at Spokane Community College and has been accepted to the Savannah College of Art and Design. Amanda is an experienced writer with credits in National Indie magazines, both fiction and non-fiction. Together they have the experience and passion to make a product that we can all be proud of. 


Who the Heck are You?

...and what makes you think you can do a good job? 

I am Amanda Baldwin and I have had short stories and articles published in independent magazines for about three years now. I have done work writing boring things like training manuals and instructions for business practices, as well as managing social media presences for many small businesses. I have also done MCing and interviews for people like Wendy and Richard Pini(Elfquest), Kaja Foglio (Girl Genius), and voice actor Chuck Huber (Andriod 17). 
I also happen to have lots of connections among fantasy/sci fi conventions in the Northwest area and once the books are finished, I have connections to help me broadcast the signal and make them more likely to be a success. I am also the founder and acting President of the Northwest Nerd Alliance, a group dedicated to redefining an inclusive definition of what being a nerd/geek/dork means. 
With capabilities in social media and online marketing, my writing skills, experience in advocacy and pre-existing connections, I think this book has a good chance of success! 

Caya Berndt is an incredible artists who's concept work that you see throughout this page speaks for itself. I had a heck of a time finding the right artist for this project. Some were offended, others were simply not the passionate hearts who believed in this work. 
Caya has been drawing since she was a wee lass, and she is largely self taught. Her style is flexible and deft, inspired by by sequential art, comics, 90s animation, and classical illustrators like Chris Van Allsberg and Bill Watterson. Subtle character aspects that were imbued through writing she has brought to life, better than ever imagined. A newly accepted student of Savannah College of Art and Design, she is the right lady for the job and with her talent, we can tackle this critical undertaking to leave a positive legacy for our children. 

Caya likes cats and is an accomplished Jazz Soloist.

Alexandra Baldwin is a real life five year old with enough sass to spare. She is a Sci-fi convention costume contest winner for her rendition of the 10th Doctor and a lover of Fantasy, Sci-fi, books, and Princesses. Her favorite color is everything and her favorite TV show is My Little Pony. Lexi will serve as our product tester. As a genuine five year old fantasy lover, she is well qualified. You should know that she has read the stories and thinks they're awesome, so you can take that to the bank!


Stretch Goals! 

If we exceed our goals, the first thing we will be is SUPER DUPER excited. Next, we will rally ourselves for more awesomeness! 

$7,000
We can do a round of hardback copies too! We all know kidlets are hard on their books! At this level, Caya and Amanda will record podcasts and videos documenting their creative process.

$9,000
Caya and Amanda will be able to dedicate more of their time to creating the next two tales: Rose and Thorn and Voice of the Sea. We also will be able to donate copies to local school and public libraries to make this literature more accessible.

15,000
Printing costs for the next two books are covered! Travel and book donations will expand their reach!

25,000
If there is this much interest in this project, we'll open New Fairytales as an NPO that will produce LGBT and other diverse stories. Hiring for new artists and story writers will begin, as well as possible collaboration for Young Adult stories, comic books and more.


Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't give any money, doesn't mean you can't help! BOOST THE SIGNAL! Share share share. Tell your friends, your colleagues, people on the street. Knowledge is power!

story:
Short Summary

Wow, thank you for taking your time to visit this site and learn more about my Indiegogo Campaign.  I appreciate any, and all of your contributions, to support the launch of my new book Tell Me So I Know.

My name is Paul Shike and I am the author of Tell Me So I Know. I attended Indiana University from 1977 - 1981 and currently reside in Dallas, TX. I have recently launched Graceful Publishing to publish and promote my wonderful new book, Tell Me So I Know. 

Tell Me So I Know is an interactive guide with over 550 questions to lead you through the interview process to learn about the life story, favorite things, memories, and advice of someone special to you. My goal is to provide a fun and simple way for you to learn more about those you love, and have a place to record and save this information.  This book will certainly enrich your relationship with those you choose to engage in this process.

I was inspired to create this book by two significant events in my life. The first was the unexpected loss of my father and the second is witnessing the impact of Alzheimer’s on my Grandmother and my Aunt. 

I have come to realize after my father's death, that I have many questions about him and his life experiences. Almost daily, I find myself wondering about some question I wish I knew about him. Driven by the emotions from wishing I knew more about his life, I decided I wanted to help others to avoid these same feelings. 

Witnessing the impact of Alzheimer’s on both my Grandmother and my Aunt was an inspiration for my writing. It seemed as if overnight, this horrible disease stole their memories. It is difficult to experience a loved one losing their ability to remember and share their memories. I wish I had taken the time to know more about their life story.

According to the 2015 Alzheimer’s Disease Facts and Figures, Alzheimer’s & Dementia 2015 study that was published by the Alzheimer’s Association (www.alzheimers.org), it is stated that 5.1 million Americans suffer from Alzheimer’s, with 1 in 9 persons over age 65 and 1 in 3 over 85 affected by this disease.
 


What We Need & What You Get

I have now completed the preliminary writing, editing, layout and drafts of the cover design of this book. I have brought this project to the 5-yard line and need your help to push it over the goal line.  Your participation by selecting one of the Perks of this campaign, will help to bring this book to market, and make it available for those wanting to know more about the special people in their life.  

 Your support will be used to help:

  • Finalize the cover design, book editing and layout. 
  • Printing the first run editions of the book.
  • Printing and shipping of the review copies for the media.
  • Design and production of the POS materials. 
  • Implement marketing programs to support the launch of the book. 

I am asking for your help with these final steps by:

  • Making a contribution by selecting a Perk to support this project.
  • Writing a book review when you receive your copy.
  •  Spreading the word about my Indiegogo Camapign. 
  • Sharing the Tell Me So I Know Facebook page and website.
As a pre-launch supporter there is an assortment of Perks, including: 
  • Signed first edition copies of the book
  • Special recognition on the Tell Me So I Know website
  • Special edition copies of the book with a custom printed recognition page for promotional use

The Impact

Think about how great you will feel, as someone special to you shares their life stories and memories with you. Embrace this book and utilize this process with all the important people in your life. Don't wait, seize the opportunity to gather this information first-hand . 

In going through this book with my mother, I now know about her first kiss, the first time she met my father,  and many of the special memories she has of her parents and grandparents. Seeing her smile was priceless, as she told the story of when as a little girl, she and her sister sold dirt as pepper to the neighbors for 10 cents a jar. 

Many times, as I would ask a question, my mother would go and get a picture or piece of memorabilia, that was part of the story she was telling me. It was a wonderful way to learn of her experiences and stories. Without this book,  I would have never known about these stories.

Thank you for coming to this site and checking out "what's happening" with my book.  If you are not able to participate in this program, please spread the word about the upcoming launch of the book. You can share the following links to my INDIEGOGO campaign , the TellMeSoIKnow.com website and ask your friends to like my Tell Me So I Know Facebook page.

story:
Short Summary

Sadie is a mongrel... a mutt... a MESS! After Sadie is rescued from the local shelter, she finds a home with the Kramer's; a loving family of three; and that's when life gets really interesting.

Big Mouth is Sadie's arch-nemesis. A tall, plastic, greedy fellow that lives in the kitchen and gets all the good food that Sadie wants. Join Sadie on her adventures of learning about the world, food, jealousy, fear, and most of all love.

This is only the beginning of Sadie's adventures! "Sadie Vs. Big Mouth" is the first in a series of books that will answer some of kids' common questions like "If my family loves me, why don't they let me do or have what I want?" and "If I'm scared of something, why do I have to be brave?"

What We Need

Sadie is an ebook already (on sale at Amazon, B&N, and Smashwords) and so what we're looking to do from here is to make it more official and get printed. Depending on how much we raise is how much we can do. The eventual goal is to be able to donate copies to humane societies and schools to teach kids valuable lessons.

  • At $300 we can afford to purchase all of the ISBN's we need to distribute the book legally and get the ebook on more websites.
  • At $1000 we can do that as well as complete the marketing supplies we need like business cards, stickers, ads on Facebook, etc. Basically we can generate a good buzz about the book so that if people buy the ebook, we can use THAT money to print.
  • At $3500 we can print a first run of 150 copies of the book to get started. We'll donate about 50 of these to high profile people (celebrities and such who will tweet about it, spread the word, etc) and the other 100 will be sold to try to make enough to print more copies.
  • At $5500 we can print 300 copies and get it in some local stores here in SC and donate to libraries and schools.
  • Of course anything beyond this will just be expanding the territory in which we can distribute.

What You Get

Everyone who gives $2 or more will get a copy of the eBook. That makes it a 99cent savings from purchasing it online. Unfortunately we cannot offer very many fancy rewards other than the ebook which is already done, because unless we raise enough to print, we won't have a book at all to offer. What we can say is that if we surpass our goal, we will be trying to get a little something in the mail to you guys. We promise we'll do as much as we can because we appreciate your support so greatly!

Risks and Challenges

Well, this is our third fundraising project launched and so a challenge is to raise enough funds to make this happen. The last times though we were trying to raise enough for a full printing run. This time we have different levels of things we can achieve with just parts of the money (we mistakenly used Kickstarter the other times, so we got none of the money). We won't forget the people who backed us the first 2 times around and we look forward to sending Sadie into your lives and the lives of the children you know! 
There is really no risk involved for YOU. the backers, because the book is already written and illustrated completely and we are very responsible, dependable, and punctual people, so as soon as we hit each level, we'll be moving along!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • PLEASE get the word out and make some noise about Sadie!
  • There are some share tools on here that can be used.
  • Every little bit does help, even a dollar or two.
  • THANK YOU!!!

story:
About Us

There is a well known saying that, "Sticks and stones may break your bones, but WORDS can never hurt you."  But if you are over five years old,  you probably know that this is simply not true.  Words can hurt!  Words can also heal!  Words can create!!  Think about it?  Everything you see around you and many of the things you use started off as words!!!  Your cellphone, at some point in time it was an idea that was put into words and was brought into being by words. First the words or idea were shared with someone by their creator, perhaps with a friend.  From there perhaps to a designer, then an engineer and finally those words in the form of a blue print were given to the manufacturer.  And now you hold in your hand the final result of those words, …. a cellphone.

My name is Vincent Ivory and I am the creator and author of Word World.  I am a husband, father, screenwriter, author, poet and filmmaker. I have enjoyed words and writing poetry since I was 6 years old.  I have worked as a writer, videographer, editor and in screenwriting in one form or another for over 18 years.   Anyone and everyone who knows me will tell you I am a big believer in words and the power of words to build people and things up, to them tear down and to affect every aspect of our life and our world.   Word World is an exciting and unique sci-fi novel about a research physicist named Jerry Jergensen who discovers a parallel world where everything is created and controlled by spoken words.  After this discovery is revealed to the government and then the world, a mass exodus ensues to the new world as people seek utopia.   But the ease and benefits of the new world are accompanied by difficulty and tragedy as people struggle to adapt to the unique laws and language barrier, proving perfection has a price.  The story has mystery, international intrigue and implications, danger, sabotage, government conspiracies, military, young people, seasoned people, love and all the elements for an intriguing and entertaining story line and movie.  


Be 1 of Us

The  word JOURNEY is defined as an act of traveling from one place to another.  

I have titled my campaign Ready 2 Take A Journey because I am asking for more than just a contribution.  I am asking each of you to go on a journey with me not just for the book but for the film as well.  I'm asking you to go all the way with me on this journey.  We are going to raise at least $9750 for the initial creation of the book Word World as well as the accompanying website which will allow us to provide progress reports, pics and backer updates for you our contributors.  I call you our "MADE IT HAPPEN" team!!!  

We have exciting perks from ebooks  to T-Shirts to Word World swag bags.  We are also offering original music that has already been produced for the  soundtrack for the movie (the music is pretty funk too if I do say so myself). You can also get Word World mugs and autographed copies of all my previously released poetry books.  There is also a limited number of perks that allow you to be named as a character in the book and to receive an autographed copy of the first part of the Word World screenplay upon which the book is based before the book and film are released!!!  So come along on this journey with us, have fun doing it and in the process, you may even become a little more mindful of the words that you use each day.   

                                                           


How Will the Money Be Used by Us

  • Writing, Conversion  & Editing Fees, 
  • Website, Artist & Marketing Fees
  • Printing & Binding 
  • Perks & Associated Cost
  • Shipping Cost
  • Indiegogo & Processing Fees
  • Taxes
 In the likely event that we exceed our goal, those funds will be used for additional marketing for the book and for preproduction and development of the Word World movie.  We have already put together an excellent team in anticipation for the film, some of whom you will quickly recognize from forums like IMDB.com.  People like Karen Goulekas as our producer and VFX Supervisor.  Karen has over 30 years in the production and film business and is one of the best VFX supervisors on the planet.  You can see her work in movies like Titanic, True Lies, Spiderman, Green Lantern, Obsessed, Looper and Don Juan.   Andrew Dutton  as our Director of Photography – Andrew has worked as a cinematographer, first assistant camera, second assistant camera, and director of photography with over 25 years of experience in film and television.  Andrew previously wrapped cinematography work on the Fast & the Furious 7.  His resume speaks for itself.  Both Karen's and Andrew's resume/profiles can be viewed at http://KegFX.com, imdb.com or Stage 32.com.  We'll introduce other team members as things progress.


The Impact on Us

One of the first people whom I allowed to read the screenplay was one of my editors and my friend Lavonne.  After reading it one of the things that impacted her was after reading the project, she said that for days afterwards she found herself being 'mindful' and giving more thought to the words she used and spoke.  This impacted me because that was the goal of project and still is.  Not to control people but to have them make a conscious choice about the words they speak over themselves, their family, their career,  and desires, other people and basically their entire life.  This is the impact I desire for each of you.  I want to reemphasize that I desire and am asking you to come along with US for the entire journey.  This is not a one trick pony, we are going all the way.  We like to do things differently and don’t much care for normal.  Normally a book would be turned into a screenplay so that it can be turned into a movie.  We’re turning a finished screenplay into a book and then the movie.  We’re beginning with the end in mind.  We believe that this project will do more than just entertain you.  It will change how you use your words which will positively affect your life, career, family, relationships and all this while doing something we all love,…enjoying a great story.


Other Ways You Can Help Us

In the event that you cannot contribute financially, please don't feel left out.  Spread the word about the project and check back for updates.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks sooo much in advance for "being ONEOFUS!!!!!"

story:
The pitch

Scotland needs a confident and intelligent magazine which champions the nation without being tribal. With our traditional media in difficulty, Rattle fulfills the need for comment from across the spectrum, a celebration of our creative achievements and coverage of global issues.

Rattle pays its contributors, invests 80% of funds in content and supports Scottish talent. Writers such as Neal Ascherson, Kevin Pringle, Isabel Hilton, Alice Thomson, Alison Stroak, Chris Deerin, Ruaridh Nicoll, Malcom Fraser among many others will contribute.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £60,000 to run the magazine for a year, meaning we can pay the industry rate of £300 per article. Over that year we will build up subscriptions to ensure long term success.

Many websites and papers rely on free content, resulting in a lower standard of content and the erosion of an independent media.

You get daily online articles across the range of current affairs and culture from established and new writers investigating Scotland driven by intelligent editing.

An advisory board will oversee the financial and editorial strategy - this will be all-women in a bid to correct the male bias in Scotland's media.

There is a five year commitment to this project.

To begin around 2,000 people need to subscribe - allowing for the different rates of subscription.

Every penny over that translates as more articles, podcasts and members' events.

When we reach 5,000 we will produce a print edition.

80% of funds will be spent on commissions, 20% on editorial and production.

Ultimately Rattle will be handed over to a trust to protect independent journalism from Scotland in perpetuity.

    The Team

    Rattle has been developed by Alex Bell with the invaluable help of Stewart Kirkpatrick.

    Rattle is thankful to the many who have contributed thoughts, amongst them Susan Morrison, Susan Deacon, Alex Black, Nicola McEwan, Marilyn Imrie, Russell Henderson, Richard Neville of the Courier, Ellis Watson of DC Thomson, Ben Thomson, Charlotte Street Partners and Sir Angus Grossart. The magazine is independent of all these supporters.

    Alex Bell worked for the BBC, The Herald and the Observer before founding allmediascotland.com. He was Head of Policy to Alex Salmond, the former First Minister and is known for his independent views.

    Click on the site now for a taste of what Rattle will be like: www.rattle.scot

    Risks & Challenges

    We will launch no matter the total funds raised here, in the belief that quality journalism will attract subscribers

    Funds will immediately translate into content - we don't have capital costs to meet.

    Rattle is for you - it can only exist if you donate now.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know the audience exists for Rattle, but they need to know Rattle exists.

    • Please tweet and retweet about Rattle's existence
    • Use the Indiegogo's share tools to let people know about Rattle.

    Thank you

story:
Inspired by the type of kid’s book I’ve never seen, and in homage to the ones I wish existed, comes a story about a thought and how we respond to them, from the perspective of a head of lettuce.

Written and illustrated in a children’s book style, carrying a unique message some might think fit only for an older mind (i disagree), we ponder the experience of choices, and the truth of expectations.

It’s called  Harsh Realities:  A Head of Lettuce. 

Paired with a custom printed CD of 5 atmospheric and ethereal instrumental songs by 5 of the most ridiculously talented and forward thinking producers in the underground rap and beat scene, it's intended to be heard both as individual songs while reading, and as a complete 5 part piece on its’ own, the music, through its’ journeys, creates a world outside the pages where the Head of Lettuce lives in each of us, and we can maybe see some of ourselves in it.

At least for me it does.  But then again, I’m the one who wrote a story about a Head of Lettuce.  At its worst, maybe, the CD just provides some dang amazing music for you to experience which you may never have.  Both are equally acceptable outcomes for me.

To help cushion the cost of printing the book I'm essentially "pre-selling" copies of the book.  I need about $500 to get the physical copies made, along with the CD's printed.  I'm selling them for $10 a piece.  Your contribution of $10 guarantees you a first run copy of the book when they're printed (within roughly 1 month of the end of the campaign, or sooner if it goes crazy well).  I can sign the copy if you'd like, but really my signature is just a scribble and a circle, not at all amazing, and also, who am I that you need me to scribble on a thing you've bought?   Anyway, I'll pay the cost of shipping it to you, because, well, thanks for being into this.  If you're a person interested in buying a quantity to resell yourself, I've got an option for a discounted price by volume, otherwise I'm just asking for a $10 trade per copy.  It'll be paperback.   I intend for this to be the first in a series of books, all under the heading of Harsh Realities.  The next one might be about an Eyebrow.

Tell a friend, and thanks for being curious.

Music by:  Glen Porter, Maker, 2econd Class Citizen, Edison, Dj Signify

story:
It's all I ever wanted to do - write. Now, having just completed my first book of short stories, Small Lives, Big World which will be published by Troubador at the end of the year, I have started work on, From Gwynedd to Greenland, a comic novel set in Greenland about a Welsh civil servant and some less than civil sheep!

I have been invited to teach English as a volunteer in Greenland next year but I lack the funds to get there and stay for three months. My accommodation is being provided but as an ESL teacher, funds are limited.

You can help by buying an advance copy of Small Lives, Big World and donating to my fund to get to Greenland next year. This would not only get me to Greenland, it would give me time to write full-time.

http://www.troubador.co.uk/book_info.asp?bookid...

Any contribution is hugely appreciated and very welcome indeed!

Thank you!

Richard

story:
When I shot this group breastfeeding portrait in June of this year, I had no idea of the great response I would get, and I loved working with all the beautiful families involved.

 Included was a mom who bottle-fed her baby donated breast milk, a mom who tandem nursed, moms of newborns and toddlers. 

 I've since been asked to shoot more group shots, as well as solo ones. I'm shooting the group sessions at no charge and the solo sessions with a small retainer ($50 versus my regular portrait fee of $225 and $400) and would like to thank them all (past and future subjects) by being able to provide them each with a 12x18 in. archival print (different than the poster listed in the perks) of the group portrait from the session(s) they participate in.

With each session shot, I hear more and more ideas of what needs to happen with this series- it started with a show, then a book, now a show AND a book. I'm humbled by the amazing response, but also a mom who's finances primarily start and stop with the needs of my children. So here I am, asking for you to join these amazing women, their children and I!

What I Need & What You Get

 Some of the perks for donating are my undying gratitude!, posters, prints, signed copies of the book, even your own session to be used as for a nursing portrait, family session, head shot, and more!
I'm hopeful that I'll reach my goal to meet the initial print run. If, however, I do not meet this goal, my first responsibility is to provide those thank you prints to my subjects. Any additional funding left would go to the continuation of this portrait project- setting up a dedicated website and more shoots in anticipation of when the time comes that I can have a beautiful show.

The Impact

All the time, I'm hearing moms share their painful experience of being shamed for doing what comes natural to us. The relationship between mother and child shouldn't be cause for stigma, especially when the mother is providing the most basic need of nutrition for her child. I hope this series helps normalize breastfeeding because the more we share our journeys as breastfeeding moms and the more normal breastfeeding becomes in society and the less women will be shamed for it. Not having shame attached to something so natural contributes to a healthy emotional balance for mom, which will helps contribute to the bond between mother and child.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

And if you are unable to make a monetary donation at this time, please share our campaign with your social media circle so that we can spread the word to others who may be interested.

story:
"Authors and readers deserve better."

This simple statement encapsulates Semper Press's vision, goal and driving force. "Semper" means "always" in Latin, and this logic and ethos is built into everything we do. We always place authors and readers first with simple, transparent, favorable terms and reads that are comparable or superior in every aspect to the best of small e-publishing and Big 6 alike. As a reader and author, I sympathize and empathize with the struggles of both camps in trying to find great reads at a fair price, as well as trying to make a reasonable return on the investment authors make in terms of time and money to bring their work to market, promote it and benefit from it. By placing the interests of readers and authors above profits, Semper Press intends to become a go-to destination for readers and authors alike by offering genuine value to both camps.

Semper Press is not a vanity or subsidy publisher and NEVER charges authors for reading, editing, cover art , releasing, promotional efforts or any of our contractual services. PERIOD.

Authors

Our standard contract of 65% with a commitment of only one year from date of publication is unique in the industry and shows how highly we value our authors. We start with the rigorous three-step vetting process of a query letter, the first chapter, and then the finished manuscript. Right now we envision no more than 10% of all submissions making it through each step and to final publication. Our marketing plan is simple, direct and straightforward and offers authors more up-front and back-end promotional support than the competition, from the date of contract signing all the way through the lifetime of the book. Finally, our 65% split of gross royalties from our website and 65% of net from third parties makes Semper's author terms the best in the industry, bar none. We know without authors, we have no product, and so it's in our best interests to take care of our authors first and foremost and show them we really value them and their choice to publish with and thereby invest in us.

Readers

Readers want a great read that looks professional and comes to them at a fair price. That's not asking so much, is it? At Semper Press, we don't think so! We believe listening to readers is the best way to ensure we stay relevant and give readers what they want. One of the ways we're doing this is with our "Slush-Pile Angels" program, which lets readers take an active hand in the publishing process by choosing one manuscript each week to save from the slush pile.

Where does the money go?

Your contributions to Semper go to start-up expenditures like getting registered as a corporation in the state of Utah, obtaining legal and financial counsel to ensure we stay on the right side of the law, advertising, paying professional cover artists and copy editors to make sure the books look and read the best they possibly can.

What are the risks?

Every project involves risk, and Semper Press is no different. We are aware that we are breaking new ground and that it will likely take a little time to gain the momentum and credibility we want to see for our authors and for the company. For this reason, the project funding request includes six months of operational capital in addition to profits from the date of the first book going live, tentatively slated for January 1st, 2016. It also includes the various fees associated with IndieGoGo.

The challenges associated with this project right now are:

Lack of Utah business licensing and incorporation. This will be addressed immediately following the end of the campaign.

Need for aggressive promotion and advertising to attract both authors and readers. This can be overcome by engaging a content writing service to assist with our marketing and social media materials, and a professional website designer to give us a suitable online storefront. These services, Concierge Content Creation of St. George, Utah and Sweet Papaya Creative of Portland, Oregon, are already in place and ready to begin work as soon as funding is secured.

DMCA/copyright infringement: This is a perennial problem in the e-publishing world, and Semper Press is dedicated to fighting it vigorously and aggressively alongside our authors. Therefore, we will be proactive in installing DRM on our works and monitoring search engines for results that indicate our authors' work is being pirated. We will be diligent in taking civil and criminal action against online pirates, including cooperating fully with federal law enforcement to ensure those responsible pay for their theft.

Market inertia and opposition from other houses. The only practical solution to this is consistency, getting the word out, and time. The more high-end authors Semper can attract from the outside, the less time this will take.

Bottlenecks caused by too many submissions, resulting in delays in editing and cover art production. This can be overcome by engaging editorial staff and cover artists as necessary on a freelance basis to assist with overflow.

Who's in charge here?

As a published erotic romance author who has also self-published, I have made it my business to acquaint myself with the strengths and weaknesses of every house I have worked with. I have listened to authors and readers who complained about everything from the quality of the e-books and covers to the pricing to the income authors realize from their work. Therefore, I am familiar with not only what the industry is currently doing, but what it should be doing for its authors and readers. Semper Press intends to alleviate these pain points by taking a "long-haul" view of the business model rather than focusing on short-term gains.

Even the best advertising and most aggressive promotion does not guarantee success, but I believe that once readers and reviewers are afforded the opportunity to see what Semper Press brings to the table, we will become a go-to source for consistently great reads at a fair price and a great rate of return for authors.


Content created by Concierge Content Creation.

story:
Why?

America is at a crossroads: economy, instability, challenges, education, future... 

Today we have a candidate unlike any other in history, a candidate who truly understands the nature of leadership, a born pack-leader and alpha male, who can return our country to greatness and resurrect hope for the future. 

A lawyer, an advocate, philanthropist, small-business entrepreneur, devoutly religious, and a loving husband who grew up in America's heartiest heartland. 

As President, Nugget promises to make America better than ever.

Because Nugget has a 4-Point-Plan and a vision for America:

  1. All Pets Matter - No to anti-feline prejudice. Yes to supporting our K9 Police
  2. Civil Unions for Homo-sapians - Separate and Equal for different Lifestyles
  3. God-given right to bare teeth - No to overly-restrictive muzzle and leash laws
  4. Taxes: Pay Less, Get More - More Savings, More Governmenting

Next year, don't choose another soulless politician. Choose Nugget for President


Nugget NEEDS need a SUPER-PAC!!

Nugget needs your love, your nurturing, and your support. But most importantly, like all political candidates, Nugget needs your money. And lots of it.

Nugget needs your donations for serious and important reasons, such as:

  • Making stickers, buttons, magnets, tote bags, tshirts, hats, and lawn signs
  • Producing campaign commercials that can really tell Nugget's story
  • Overcoming anti-canine prejudice and getting Nugget on the ballot
  • Creating a campaign Super-PAC that can take unlimited corporate donations
  • Eventually take over the world, eventually.


Help Nugget make our America more America, again

As a grass-roots candidate, Nugget is not as well-connected or well-funded as the other major candidates. And that's why we need your help. 

Nugget needs campaign materials and television commercials that an disrupt the other candidates. But first of all, we must fight with everything we have to get Nugget's name on the ballot.

These goals may seem far fetched, but this is a game Nugget knows all too well. 

Even the smallest of contributions can make a difference. This is why we are asking for the minimum amount. All orders for stickers, buttons and tote bags will be honored no matter what.

As long as we receive at least $100, we will do something glorious.                          


Overcoming anti-Canine prejudice

Our team faces many obstacles that other more well-connected campaigns do not, such as:

  • Prejudice against canine candidates
  • Colorblindness
  • Not having opposable thumbs.

The Nugget team believes we can overcome every single one of these challenges because Nugget believes in Americans like you. 

Our opponents have already begun spreading rumors that Nugget has been caught eating out of the trash, drinking out of the toilet, and sitting on the couch when no one is in the room. 

Nugget's supporters know these claims and others like it to be absolutely libelous and entirely untrue.

Some have even asked Nugget, "why not start smaller? why not run for congress?"

For Nugget, this is a once-in-a-lifetime election.

Poor folks can help too!

Are you totally broke? Nugget understands. He is too.

That's why we are calling all artists and creative-types of all kinds to share their talents and help bring Nugget into the spotlight and into the hearts of all Americans.

Go ahead and contact us if you are willing to do any of these things:

  • Make posters or other things!
  • Think of ideas for slogans and stuff for Nugget to do!
  • Tell your friends about Nugget! 
  • Visit Nugget's homepage or find him on Facebook and Tumblr and Twitter

Thank you everyone. It is you, the voters who matter most. 

Together, we can make America more America again!

Because let's get real, every other candidate is a joke.

story:
Who am I...why help?

My name is Ashley Hutchison. I am 22 years old and I am blessed with many things in life and one of those things just happens to be writing. I am not here looking for fame and fortune - though, I'll admit...who would ever turn that down? - but there is nothing else on this planet I want to do. I have SO many stories I want to write and share with the world. The feeling I get when I read and fall in love with characters and story lines is all I want from my readers - that escape. I want to give that to people and I want people to get lost in my books for hours on end. I promise I won't disappoint: Along with Thorn of a Rose I have the sequel, as well as, 12 other books started and 32 sitting comfortably on the back burner. 

Re-Launch: Why I need you!

I am here because I am aiming to re-launch the first book of my Blood Curse Trilogy: Thorn of a Rose. Thorn of a Rose is a Sci-Fi, Fantasy novel aimed toward young adults as well as adults alike. I started Thorn of a Rose when I was 13. I've scratched it and started over countless times as my story expanded and new ideas developed. Finally, I started and finished it when I was 18 and self-published it when I was 19. Silly me, I was so ecstatic at having a book published that I didn't take into account the marketing aspect. So here I am. I am ready to polish it up and re-launch it into the market with the necessary funds to promote it successfully for my readers.

$15,000!? That's a lot!

No, this is not a random number I pulled out of the air. I have a down payment on a small publishing package to lock in my much-more-expensive deal that - with your help - I will be able to upgrade to in order to obtain all my marketing needs.

Which include but aren't limited to:

  • Editorial Services - to make sure readers are ensured the best reading experience.
  • International Marketing: radio, TV, social media, ect.
  • Hollywood script: a team would collaborate a synopsis of my book to submit to Hollywood files and could be selected to become a movie someday - every authors' dream come true!

Book Overview: Don't let the title fool you!

In a post-apocalyptic world, where an evil entity by the name of Jorne reigns his baneful wrath for blood lust and domination, stirring up an unrelenting coalition between three of the world's most harmonious nations to sign a contract --allowing Jorne to unleash some of his influence onto the army known as the Jortori. This contract was specifically formed by three very powerful men, a representative from each country, to rule the Jortori army in Jorne's place. The majority of the human race found sanctuary among the stars --with a promise to one day return. Among the handful of those left behind is a young girl by the name of Aleta Rose. Aleta and the remaing population were forced to come out of hiding to learn what true innate abilities really are, and to begin a revolt against the Jortori in order to save their home. Valcan, a Jortori leader, launched a grueling attack on Aleta's village when she was eight. Aleta, being the only survivor from the tragedy, was forced to live in the wilderness in order to survive. After nine years of living in utter isolation, Aleta, and her two wolves, are faced with the heart-stopping news of the Jortori's return to her home land. When it can't seem to get much worse, she is taken to a hidden military base, concealed in the mountains. Scared and confused in her new surroundings, Aleta learns that this is no ordinary military base. Everyone is acting strange and treating her like some disease ridden animal. The secrets and lies pile on top of each other as Aleta isn't only forced to figure out what causes her panic episodes that paralyze her body in the midst of anger but just what kind of secrets are these people not telling her?
