"Don't shoot!" Fain ran in shouting. But it was too late, someone shot. Gun fire went off in rounds behind me so quickly that it was almost unison. I turned and looked down, Kale stood in the far corner of the room with his gun pointed directly at my head. I tilted my head at the three bullets floating in front of my face and shook my head with disappointment. I inhaled and exhaled, sending the bullets back in the direction they came. Kale dropped. Gave immediately left his post and bolted across the room toward Kale, sliding on his knees on approach. Stop. My heart skipped a beat and for a split second I felt a pang of guilt for the damage I've caused. But I quickly abolished the foreign feeling altogether. However, in that split second of being distracted I was knocked so hard with a force that sent me spiraling into a wall. As I sat up out of the ruble, Rayden was on me, forcing me back down with an animalistic hand at my throat. Ah, his ability. His face hovered just above mine and I starred up at him solemnly and calm. The white's of his eyes grew bright red and the veins in his neck and forehead protruded so far out of his skin that I could count his heart beat. He flared his nostrils as he blew hot air onto my face. 
"I should kill you right now," his voice came from deep within his chest, almost like a growl as his hand tightened around my neck, pushing against my wind pipe. I smiled up at him, 
"Do it." Though his face didn't show it, I could smell his fear and I drank it in like the greatest perfume the world had to offer. This time, he actually growled as his other hand came up to strike me. Then he was gone. 
Fain was there in a flash yanking him off by the back of his shirt and throwing him on the ground. "Control your self!" He yelled down at Rayden, who did nothing but give him a pissed off glare. Blood trickled down his right forearm, pooling up on the ground beneath his dripping fingers. He forced his attention off of Fain and toward his wounded arm. I rose up behind Fain, smiling at myself for the plan I had in mind for him. Trying not to be too amused by the turned tables. Then pain suddenly erupted in my right shoulder and I collapsed to my knees. I watched my blood spill onto the floor in front of me until I could see the shine of my glowing ice, blue eyes starring back at me in the reflection. Intrigued, I dipped my finger tips in the blood and curiously rubbed my fingers together, feeling the warm sensation against my ice cold skin. I sat up, starring at my fingers, fascinated. Then I heard a click and looked up to find the barrel of Sarge's gun starring me in the face. I smiled. 
"Knock it off," Sarge yelled, cold cocking me in the back of the head with the handle of his gun. I fell forward to the palm of my hands again and more blood splurged out of my shoulder, splattering onto the floor and the side of my cheek. Rage surged through me and I titled my head up until I could make eye contact with him. He made a poor decision. A poor decision with poor consequences. I lifted my hand up and Sarge's gun flew into the wall to our left causing a random bullet to be shot. It went flying into precarious directions - with a mortal at each corner of the room. I pushed myself back onto my knees, feeling light headed and weak. I assessed my wound - which was still bleeding profusely. So I lifted my hand to apply pressure before I bled out. He didn't hit anything vital but I assume he, ignorantly, did that on purpose. I grabbed onto the side of the broken wall with my free hand and pulled my heavy body to it's feet. Fain was there trying to assist and I flung my hand out to push him away. But he didn't go. So I shrugged him off and stumbled forward. Losing more blood with every step. Rayden stood up to block my path but I saw his eyes flicker to something behind me and he stepped aside, grumbling. I turned in a slow circle, looking for my next target when I saw Gave still knelt at Kale's side looking just as weak as ever. He stood up once he noticed my gaze was on him and he backed into a defensive stance in front of Kale's body as I swayed and stumbled in his direction. I could feel blood trickling out of the corner of my mouth and I licked it away as I turned my lips upward into a smirk. 
"Time to play," I sang, stepping forward, blacking out with every other step as I lost more blood from the awkward movement. 
"Why are you doing this?" He asked. "What motivation is there behind it all?" 
"I don't need a motivation to make you all an example of my power." 
"We're on your side. We want to help you." 
"Help me? How in the hell can any of you morons help me with anything?" I laughed, coughing up more blood. 
"Aleta," Fain said oddly close behind me - of course. 
I spun on him, momentarily losing my balance. "I told you-" 
"I know your still there." I spun around to find Fain an inch away from my face, looking down at me with sadness shimmering in his eyes. "Look at yourself, this isn't who you are," he whispered softly.

Who am I...why help?
 My name is Ashley Hutchison. I am 22 years old and I am blessed with many things in life and one of those things just happens to be writing. I am not here looking for fame and fortune - though, I'll admit...who would ever turn that down? - but there is nothing else on this planet I want to do. I have SO many stories I want to write and share with the world. The feeling I get when I read and fall in love with characters and story lines is all I want from my readers - that escape. I want to give that to people and I want people to get lost in my books for hours on end. I promise I won't disappoint: Along with Thorn of a Rose I have the sequel, as well as, 12 other books started and 32 sitting comfortably on the back burner.    Re-Launch: Why I need you! I am here because I am aiming to re-launch the first book of my Blood Curse Trilogy: Thorn of a Rose. Thorn of a Rose is a Sci-Fi, Fantasy novel aimed toward young adults as well as adults alike. I started Thorn of a Rose when I was 13. I've scratched it and started over countless times as my story expanded and new ideas developed. Finally, I started and finished it when I was 18 and self-published it when I was 19. Silly me, I was so ecstatic at having a book published that I didn't take into account the marketing aspect. So here I am. I am ready to polish it up and re-launch it into the market with the necessary funds to promote it successfully for my readers.
    $15,000!? That's a lot! No, this is not a random number I pulled out of the air. I have a down payment on a small publishing package to lock in my much-more-expensive deal that - with your help - I will be able to upgrade to in order to obtain all my marketing needs.
Which include but aren't limited to:  Editorial Services - to make sure readers are ensured the best reading experience. International Marketing: radio, TV, social media, ect. Hollywood script: a team would collaborate a synopsis of my book to submit to Hollywood files and could be selected to become a movie someday - every authors' dream come true! story:
Hello, I am Ashley Dawn, and I am creating this indiegogo campaign to launch my new business. ThirstySoul and I would LOVE your Support! 

By launching the Live Your Bliss campaign,  it allows me to begin my journey has a yoga teacher, and it will help me finalize my accreditation as a kundalini dance instructor, and continue supporting others as a wholistic healthcare therapist. But most importantly, it will help me launch my business successfully, so I can begin these tools to you, and to the world!

I have committed to devote my life path to the beauty of sacred healing arts, because I believe when people feel their healthiest they are motivated to pour their hearts into things that they love. They feel inspired to unleash their unique creative expression to world that will support them to move away from creating other’s people’s dreams, so they can begin moving in the direction to create their own dreams.

I constantly hear people complaining about the aches and pains in their body, and it breaks my heart. When chronic pain is experienced it can cause insomnia, low levels of energy, and even cancer. While simultaneously feeling depressed, lonely, and frustrated. This can cause people to isolate themselves from community, family, and friends. 
You don’t need to live a life in pain, you don’t need to suffer, and you don’t need to feel alone. Together, we can begin creating the lasting results that are FUN and HEALTHFUL,  and that allow you to consciously connect to your passion, and to the beautiful people that live in this world.

If you would like to
Maximize Energy
Relieve Headaches
Improve Your Digestion
Have Skin That Glows
Feel More beautiful
Maximize energy
Be Stress Free
Enjoy Your Happiness
Experience Less Colds and Flus
Have a better sleep
Be more patient
Express Your Creativity.
Trust Yourself

Then ThirstySoul's offerings would be perfect for you!!

It is my deepest desire to raise awareness on how to create a HEALTHY, LOVING, BEAUTIFUL, AND SENSUALLY SATISFYING LIFESTYLE  though holistic healthcare coaching, cleansing and purification practices, dance and yoga.

By supporting this campaign, you will discover a life that is vibrant, juicy, and delicious. So you begin feeling beautiful from the inside out. When you feel unconditional love for yourself you begin to experience the joy that life has to offer. When you feel your JOY, then you begin living your bliss.  It sounds cheesy & I know it is a cliche..... but, it is my TRUTH!

I am a curious student and a passionate teacher spreading the awareness of the benefits of Nutrition & Purification practices to local communities. I travelled to Australia to connect and expand my network of people while hosting workshops on health and wellness. I sparked the beginning of a life long journey by facilitating and creating my very first international  retreat in Ubud, Bali Indonesia. 

It was my dream come true!

I believe we can truly empower ourselves & MAKE MORE DREAMS COME TRUE  through nourishing the body with fresh and vitality giving foods, combined with a meditative moving practice; such as yoga + kundalini dance!


When you support the Live Your Bliss Campaign

You help build a web based health channel that educates and inspires viewers worldwide. ($3000)

You support me to finalize my Kundalini Dance Facilitator Training. ($2495.00)

You support me to purchase yoga supporting equipment. I have created a yoga space in my house, and need blocks, extra mats, straps, ect to better support people in their practice. ($1000)

Together,

We can step into our personal power,
We can begin feeling the world,
We can see beauty everywhere,
We can taste the freshness of life,
We can listen to our inner wisdom. 

We can make dreams comes true! 

xo
Ashley Dawn

A little more about me....

Ashley studied the practice of modern day yoga in Calgary, Alberta. She holds a Yoga Alliance E-RYT 200 certification, having completed her teacher training with Jamie Mathiasen, and Aaron Patrick. She has been offering yoga classes with an emphasis on expressive healing arts fused with an asana practice and tantic meditation. I have studied various forms of hip hop, salsa, and contemporary movement. I have also received my White Belt Training in NIA.

I am a holistic nutritionist through Body Mind Institute, and I am currently finishing my studies to become a Master Herbalist through Living Earth School.


If I don't receive the full funding....

If I don't receive the funding for campaign then I will utilize the funding for marketing materials, website, and design fees, space rental fees, and equipment and materials to have a fully operating yoga studio in my home.


Please Share with Friends and Family
If you are unable to donate that is okay your love and support is valued and appreciated. 

Thank You!!

story:
IN SHORT:

Movement creates cities. This innovative publication uses movement as a conceptual device through which to read Johannesburg. Functioning as both a guide to visitors and a resource to residents, the books re-read the historical and contemporary forces that continue to shape Johannesburg. Notable authors, academics, photographers, researchers, designers and artists have interpreted the cities through their movement. The book explores fraught histories, poetically questions contemporary decisions, and critically reflects on social change. We are using the crowd funding movement as a means to complete the production of the book.

240x168mm
208 pages, full colour
ISBN 978-0-620-65889-8

Contributors:
Adam Habib, Alex Parker, Andrew Tshabangu, Brian McKechnie, David Adjaye, Dorothee Kreutzveldt, Edwin Cameron, Frances Goodman, Jay Naidoo, Julie-Ann Tyler, Jurgen Schadeberg, Karin Botta, Laurice Taitz, Lerato Mbangeni, Magas Pather, Melinda Silverman, Michael Flanagan, Molemo Moiloa, Mpho Parks Tau, Nolan Dennis, Nozuko Mapoma, Pandeani Liphosa, Pregs Govender, Pule Welch, Rangoato Hlasane, Rendani Nemakhavhani, Sally Peberdy, Sean O’Toole, Sithole Mbanga, Thandi Matthews, Thomas Coggin, Vaughn Sadie



WHAT IS MOVEMENT JOHANNESBURG?

Movement Johannesburg is an urban anthology, an exploration of the movements that have created Johannesburg and continue to shape the city. The book offers a diverse set of essays, interviews, photo essays, maps, and photographs that attempt to capture the complex histories and realities of movement (n.) and movement (v.) in the city. The publication will, in particular, reward the curious individual interested in the forces that shaped Johannesburg today looking for in-depth accounts but also lighter travel reading. Crafted through specially commissioned contributions from architects, academics, artists, photographers, urbanists, activists and thought leaders all passionate and knowledgeable about the movements of Johannesburg – past and present, Movement Johannesburg is both an accomplished reading of the city, but also a warm introduction to vibrant Johannesburg.


ABOUT THE EDITORS:

Zahira Asmal is the managing director of The City and founder of DESIGNING_SOUTHAFRICA. As a publisher, editor and curator, her work focuses on design, democracy and inclusive city-making. In doing so she has collaborated with governments, designers, architects, academics and the media globally. Asmal’s work has earned her a top spot on Design Week’s ‘Hot 50’ list and Wallpaper* magazine’s ‘Top 20’ list. She was also included in Mail & Guardian’s ‘200 Young South Africans’ and their ‘Book of Women’, as well as being listed in Monocle magazine’s Design Directory. Having worked with world-renowned architect David Adjaye OBE on his book, African Metropolitan Architecture, and exhibition, Urban Africa they are once again working together – this time on a place-making project at Johannesburg’s prominent Park Station.

Guy Trangoš is a professional architect and urban researcher at the Gauteng City-Region Observatory. A partnership between Gauteng Provincial Government, the University of the Witwatersrand, the University of Johannesburg and local government. In 2008, Guy completed his Professional Architecture Masters degree at Wits. He practised at Mashabane Rose and Associate Architects, and 26'10 south Architects, both in Johannesburg. In 2012, Guy completed a Masters in City Design and Social Science at the London School of Economics and Political Science, and began working at the GCRO in 2013. Today, Guy writes on architecture and urbanism for various publications, and continues to research and lecture on urban change, urban publics, mobility, architecture, and design.

THE CITY creates dynamic urban cultural projects and disseminates information on the social and economic change implicit in the urban consciousness of our times. Through singular publications, curated experiences and strategic connections, THE CITY delivers messages to targeted global communities that span the private, public and civic realms.


WHAT WILL YOUR MONEY DO?

THE CITY has received a grant from the South African Cities Network to research the movements that have created and shaped the major cities in South Africa. This was for the purpose of presenting this research on various platforms both locally and globally that are supported by the South African Cities Network. We require further funding for the design and printing of the Movement Johannesburg book so the research and insight that we have learned over the past year can be shared.

Our first book Reflections & Opportunities was presented over 25 events in 17 cities including Argentina, Brazil, South Africa, Germany and the UK where we were invited by universities, municipalities and conferences. That means that there is amazing goodwill and interest in our work and people are really interested to know more about South African cities. Help us make this book a reality!


MORE ON THE MOVEMENT PROJECT:

Movements have affected the look, feel and progress of cities in particular and interesting ways. They are what infuse a city with the energy that gives them their individuality, their idiosyncrasies, and their joie d’vivre. They are indeed the lifeblood of a city, pumping vivacity into its metaphorical heart, and in so doing breathing life into the relationships between inhabitants and the city. 

This innovative series of publications and experiences uses movement as a conceptual device through which to read major South African cities. Durban was explored through an innovative poster-zine, and Movement Cape Town, the first book in the series, is currently in press and will be available for purchase soon. You can purchase an early copy here as part of a Movement Johannesburg and Movement Cape Town combo deal.

MOVEMENT JOHANNESBURG Launch dates:

Johannesburg: 26 November 2015
Cape Town: 2 December 2015

Engaging with the freedom | Zahira Asmal | TEDxBeloHorizonte


A special thanks for helping Movement launch this campaign!

  • Guy Trangoš
  • Steffen Fischer 
  • Richard Quintal 

For more info as it comes follow us at:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Movement Johannesburg is an urban anthology, an exploration of the movements that have created Johannesburg and continue to shape the city. The book offers a diverse set of essays, interviews, photo essays, maps, and photographs that attempt to capture the complex histories and realities of movement (n.) and movement (v.) in the city. The publication will, in particular, reward the curious individual interested in the forces that shaped Johannesburg today looking for in-depth accounts but also lighter travel reading. Crafted through specially commissioned contributions from architects, academics, artists, photographers, urbanists, activists and thought leaders all passionate and knowledgeable about the movements of Johannesburg – past and present, Movement Johannesburg is both an accomplished reading of the city, but also a warm introduction to vibrant Johannesburg.

ABOUT THE EDITORS:
Zahira Asmal is the managing director of The City and founder of DESIGNING_SOUTHAFRICA. As a publisher, editor and curator, her work focuses on design, democracy and inclusive city-making. In doing so she has collaborated with governments, designers, architects, academics and the media globally. Asmal’s work has earned her a top spot on Design Week’s ‘Hot 50’ list and Wallpaper* magazine’s ‘Top 20’ list. She was also included in Mail & Guardian’s ‘200 Young South Africans’ and their ‘Book of Women’, as well as being listed in Monocle magazine’s Design Directory. Having worked with world-renowned architect David Adjaye OBE on his book, African Metropolitan Architecture, and exhibition, Urban Africa they are once again working together – this time on a place-making project at Johannesburg’s prominent Park Station.


Guy Trangoš is a professional architect and urban researcher at the Gauteng City-Region Observatory. A partnership between Gauteng Provincial Government, the University of the Witwatersrand, the University of Johannesburg and local government. In 2008, Guy completed his Professional Architecture Masters degree at Wits. He practised at Mashabane Rose and Associate Architects, and 26'10 south Architects, both in Johannesburg. In 2012, Guy completed a Masters in City Design and Social Science at the London School of Economics and Political Science, and began working at the GCRO in 2013. Today, Guy writes on architecture and urbanism for various publications, and continues to research and lecture on urban change, urban publics, mobility, architecture, and design.
THE CITY creates dynamic urban cultural projects and disseminates information on the social and economic change implicit in the urban consciousness of our times. Through singular publications, curated experiences and strategic connections, THE CITY delivers messages to targeted global communities that span the private, public and civic realms.



WHAT WILL YOUR MONEY DO?
THE CITY has received a grant from the South African Cities Network to research the movements that have created and shaped the major cities in South Africa. This was for the purpose of presenting this research on various platforms both locally and globally that are supported by the South African Cities Network. We require further funding for the design and printing of the Movement Johannesburg book so the research and insight that we have learned over the past year can be shared.
Our first book Reflections & Opportunities was presented over 25 events in 17 cities including Argentina, Brazil, South Africa, Germany and the UK where we were invited by universities, municipalities and conferences. That means that there is amazing goodwill and interest in our work and people are really interested to know more about South African cities. Help us make this book a reality!



MORE ON THE MOVEMENT PROJECT:



Movements have affected the look, feel and progress of cities in particular and interesting ways. They are what infuse a city with the energy that gives them their individuality, their idiosyncrasies, and their joie d’vivre. They are indeed the lifeblood of a city, pumping vivacity into its metaphorical heart, and in so doing breathing life into the relationships between inhabitants and the city. 


This innovative series of publications and experiences uses movement as a conceptual device through which to read major South African cities. Durban was explored through an innovative poster-zine, and Movement Cape Town, the first book in the series, is currently in press and will be available for purchase soon. You can purchase an early copy here as part of a Movement Johannesburg and Movement Cape Town combo deal.

MOVEMENT JOHANNESBURG Launch dates:

Johannesburg: 26 November 2015
Cape Town: 2 December 2015

A special thanks for helping Movement launch this campaign!

story:
"Good Midnight, Insomniacs: Waking up from Depression and Addiction to Discovery" is a spontaneous collage of life-writing and photographs put together in one breath and hastening to document the early stages of my recovery from depression and addiction. No matter who you are - a man or a woman, young or old, rich or poor, black or white, your addiction wants to take your life. Period. "The Three Headed Dragon" wants you dead. My modest self-help booklet is dedicated to intervention and addresses people who have decided to conquer one of 21-st century's deadliest pandemics. As the proverbial slogan of Alcoholics Anonymous goes: "You are no longer alone", it is my firm belief that in today's cyber era there is no excuse for silencing mental health issues and chronic addiction pathology, no reason for isolation and despair in the wee hours of the morning. My personal collection of sunrise pictures taken over the first six months of my recovery sends a symbolic message of hope for a new daybreak to fellow addicts and insomniacs. The essays are simply a continuation of my gratitude letter to "The Addictions and Concurrent Disorders Center" at the Credit Valley Hospital in Mississauga and depict my personal awakening as a direct result from its multifaceted support. The acquired knowledge has empowered me beyond words (here come the pictures!) and has opened widely a new road for yet another journey of healing and discovery.

I am dreaming of reaching a much larger audience for my self-published book.

I wish the world can enjoy my sunrise pictures as a reminder of welcoming each new day with a fresh look and a deep optimistic breath in.

(Photo Album Link on the Website below)

story:
Hello friends!

My name is Asia Dee. Some of you may know me from my modeling career. The phrase 'Don't Feed the Models,' has always gotten under my skin. Most of the models I know LOVE to eat. My love for food isn't limited to the consumption of it... I am very passionate about preparing it as well.

My role in the kitchen began at a very young age. It started with simple things; beating eggs into the waffle mix, decloving garlic and grating cheese. Eventually my tasks in the kitchen became more profound and by age 10, I realized I loved to cook.

As some as you may know, I was raised as a pescatarian (like a vegetarian except I eat seafood). Contrary to popular beliefs, vegetarian diets aren't necessarily limited and we don't eat twigs and leaves all day (although I do love my kale...).

In the past few years I've given my social media followers glimpses of the food I make for myself. Most people are extremely receptive to my home-cooked meals and ask me to post recipes. More recently, I started doing quick Snapchat tutorials while I cook and the responses have been amazing! I love the positive feedback and I get really excited when people show and tell me they made something I posted.

I created this Indiegogo account to help raise funds to curate my first vegan, vegetarian and pescatarian cookbook.

story:
CONFLUX 101

A conflux is the point where two rivers meet to become one entirely new river. It's the perfect metaphor for how each of our different identities and cultures meet. At Conflux Magazine, our driving belief is that identity is fluid and made of multiple streams of influence. Our unique mixes make us complicated, beautiful, and inspiring.

People of the world, we all have confluxes! Like what, you say? Like coming from an interfaith family, and finding that both religions have shaped your beliefs. Or growing up in Jakarta but calling New York City home. Or speaking fluent English, whilst feeling happiest expressing yourself in Spanish, no matter how choppy it gets! You get the picture. So take a second to think about it: what's your conflux? And do you really have just one?

ABOUT THE MAGAZINE

Conflux Magazine will explore how our contributors and subjects are driven and inspired by their mixed identities and influences. Each issue will focus on one identity or influence, like race, culture, gender, music, or food. Content will include interviews, essays, photo essays, profiles, and art. (Long live print!) 

Beyond our print issue, we'll host events that uplift all types of voices in a global conversation on mixedness. We'll post content from these events and video interviews on our website to make our content as accessible as possible.

WHO WE ARE

We're Ozra Yazdani and Anita SenGupta, and together, we're a passionate, dedicated team striving to shift the ways we now understand identity. When we met last fall, we immediately connected over the fact that we were both multiracial and went to top-rank schools on scholarship. Our mixes of race, culture, socioeconomics, and religion--among our many other mixes!--give us unique experiences, perspectives, and inspiration. But (as any mixed person knows) our mixes have the ability to confuse the heck out ourselves, as well as other people. And we want to change that. People now are more mixed than ever, in every way. We want to create a platform that celebrates all kinds of mixes.

OUR MASTER PLAN

WHERE WE ARE

We've mapped and started designing out our first issue, we've connected with 7 amazing contributors (some of whom made us cry with their touching content), we held an interactive event in Washington Square Park, we've built relationships with other amazing indie print magazines, we've started talking to stockists, we've honed in on our concept, designed a logo, produced a video... This list could go on! We've been kicking butt to get Conflux Magazine moving. Now we need YOU to help make it fly!

HOW YOU'RE HELPING

By contributing to our Indiegogo campaign, you're not only joining our community, you're also helping that community grow to reach as many people as possible with high-quality, unconventional content.

Okay, okay, but here's our budget breakdown so you know what you're really supporting:

$3,000: One print issue with NYC distribution + Website + Video Interviews

$6,000: One event + Two print issues with NYC distribution + Website + Video Interviews

$8,000: Two events + Two issues with NYC distribution + Website + Video Interviews

$10,000: Two events + Two issues with U.S. distribution + Website + Video Interviews

From the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU for joining us on this journey! Your encouragement  and support mean everything.

story:
About the Book


Live to Air is a tale of murder and intrigue, love and violence, hope and despair.  Its hero, Ethan Benson, is a savvy, award-winning producer with a keen nose for news who works for “The Weekly Reporter,” the top rated newsmagazine on television.  Assigned to what appears to be a straight forward story about the high-powered murder of an innocent young socialite, the daughter of the deputy mayor of New York, Ethan embarks on a journey, surrounded by a cast of memorable characters to unravel the truth hidden by the powers to be who’ve viciously schemed to frame a hot-headed young hoodlum.  

My novel is a classic murder mystery, filled with suspense and built against the backdrop of the television news business.  Ethan takes you behind the scenes as he digs into the killer’s criminal past and discovers---through a series of twists and turns---a devious scheme hatched by the prosecutor and the public defender who twist the facts and manipulate the jury to make sure the fall guy is found guilty.  Then, in a surprise ending, Ethan reveals---through his hard work and determination---the role of a powerful government official who’s hiding a dark secret that threatens to destroy his political future.

Peppered with car chases, gun battles, and contract hit men, my novel takes its place in the pantheon of crime thrillers.  Ethan is a flawed but powerful protagonist---much like Michael Connelly’s Mickey Haller, John Sanderson’s Lucas Davenport, and James Patterson’s Alex Cross.  But unlike most heroes or antiheros in this genre of fiction who work as attorneys, private investigators, or homicide detectives, Ethan is a television news producer who uses the tools of reporting to seek out the truth as a crime fighting sleuth.  Live to Air is a classic murder mystery with unforgettable characters set in a milieu rarely explored in other works of fiction and the first in a series of Ethan Benson thrillers.      

What Makes This Novel Unique?

As a producer in television news, I spent my entire career working at the broadcast networks.    

I started at the bottom as a desk assistant and worked my way to the top, where I created and managed the weekly newsmagazine, Dateline NBC.  That journey took two decades, and to get there, I had to learn the business from the bottom up.  I spent years working as a researcher, an assistant producer, an associate producer, an operations producer, a line producer, a segment producer, and a senior producer, before being named the executive producer of my own broadcast.  Needless to say, I used personal anecdotes from each of these production experiences to create the storyline for Live to Air.  

So the characters, while fictional, are based on the professionals I met---encapsulating the quirks, strengths, and weaknesses of the creative people who made up my world of broadcast news.  Ethan Benson combines the strengths, weaknesses, and foibles of many of my colleagues---not to mention the bits of me that run through his character---and his adventures in the book mirror the adventures in my own career.  They’re authentic, but imaginary, and steeped in the real life of drug dealers, rapists, and murderers I investigated during my years as a television journalist. 

So why did I write Live to Air and why should you support my fundraising campaign?  The answer to both those questions is simple.  Murder mysteries are both fascinating and engrossing---a way to lose oneself in an imaginary world of villains and heroes and heroines.  

But most murder mysteries in today’s marketplace feature homicide detectives, lawyers, and private investigators as their protagonists. My novel is different because it is built around a hero who's fighting crime using the same tools as a real life reporter. 

This makes Live to Air  a gripping read, and Ethan Benson an iconic hero.  The book is a page turner, and the first in a series of crime thrillers that will captivate the imagination of readers of all ages. 

Here’s What Others Say About Live to Air

 “Jeff has translated his twenty-five years as one of television’s leading investigative reporters into a twisting and turning murder mystery that will keep you riveted.”
– Av Westin, former Vice President, ABC News Creative Development

“His characters are charismatic, devious, and frightening---straight out of the annals of the best murder mysteries.”
-- Deborah Roberts, Correspondent, ABC News

“Ethan Benson is a new kind of hero cast in the role of crime-fighting sleuth.  Sensitive and insecure, dogged and determined, sharp-witted and loving, he refuses to take no for an answer as he strives to uncover the truth.”
– Al Roker, Host and Weatherman, NBC News Today Show

“His plotline unfolds masterfully as it tracks his hero pulling back the layers and skillfully chronicling each stage of newsmagazine production, deftly revealing the storyline as Ethan takes the reader on a wild journey producing his story.”
– David Sloan, Senior Executive Producer, ABC News 20/20

“Jeff and I spent years working together at 20/20 and his novel captures the essence of storytelling and the art of the interview…The book is sharp and fast-paced, a real page turner that will hold your attention right down to the chilling climax.” – Barbara Walters, former Host of ABC’s the View, 20/20, Evening News, and NBC’s the Today Show

Who is Jeffrey L. Diamond?

I’m an award-winning journalist with forty years of experience in television news and an aspiring novelist.  I began my career at ABC News where I produced for the weekly newsmagazine, 20/20, supervising hundreds of stories, ranging from several minutes in length to a full hour of programming.  My body of work includes newsmaker profiles, breaking news and investigative reports, major interviews, and numerous crime stories.  During my career, I collaborated with some of the biggest names in the business---including anchors Charles Gibson, Hugh Downs, Jane Pauley, Stone Phillips, and Barbara Walters, and correspondents Deborah Roberts, Tom Jarriel, Jim Avila, and Lynn Sherr.  

I also created Dateline NBC and served as an executive producer at Martha Stewart Living Television and Judith Regan Television, where I was responsible for overseeing multi-million dollar budgets, supervising hundreds of producers, writers, editors, and camera crews, and conceptualizing and implementing the creative content of these programs.  

Toward the end of my television career, I devoted all of my creative energies to producing stories, once again, for 20/20.  My responsibilities spanned every aspect of storytelling---from research, budgeting, interviewing, and directing to writing, editing, and post-production.  I’ve been nominated for dozens of awards and won six national Emmy Awards, two Dupont-Columbia Awards, one Peabody Award, one National Press Club Consumer Journalism Award, two CINE Golden Eagle Awards, and countless others.  I currently live in the Berkshire Mountains of Massachusetts with my wife, Amy, and my golden retriever, Bailey, where I am hard at work on the next Ethan Benson thriller.

The Team

  • Jeffrey Diamond - Author
  • Owain Llewellyn - Senior Creative Developer
  • Melissa Grimm – Publicist & Marketing Expert
  • Zerabruk Cavallaro – Cameraman and Editor

Why Does Publishing Cost So Much Money?

Live to Air is being published by the best hybrid publishing company in the business---the Greenleaf Book Group.  The company is highly selective, evaluating close to 2500 manuscripts and publishing roughly 75 books a year.  Live to Air is one of those books.  I elected to go with Greenleaf and not to self-publish because of its stellar reputation, and because I knew I’d have access to some of the best people in the industry---a first-rate project manager, editor, proofreader, cover design artist, interior layout expert---as well as a team of e-book, print on demand, distribution, and marketing specialists.  But the cost is steep---well over $20,000---and I have to pay all of it upfront.

Here’s the breakdown in dollars ($)


And the above expenses don’t include my author website, this fundraising campaign, a book tour, and a public relations firm to help coordinate the promotion.  I’m willing to absorb these additional expenses out of my own pocket and have launched an Indiegogo Fundraising Campaign just to pay the cost of publishing Live to Air, because I believe in Ethan Benson and hope to establish his character in an ongoing series of murder mysteries for everyone to enjoy. 

The second thriller, Live to Tape, is already written, and the third book, Live to the Network, is currently in research. 

What are the Gifts for Pledges

  • $25 or more – Receive an online edition of the book after publication
  • $50 or more – Receive a print copy of the book after publication
  • $100 or more – Receive a signed print copy of the book after publication
  • $250 or more – Receive a signed print copy and an online copy of the book after publication and a personal thank you letter from the author
  • $500 or more – Receive a signed print copy and an online copy of the book after publication and an invitation to the book launch party
  • $1000 or more – Receive a signed print copy and an online copy of the book after publication, an invitation to the book launch party, and lunch with the author

Please Contribute

So to all of you with a dream, my dream is to create a fictional character, Ethan Benson, who comes to life in a hard-hitting series of murder mysteries that will captivate readers, bring everybody enjoyment, and open the world of television news to an audience who wonders how a hard-nosed journalist goes about solving a high-visibility crime.  So please take a moment, push that button, and contribute to my campaign so I can bring Live to Air to the marketplace this summer.  Thank you again.

Toward the end of my television career, I devoted all of my creative energies to producing stories, once again, for 20/20.  My responsibilities spanned every aspect of storytelling---from research, budgeting, interviewing, and directing to writing, editing, and post-production.  I’ve been nominated for dozens of awards and won six national Emmy Awards, two Dupont-Columbia Awards, one Peabody Award, one National Press Club Consumer Journalism Award, two CINE Golden Eagle Awards, and countless others.  I currently live in the Berkshire Mountains of Massachusetts with my wife, Amy, and my golden retriever, Bailey, where I am hard at work on the next Ethan Benson thriller.The Team

Jeffrey Diamond - Author
Owain Llewellyn - Senior Creative Developer
Melissa Grimm – Publicist & Marketing Expert
Zerabruk Cavallaro – Cameraman and Editor


Why Does Publishing Cost So Much Money?
Live to Air is being published by the best hybrid publishing company in the business---the Greenleaf Book Group.  The company is highly selective, evaluating close to 2500 manuscripts and publishing roughly 75 books a year.  Live to Air is one of those books.  I elected to go with Greenleaf and not to self-publish because of its stellar reputation, and because I knew I’d have access to some of the best people in the industry---a first-rate project manager, editor, proofreader, cover design artist, interior layout expert---as well as a team of e-book, print on demand, distribution, and marketing specialists.  But the cost is steep---well over $20,000---and I have to pay all of it upfront.
Here’s the breakdown in dollars ($)



And the above expenses don’t include my author website, this fundraising campaign, a book tour, and a public relations firm to help coordinate the promotion.  I’m willing to absorb these additional expenses out of my own pocket and have launched an Indiegogo Fundraising Campaign just to pay the cost of publishing Live to Air, because I believe in Ethan Benson and hope to establish his character in an ongoing series of murder mysteries for everyone to enjoy. 
The second thriller, Live to Tape, is already written, and the third book, Live to the Network, is currently in research. What are the Gifts for Pledges



$25 or more – Receive an online edition of the book after publication


$50 or more – Receive a print copy of the book after publication


$100 or more – Receive a signed print copy of the book after publication


$250 or more – Receive a signed print copy and an online copy of the book after publication and a personal thank you letter from the author


$500 or more – Receive a signed print copy and an online copy of the book after publication and an invitation to the book launch party


$1000 or more – Receive a signed print copy and an online copy of the book after publication, an invitation to the book launch party, and lunch with the author

Please Contribute
So to all of you with a dream, my dream is to create a fictional character, Ethan Benson, who comes to life in a hard-hitting series of murder mysteries that will captivate readers, bring everybody enjoyment, and open the world of television news to an audience who wonders how a hard-nosed journalist goes about solving a high-visibility crime.  So please take a moment, push that button, and contribute to my campaign so I can bring Live to Air to the marketplace this summer.  Thank you again.

story:
Hi, Wallace here and I am asking for your help in funding my efforts to get my first full-length novel, Parallax, professionally edited and cover designed prior to its publication this year. The novel is intended to be the first of a long-term series that will chronicle Pratt's adventures in protecting the Milky Way Galaxy. It is my hope that this endeavor will attract Traditional Publishers, who will pick up the series and offer steady employment doing what I love most. If not, then I will continue to pursue the Independent Route. I love to write, but it's not easy to get a career like this off the ground. That's where I'm hoping that you will come in.

Parallax is the story of John Winslow Pratt, fighter pilot for the United Earth Union and the Stellar Alliance in the Year 2223. When he is abducted during an invasion by unknown aliens, he is pulled into a conspiracy that crosses Time and Space. Separated from all he used to know and suspected by his own government of treason, Pratt finds unlikely allies in Ariel DuBois, the intelligence agent sent to arrest him, and Koren, the leader of an alien clan at war with the Stellar Alliance who recognizes the greater threat that looms in the shadows, joins forces with Pratt to end the war, and shift attention to more important matters.

I intend to start with a three book trilogy and then expand to a 10-12 book series that will cover new story arcs that encompass the Milky Way and beyond. I believe in this project and where it's going. 

The campaign consists of raising funds to pay for a professional editor and cover designer prior to release through Createspace and Amazon Kindle Direct Publishing. I intend this to be a one-time thing to help me get things moving.

There's not much more to say, but I'll be available for questions and will respond as quickly as possible. Thanks for your time and have a great day. :)

story:
We are publishing a large tabloid sized book of RAT: Subterranean News with soft covers in color. Money raised from you will go towards the final electronic preparation and for printing. The ebook version as a PDF will be updated as more material is prepared.

RAT: Subterranean News was published in New York City during the most intense period of the counter culture movement in 1968-69. As activist, “PARTICIPATORY JOURNALISTS” it quickly reported from the inside of the Columbia University insurrection, the Woodstock music festival, and the massive anti war demonstrations in Chicago at the Democratic Convention.

FBI documents obtained under the Freedom of Information Act include this analysis of RAT:

“Only a handful of the papers strike me as having a distinct character, useful, original material, and rich, imaginative writing…The paper, named after the small, tough, and durable rodent of the underground, defined itself in a first anniversary editorial last March as an ‘experiment in participatory journalism’,”

Because this period occurred before the internet there is surprisingly little original material from this critical period of American rebellion. For instance, the leading libraries only contain a few issues of RAT on microfilm. 

Original material about the Black Panthers and ghetto insurrections, the draft resistance and anti war underground, the Weatherman bombings of anti war targets, the planning of SDS, the creation of the Yippies, the rise of Women’s liberation, the Stonewall riots leading to gay and gender liberation, the genesis of the environmental movement – all of these are hard to find in original reports and documents.

RAT broke many stories ignored by the standard Media. First hand reports by civil rights activists involved at the scene of ghetto insurrections come to mind. I also marvel at the brilliance of the RAT photographers. I’ve come to see them as brave war correspondents from the battle zone. The cartoonists and graphics artists were truly exceptional, funny, ironic, and inspiring. In retrospect, the crazy layout overseen by Art Director Bob Eisner was ground breaking. RAT was revolutionary in the concept of how a newspaper could look and would influence publications far into the future.

We have been working for 4 months scanning, digitally preparing, and laying out pages for the book which will be tabloid sized and about 350 pages in color. Considerable money has already been spent in the preparations for publication. We have also been preparing a much more complete ebook PDF version for researchers, scholars and activists.

The enterprise will be ran as a non profit company so that any money made from the book can be granted to needy ex RAT staffers . This campaign will be used to primarily pay printing and shipping costs. The book is designed as a professional and lasting record of this mixed, hopeful, inspired, desperate, and passionate time.

What RAT printed was important enough to launch a FBI New York Red Squad campaign.

Long ago I signed a document with the NY Lawyers Guild who were suing to get many New York organization’s FBI files. After about 15 years I got about 40 pages. Reading them carefully is astounding! The most interesting part is that the intelligence side realized they should not try to strong arm RAT with a big cop assault arresting the whole staff on trumped up charges thereby winning us a lot of support and sympathy.

Instead they decided on a plan of economic squeeze.

The intelligence files indicate they visited our distributor, key newsstand locations, our printer, etc with a patriotic appeal to drop the RAT. At a high level FBI heavyweights visited the Record companies and told the management they should no longer advertise in RAT and other underground press publications. We will include excerpts from these FBI documents in the book. It’s good to be able to prove that in some of our diatribes we weren’t suffering from crazy hippie, LSD induced paranoia.

We have 5 committed and smart people working as a team on this project so it’s hard to envision it not getting done. Two members are older and could have health issues but are in well functioning shape at the moment. If a health crises debilitated either, the book might have minor differences, but the very worst case is printing would be delayed until the fall.

If the total amount is not raised fewer books will be printed.

The other obvious risk is that only a small group of activists and scholars care. We have designed this tabloid sized soft cover book with strong graphics, and sharp and provocative articles. For instance, reading about the black battle for rights is a revealing, straight line projection to the police murders of today. This is a bit reminiscent of an insurgent Whole Earth Catalog that’s great for browsing.

First of all, you are helping to get needed information for another era of activism. Much of this RAT compendium has been put together with the question “What hard won lessons would be useful to the Occupy Wall Street generation?”

Contributors have the opportunity to get a signed copy of the book. We have prepared 21 posters, suitable for framing , in an edition of 100 which are signed and numbered. Both will likely be collectors items. For the high donors or foundations that contribute, there are pages in the front of the book for acknowledgements or in memoriams for loved ones who have passed.

*Please note that all 12x18" RAT Posters are printed on #80 matte cover paper

Doug Marshall. Graphic designer. Prepared final electronic design for books at the LBJ School at the University of Texas before being sent to the printer. Recently retired. Long time leader of the popular Austin band Doug Marshall and the 103’s.

Artly Snuff. Former member of the Board Texas Student Publication. Poster and internet designer. Masters degree in Architecture from UT . Founding member of the famous dada, satirical rock group the Uranium Savages.

Daniel Hipolito. Artist. Zine publisher. Electronic music composer/performer with Smokey Emory

Christine Aprile. Video Editor. Graduate of Cleveland Institute of Art. Composes and performs with avant garde band Silent Diane.

Jeff Shero. Founder/editor of RAT. Nationally published writer. Founded TV company listed on the Denver stock market. Never performed in any band.

story:
Emotions Poetry Series 

The gift of poetry may be one of life's most powerful—and envied—skills. 

A poem well told can make us laugh, weep, swell with pride, or rise with indignation. 



Humans seem to be fundamentally hard-wired for emotional connection and the creation of beautiful poetry and prose has developed emotional reactions and contacts with us all since time began. 

The oral poetry tradition is as old as language itself. 


Throughout history, poetry has primarily existed in the verbal realm, preserving and passing knowledge across generations before being canonized in print. 

This was true of the ancient epics, and it’s true today. Romance, love, life and death, are all expressed through the powerful phrasing of rhythmic words, making poetry a life-changing medium for good.

Emotions Poetry Series

The emotions poetry series is a compilation of poetry works by Colinda Aldridge. Colinda has captured the lives of everyday people through her epic series of books, commenting on the twists and turns of life that bring about our most intimate emotional reactions. 

About Colinda Aldridge

               

Colinda’s books cover all aspects of life from Love and happiness to new life and death, allowing individuals to connect with and express their own emotions through beautiful words and delivery. 


Colinda Aldridge is an up and coming author who has devoted her time to crafting authentic prose for the benefit of others. Colinda has always loved reading and writing and from a very early age was engaged in the heart warming activities of writing her very own prose, poetry and literature. 

The passion that Colinda has for writing drives her to establish her own legacy in the world of literature.

For Colinda coping with tragedy and conquering fears always begins and ends with the ink of the pen and the smooth surface of a sheet of paper. 


Colinda is ready to share her work with the entire world, and is launching this Crowdfunding campaign to fund the release of her Emotions series alongside the release of her first CD of her work. 

By supporting this campaign you will be helping Colinda to realise her dream and help others who will benefit from the beauty of Colinda’s talent with words. 

Why?

Because telling your story - and sharing it with those that care - may be the most powerful medicine on earth.

Each of us is a constantly unfolding story, a hero in a novel no one else can write, and still so many of us leave our stories untold. 

When this happens we lose the narrative of life, the passing on of batons, the inspiration for life itself and the hope of a future generation. We all have a responsibility to take the time to share our stories, good, bad and otherwise. To educate and illuminate the minds of children, to spark their imagination, to heal our very own souls and connect with the lost and lonely.



Every time you tell your story you help yourself and others to feel connected, loved and needed. Essential needs for us all. 

Storytelling is the most powerful therapy we have as human beings. No matter who you are or what you do, we all have a story to tell.

Colinda chooses to tell her story through poetry and prose, taking others on a rollercoaster of emotions with her work. 

By supporting this campaign you will have the opportunity to read Colinda’s work and even purchase her books at an early bird rate. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

By supporting this campaign with your contributions and donations Colinda can have make her mark in the world of literature. The power of the written word is all encompassing, and Colinda is ready to share her heart and soul with those who are ready to connect. 

This campaign will also raise the profile of the Emotions series of books. So please share this campaign with other creative writers who may be inspired and those who appreciate poetry as an art form. 

By simply contributing to this campaign you will improve the opportunity for writing, publishing and sharing poetry for all.

THE GOAL

$10,000

By raising this amount Colinda will get to develop her website, do some promotion and get her first series of poetry published. 

Colinda will also have the chance to produce her CD series and promote her poetry for those with a preference for listening. 

This is how the money will be distributed

  • Website development  $2,000
  • CD Production  $3,000
  • Marketing and Promotion $2,500
  • Publishing  $2,500

SUPPORTERS PERKS

Show your support for the development of Emotions, and there are a number of supporter’s rewards available for you - check them put on the right and enjoy - they also make gifts for a friend 

All contributions at all levels are of course welcome. I would like once again to thank you for supporting my campaign and for helping me to bring Emotions to life in a way that everyone can enjoy.

Thank you again and watch this space for regular updates and notifications on my progress. 

I would like to leave you with one final thought…

The Power of Poetry

Dedication:

I pray for the day

We are again

Face to Face

I hope to receive you

With loves firm embrace

For now there are no jokes

And no heartfelt laughs

I'm left only to reminisce

Things from our past

Be it thick or thin

You were there through it all

I wish to almighty God

I never receive that phone call

I can't tell you how

Miserable it feels not being with you

I can't tell you

I love and miss you

You will never be replace

I pray for the day

We are once again

Face to Face 

There are  Risk and Challenges with in this world.We have no way of stopping .  What ever may or may not be happening with in today's world Yes,It's scary However through all of my life's struggles. I've found that prayer, faith and hard work will help you through. So I will make sure that all of my contributors will receieve all of their perks.

May God protect and guide us all.
Peace and blessings.
Colinda

story:
Im März 2014 wurde bei meiner Tochter ein bösartiger Tumor, ein sogenanntes anaplastisches Astrozytom WHO III festgestellt. 

Durch seine nebelartige Beschaffenheit ist eine OP nicht möglich. Sie bekam Bestrahlung und Chemotherapie. Anfangs lief alles sehr gut und es ging ihr besser. So gut das sie ihren Schulabschluss mit Lob meisterte und nun eine Ausbildung begonnen hat. 

Im Mai diesen Jahres begann Lena doppelt zusehen und im Laufe der Zeit  begann sie zu schielen. Vor zwei Monaten fanden die Ärzte heraus das Lenas Tumor wieder gewachsen ist und das sie einen neuen hat. Dieser sitzt im Pons, was der Stammhirn-Bereich ist. Dieser ist auch dafür zuständig das sie schielt.

Durch diesen Befund mussten die Ärzte uns leider mitteilen, das unsere Zeit mit Lena sehr begrenzt ist. Lena ist jetzt 15 Jahre und wird laut Ärzten nicht erwachsen werden, vielmehr ist es so, das durch den erneuten Befund ihre Lebenserwartung sehr stark abgenommen hat.

Von vielen Seiten bekommen wir nun gesagt genießt die Zeit, unternehmt noch was. Erfüllt ihr noch einpaar Wünsche. Doch jetzt könnte ich schon wieder in Tränen ausbrechen, denn dies ist uns leider nicht möglich.

Aufgrund der Diagnose waren wir gezwungen dringend ein Zimmer für Lena zu schaffen, damit wir für alles was eventuell kommt gewappnet sind. Denn  wir hatten bisher für uns sechs einen Wohnbereich von ca. 45 m². Ein eigenes Zimmer hatte keines unserer 4 Kinder. Geheizt haben wir mit einem kleinen Tiba-Herd und mit Strom, was eine Unmenge von Geld verschluckt hat.
Deshalb mussten wir renovieren und Wohnraum schaffen und vor allem brauchten wir eine neue Heizung. Und wir wollten endlich für jedes Kind ein Zimmer und unseren eigenen Wohnbereich.

Durch zahlreiche Fehler die wir gemacht haben und durch unvorhersehbare Zusatzkosten war das Geld schneller weg wie wir gedacht haben. Jetzt haben wir einen riesigen Berg an Schulden, unser Wohnbereich ist im Rohbau und ein Teil der Rechnungen sind noch offen und von der Bank bekommen wir kein Geld mehr. So sitzen uns die Gläubiger im Nacken und wir stehen mit dem Rücken zur Wand! Aber es ist wenigstens der Bereich für Lena fertig, das ist das wichtigste. Sie hat ein schönes Zimmer für sich!

story:
If you've ever lost a friend or Loved one without the the opportunity to say goodbye and have closure, then this is a book for you. 

 "Journey of a Lifetime" is a story about having closure inside the final 5 seconds of your life. It's about creating the Emotional Life Insurance we all need inside of the final 5 seconds of your life. 

This is an innovative novel, which includes a soundtrack from 15 different musical artists such as: Five for Fighting, The Corrs, Linda Ronstadt, Sting, Queen, Barry Manilow, Air Supply, Joe Fred, Dala, Joni Mitchell, Sarah McLachlan, Sir Elton John,  Alan Silvestri, Tom Tykwer and Harry Gregson-Williams 

We are also taking this novel to social media this summer in Europe to re-create the story of Tristan Kelly on Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and Youtube. Follow us @IamTristanKelly on Twitter.

We are Committed to creating a movement of Closure with this novel for all of us who have lost Loved ones suddenly with words left unsaid. 

Please share this message so that it may find it's rightful place to those who need to hear it. I thank you for your support and interest in my novel, Journey of a Lifetime.

If this message agrees with you or your business, please feel free to reach out to me and inquire as to how we can work together with our visions. 

My Best Wishes, 

Chuck

story:
Robert Winter grew up in San Carlos, California where his father owned a construction company. Robert began working for his dad in his early teens. While a senior in high school, his father and mother would divorce. Robert and his two brothers stayed with their father. It was during this period of his life that his father relocated the four of them to Seattle, Washington. Unhappy, and missing the California sun, Robert saved the money he had earned working for his dad and used it to moved back to California. There, he enrolled himself in Sierra College to study psychology. During his years in college, he turned to the only real trade he knew - construction. After three years of college he acquired his contractors license moved to Southern California and began building custom homes on the San Diego waterfront. Life for Robert was a relatively content...or so he thought.

His background caught the attention of Richard Woodard. It was at this point that Robert's life would change forever, as would the way he viewed the world. Richard offered Robert a chance to work as an inspector for FEMA. Richard guaranteed that Robert would not have a "job" so much as a living adventure, and that Robert would do more in a year than most people get to experience in a lifetime. His young curiosity won out.

Robert began his career as a FEMA inspector in 1989, before cellphones were common, everyone had a laptop, and GPS was standard in most cars and handheld devices. What seemed in his mind to be an easy transition from contractor to inspector, would prove otherwise. Nothing could prepare him for what he would experience as an inspector during a natural disaster, nor what it takes to become a FEMA inspector.

In "Dust in the Wind", Robert chronicles his life with FEMA from his very first meeting with a disaster victim; a memory forever etched into his mind.

To date: Robert lives in Las Vegas, Nevada. He continues to work for FEMA, and works as a bodyguard for the rich and famous when not on the site of a natural disaster as an inspector. In addition to "Dust in the Wind", Robert has two more books in the works - one due out in the summer of 2015.

The intent of this campaign is to raise the necessary funds to launch Robert's charity "Celebrities 4 Disaster Relief"; a charity that will step in and help victims of a natural disaster while they are waiting for the funds to come in from FEMA, insurances, or other sources of funding available to disaster victims. It can take days, or even weeks or months before aid is made available. Often, in and around the destruction area, there is no water, food, housing or clothes for the victims to wear. As a person who has seen the front line of disaster dozens of times, Robert knows of the atrocities these victims experience. His goal is to establish a stepping stone organization that will be there during those hours of need beyond what the Red Cross, Salvation Army, or other non-profit agencies can do. Robert wants to establish an agency that will help sustain the needy until financial relief is in sight, while helping to guide them on the sometimes cloudy path to recovery.

Robert has applied for the non-profit status and his website is up and running. He has celebrities awaiting in the wings for the organization to be finalized. Now he needs your support to kick start this project.    

His goal is $3000 to get the organization off to a great start. It doesn't sound like much, but it will be enough to establish the organization. In return, Robert is offering a host of incentives for each donation, including a copy of his just published book "Dust in the Wind".

There are always risks and challenges with every endeavor. Robert is ready to face them all. He has already invested a substantial amount of his own funds to create an incentive for fundraising - the book. In addition, he fronted all the necessary funds to set up the non-profit status. Now it is time to make it a reality; one that will sustain for the sake of the victims of a natural disaster.

You can help by supporting our effort and sharing this campaign with friends, family and on your social networks.  Just use the INDIEGOGO share tools.

Listen to Robert's radio interview about "Dust in the Wind" at:
http://youtu.be/vT-civzCN6M

A Portion of all Proceeds from the sale of "Dust in the Wind" goes toward the "Celebrities 4 Disaster Relief", as will future sales from Robert's upcoming book, due out this year.

Sandra Brazier and her sister are the inventors and developers of eVoiceAmerica.com. Problem: How to penetrate the many serious barriers blocking communications between the American People and their elected representatives in Washington. Applying our invention motto: “If you solve a problem for yourself, you have most likely solved it for millions of others,” we set out to solve this problem. We knew that tens of millions shared this frustration and concern, so we created eVoiceAmerica.com to solve this serious impediment to our representative democracy. 

                                       

Now we are ready to fund and launch national and regional radio ads; social media campaigns, and national television ads to inform Americans about eVoiceAmerica.com to increase its impact and begin building an organization to support it with highly qualified researchers, analysts, marketing staff, site programmers, and supervisory staff.

Site Status and Purpose

Now we need your crowdfunding contributions to systematically and methodically deconstruct the ruling, political class in DC, using the legitimate, time-honored, tools of our Democracy to do so through our patented, internet technology and in the numbers that the internet possible. Congress will know that we know what it knows: majority percentages on specific issues. eVoiceAmerica.com has been enthusiastically endorsed by these prominent political commentators

WAYNE DUPREE on September 4, 2015 at 11:51 AM

MUST SHARE!!! Power to The People! New eVoiceAmerica.com Website Holds Politicians Accountable — AWESOME! 

There is something new in the air this election cycle. It’s not just that there are eighteen (at last count) candidates running for the Republican nomination. No, there is something else; you can feel it in the political wind. There is a certain anger, a certain determination. It’s as if the people are saying, this time we are going to get it right! This time we are going to make a difference! This time we are not going to let them get away with promising us one thing and delivering quite another.

The Republican establishment is nervous.

It began with Donald Trump. No one foresaw the success of his candidacy. Now they don’t know how to stop it. Now Ben Carson is rising. Carly Fiorina is gaining strength. None of these people is establishment, candidates. The people are speaking. The people want their voices heard! They are throwing away everything to do with the Republican Party. As Trump says, the people want to make America great again, not cut backroom deals with corporations and special interests that harm America’s future.

Enter eVoiceAmerica .com, a new website built to do just that—provide power to the people, a new avenue to get YOUR opinion heard. The average voter has long complained that their elected representatives promise to listen to them, promise to uphold their views, you know, the views that got them elected.

Then, they get to Washington and do something else entirely over time. They do things like fund Obamacare, wilt in the face of Obama’s illegal immigration actions, wilt in the face of an Iran deal that will endanger your children’s future! Of course, there are exceptions, like Ted Cruz and Mike Lee. But, on average, voters are distrustful of Washington and the professional politicians that reside there, getting rich off of selling access and power. The views of the little guy just get drowned out.

eVoiceAmerica.com wants to change all that. With eVoiceAmerica, you can make sure your voice is heard. And more than-than, you can make sure your opinion counts! You can band together with other like-minded conservatives—there is power in numbers! But what eVoiceAmerica wants to do is to hold politicians accountable!

In addition to ensuring your representative acts in your interests, with eVoiceAmerica, you can learn about issues. You can contribute your opinion on any concern to the general discussion by adding resources. You can see how your politician has voted in the past on bills that matter to you and your family.

But the best thing of all with eVoiceAmerica is that you can TAKE ACTION! You can do something about the issue that bothers you. You know, that issue that keeps you up at night! You can push that button and send your opinion to your Congressman right then and there! Imagine how good that would feel! You’re an American! You have power as a voter! Isn’t it time you used it?

So check out eVoiceAmerica.com , play around with the website; learn what it has to offer. Then tell your friends! Band together and make your voice heard once and for all with eVoiceAmerica.com.
