story:
An Excerpt From Chapter Four

 

Reesa was lost in golden October. Shining maple trees bridged the concrete walk down the gentle hill. Brown-gold fallen leaves carpeted the hillside. Bright gold leaves floated toward this mottled carpet where, upon landing, they glittered like brilliant stars.

     Alone in this golden splendor, Reesa seemed unaware that she should be with her classmates. Tall, slender, and light on her feet, she danced gleefully from falling leaf to falling leaf, catching a dazzling yellow bouquet of falling stars.

I was tempted to open the door and call out to Reesa. I knew I had only seconds before I must return to the classroom or risk disruption. But I didn’t call out. I wanted Reesa to learn to line up with the class. But I also wanted her to have this sacred moment. I made one of the one thousand judgment calls a teacher in a wonder-centered school makes each day. I just waited.

     Teachers, visionaries, psychologists and politicians have long argued about the appropriate balance of work and play, of compliance and freedom at school.  Advocates of open classrooms and home schooling might argue that Reesa should have been allowed unlimited time amid swirling leaves. In contrast, those who were successful in moving standards-based education into most public school classrooms in the early years of the new millennium might counter that the allocation of an hour or more a day for play in first grade cuts into time for reading instruction.

     As a teacher in a wonder-centered classroom, my goal is to never sacrifice a moment of wonder. Yet, I know that while I work to protect each moment of awe, protecting every wondrous experience for every child in my care is ultimately impossible. I know too that the best shot at cultivating and protecting sacred moments at school is to entrust each child to teachers who are allowed to make, perhaps, one thousand judgment calls each day, who are given significant freedom in orchestrating the movement of children, dynamically balancing freedom and responsibility in each situation. Thus, the teacher demonstrates the dance itself, not just freedom, not just responsibility, but the art of living. 

A Gift of Wonder is a book for readers, parents, grandparents, teachers and those interested in protecting childhood. 

Readers will enjoy the teaching moments, the humor, and the moving story of children and a teacher growing together over six years.

Parents will gain insights about their own children as they read about the stages of childhood.  Advance readers who are grandparents are the surprise audience who love this book!

Teachers will find encouragement to let go of the lesson plan when a student looks off into the distance, raises her hand and begins to lead the class into an awe-inspiring question or observation.

Those seeking a more meaningful school experience for children will find here a story worth sharing, a vision that shows why testing and rigid standards are not the way to improve schools.

Our vision of the future of education should arise from classrooms where engaged children love to learn! 

 

1. About the Book

“If I had influence with the good fairy who is supposed to preside over the christening of all children, I should ask that her gift to each child in the world be a sense of wonder so indestructible that it would last throughout life, as an unfailing antidote to boredom and disenchantments of later years, the sterile preoccupation with things that are artificial, the alienation from the sources of our strength.”  Rachel Carson 

Children are born with the gift of wonder described by Rachel Carson. A key to parenting and to teaching is to work with this natural, inborn sense of wonder. 

During the primary school years the innocent, imaginative wonder of the six year old transforms year by year into the reality centered engagement of the preadolescent. 

“To first graders, every object, every living being has a place in a world strung together by imagination. But, soon, an acorn top would cease to be an elf’s cap. A little stone would no longer be a fairy’s smooth, rounded seat. It would become a hard, lifeless rock. And the stars of the night sky would no longer dance with the fireflies, but would turn out to be cold, distant specks. Ultimately, by third grade, my students would each perceive themselves to be in a world of discrete objects, and they would see themselves standing apart from a universe that was no longer a never-ending, benign continuity.  

Then holding a steady course toward wonder would mean that I needed to become a different kind of teacher. It would be my job to help my students forge new connections with the universe one acorn, one stone, one star at a time. Then I would explain how the amazing phenomenon of photosynthesis leads to the production of acorns. I would describe the volcanic fire and flows of lava that gave birth to the igneous rock. I would bring my students close to the nuclear reactions in the far off stars and tell them that the atoms in their own bones were formed in an ancient stellar blaze. It would be a new sort of reality-based awe that I would need to learn how to kindle when my class ceased to make their own easy connections and understandings.”  from A Gift of Wonder.

A Gift of Wonder,  A True Story Showing School As It Should Be, invites readers into our classroom as my students and I travel from grades one through six in an independent school that, according to its philosophy statement, “cultivates in the children a feeling of wonder.”

Here the curriculum was based on the developmental stages of childhood and, according to an early reader, “one of the joys of this memoir is to see how children change at different ages.” A key to raising happy, inquisitive, adaptable children at home and at school is understanding the needs of children at each age level. A Gift of Wonder travels through the territory of childhood leaving readers with an understanding that will help in parenting or teaching.   

 

A Remarkable Journey

A Gift of Wonder, A True Story About School As It Could Be is a journey into the heart of teaching, into the deepest questions we must ask ourselves as prepare children for the future. 

Looking back over my  journey with my first class, I saw that our best classroom experiences would be disallowed in most public schools today. I wanted to write this story so that parents, teachers, and  leaders involved in making decisions about the future of education could see what has been discarded in the latest version of education reforms that have focused on testing rather than teaching, on narrow curriculum goals rather than meeting the complex needs of each individual.   

A Gift of Wonder shows the baby that has been thrown out with the bathwater. 

Most books about education offer a prescription, a carefully thought out methodology. Instead, I offer a story, a tale where children offer astounding insights, enter into productive arguments, and identify with characters from history. Above all, A Gift of Wonder shows the relationships among a teacher and her students in which a teacher models attention and listening by tuning in to her students.  

The Power of Stories

As Ken Robinson says, "Teaching is a creative profession, not a delivery system.”Delivery systems can be packaged, managed and, above all, standardized and tested. In contrast, creative professions are best understood through stories.

 

As a teacher who teaches through stories, it was natural for me to use my own story as a way to help people envision education in which students are eager to go to school every day. 

My teaching story begins in my first year in the classroom. I am the first to admit that I was inexperienced and often felt a bit lost. A Gift of Wonder shows me tentatively finding my way through the stages of childhood, seeking ways to help children with their individual challenges. And, it shows the reverence, love and humor I found as I witnessed these young people maturing in my care. Along the way there is a lost kitten, a health crisis, an argument over chewed up pencil, a howl in the night, an invisible spider’s web, and a hilarious student observation about frogs.

   

2. Reviews 

A GIFT OF WONDER by Kim Allsup is a book about teaching and about being a teacher, but it is also a book with deep, real lessons of life, learning, and the wonder of children. It is transcendent and funny and rich with experience, and I only wish I could have had a teacher like Kim Allsup. Reading her book is the next best thing.  

Brent Runyon Author of The Burn Journals 

"Allsup develops the mood and after-images of her book in a way that weaves an unusually lovely cloak for us to see –– rather, a magic cloak that gives us a new perception of childhood, teaching, and education."   from the foreword by Patrice Maynard 

“In a world that tends to tell us all what to buy, what to feel, what to do, how to do it, and what to think about, Allsup’s story of a class with children who are left free to have their own experiences and express what they have discovered on their own is refreshing and moving.”  from the foreword by  Patrice Maynard, Director of Publications and Development for the Research Institute for Waldorf Education 

“What qualities and skills will enable the next few generations to meet their challenges? First, they will have to have the self-understanding to be able to discern truth from falsehood, and the self-esteem to be able to open to the truth. Second, they will have to possess the imagination to envision and develop solutions to the problems. And, finally, they’ll have to be able to lead others to effect their solutions.

Self-understanding and self-esteem are the cornerstones. How do you teach self-understanding and self-esteem? Surprisingly, the answer is neither new nor complicated. First, teachers must model wonder, such that their students feel affirmed for their natural tendency to wonder. And, second, the teachers must listen to their students without bias, such that the children feel invited and free to share their perceptions and interpretations, which is to say, to self-create. The instant an individual takes responsibility for creating the life she wishes to lead, she also begins to take responsibility for creating the world in which she can lead it." Robert Leaver, retired headmaster 

 3. Why A Gift of Wonder is important 

Today teachers are leaving public education in the United States in record numbers because rigid rules prevent them from creative, authentic teaching. One such teacher, David Xirau, penned this letter upon leaving public school teaching in Massachusetts in 2015

"Authentic teaching is done free of the restrictive standards, unattainable objectives, and insanely burdensome administrative minutiae that are imposed upon us every day. ...

What is the real cost of this extra work? Who is paying the price when our minds and energy are devoted to endless testing, development of standards and objectives, rubrics, measurement, results, analysis, DDMs, improvement plans, PLCs, "Smart" goals, evidence collecting, percentages, alignments, core curriculum, cross curriculum, accommodations, modifications, incessant IEP paperwork, meetings, data, data, data, and more data? Read the list again!! Where is the pedagogy? When do we get to teach?

Students need to be taught, not analyzed. They are human beings, not an experiment, not parts of a machine coming off of an assembly line. My students need and deserve my full attention, something I cannot give under the current circumstances." 

Recently two researchers, Mehta and Fine, discovered that, in spite of the rigid rules that govern many educators, there are teachers in most schools whose students are especially engaged and motivated. The researchers noticed that these public school teachers often bend the rules, are not afraid to go off script, that they sometimes allow the students to lead the class and that they see their students as their teachers. 

While teachers in many schools would be be stretching the rules to go off script, I taught in a Waldorf school where teachers are encouraged to create lessons that are tailored to their students and to spontaneously change plans to meet the needs of their students. A Gift of Wonder shows this creative freedom.

A Gift of Wonder reveals the secret behind the academic successes and life satisfaction reported by both students and teachers in Waldorf schools worldwide. This secret cannot be found in novel reading programs, the latest math text or a new teaching methodology. Rather, the key to nurturing highly motivated students is simple: trust the judgement of creative professionals to know when to let go of the lesson plan, when to encourage an off topic discussion, when to substitute a more relevant presentation and when to let the students lead the way.  

4.  How you can help and why your suport is vital

A Gift of Wonder  will be released by Lindisfarne Press on August 15, 2017. This means all of the work to create the book (writing, editing, design, layout and cover) has been accomplished. While many crowdfunding campaigns to support books seek funds to finish an incomplete project, A Gift of Wonder  has been brought to the publication stage without outside support.  

Your help is needed to take the last, big step -- finding readers. 

it is easy to help by sharing this campaign on social media and telling your friends about the A Gift of Wonder.

I would so appreciate for review  on Amazon, Goodreads and other sites. 

Please be among the first readers of A Gift of Wonder. Your purchase of the book through this campaign and your donations to the campaign will fund a professional publicist and advertising.

Children's experience at school can be wondrous. A Gift of Wonder can help create the paradigm shift that our children need and deserve, but this vision of schooling will reach its potential as a force for change only if readers find it.  Please help A Gift of Wonder find its readers. On behalf of the children of tomorrow, I thank you for being part of this mission to support a vision of the healthy blossoming of children at school.

A Gift of Wonder travels through the territory of childhood leaving readers with an understanding that will help in parenting or teaching.    A Remarkable JourneyA Gift of Wonder, A True Story About School As It Could Be is a journey into the heart of teaching, into the deepest questions we must ask ourselves as prepare children for the future. Looking back over my  journey with my first class, I saw that our best classroom experiences would be disallowed in most public schools today. I wanted to write this story so that parents, teachers, and  leaders involved in making decisions about the future of education could see what has been discarded in the latest version of education reforms that have focused on testing rather than teaching, on narrow curriculum goals rather than meeting the complex needs of each individual.   A Gift of Wonder shows the baby that has been thrown out with the bathwater. Most books about education offer a prescription, a carefully thought out methodology. Instead, I offer a story, a tale where children offer astounding insights, enter into productive arguments, and identify with characters from history. Above all, A Gift of Wonder shows the relationships among a teacher and her students in which a teacher models attention and listening by tuning in to her students.  The Power of StoriesAs Ken Robinson says, "Teaching is a creative profession, not a delivery system.”Delivery systems can be packaged, managed and, above all, standardized and tested. In contrast, creative professions are best understood through stories. As a teacher who teaches through stories, it was natural for me to use my own story as a way to help people envision education in which students are eager to go to school every day. My teaching story begins in my first year in the classroom. I am the first to admit that I was inexperienced and often felt a bit lost. A Gift of Wonder shows me tentatively finding my way through the stages of childhood, seeking ways to help children with their individual challenges. And, it shows the reverence, love and humor I found as I witnessed these young people maturing in my care. Along the way there is a lost kitten, a health crisis, an argument over chewed up pencil, a howl in the night, an invisible spider’s web, and a hilarious student observation about frogs.   2. Reviews A GIFT OF WONDER by Kim Allsup is a book about teaching and about being a teacher, but it is also a book with deep, real lessons of life, learning, and the wonder of children. It is transcendent and funny and rich with experience, and I only wish I could have had a teacher like Kim Allsup. Reading her book is the next best thing.  Brent Runyon Author of The Burn Journals "Allsup develops the mood and after-images of her book in a way that weaves an unusually lovely cloak for us to see –– rather, a magic cloak that gives us a new perception of childhood, teaching, and education."   from the foreword by Patrice Maynard “In a world that tends to tell us all what to buy, what to feel, what to do, how to do it, and what to think about, Allsup’s story of a class with children who are left free to have their own experiences and express what they have discovered on their own is refreshing and moving.”  from the foreword by  Patrice Maynard, Director of Publications and Development for the Research Institute for Waldorf Education “What qualities and skills will enable the next few generations to meet their challenges? First, they will have to have the self-understanding to be able to discern truth from falsehood, and the self-esteem to be able to open to the truth. Second, they will have to possess the imagination to envision and develop solutions to the problems. And, finally, they’ll have to be able to lead others to effect their solutions.Self-understanding and self-esteem are the cornerstones. How do you teach self-understanding and self-esteem? Surprisingly, the answer is neither new nor complicated. First, teachers must model wonder, such that their students feel affirmed for their natural tendency to wonder. And, second, the teachers must listen to their students without bias, such that the children feel invited and free to share their perceptions and interpretations, which is to say, to self-create. The instant an individual takes responsibility for creating the life she wishes to lead, she also begins to take responsibility for creating the world in which she can lead it." Robert Leaver, retired headmaster  3. Why A Gift of Wonder is important Today teachers are leaving public education in the United States in record numbers because rigid rules prevent them from creative, authentic teaching. One such teacher, David Xirau, penned this letter upon leaving public school teaching in Massachusetts in 2015"Authentic teaching is done free of the restrictive standards, unattainable objectives, and insanely burdensome administrative minutiae that are imposed upon us every day. ...What is the real cost of this extra work? Who is paying the price when our minds and energy are devoted to endless testing, development of standards and objectives, rubrics, measurement, results, analysis, DDMs, improvement plans, PLCs, "Smart" goals, evidence collecting, percentages, alignments, core curriculum, cross curriculum, accommodations, modifications, incessant IEP paperwork, meetings, data, data, data, and more data? Read the list again!! Where is the pedagogy? When do we get to teach?Students need to be taught, not analyzed. They are human beings, not an experiment, not parts of a machine coming off of an assembly line. My students need and deserve my full attention, something I cannot give under the current circumstances." Recently two researchers, Mehta and Fine, discovered that, in spite of the rigid rules that govern many educators, there are teachers in most schools whose students are especially engaged and motivated. The researchers noticed that these public school teachers often bend the rules, are not afraid to go off script, that they sometimes allow the students to lead the class and that they see their students as their teachers. While teachers in many schools would be be stretching the rules to go off script, I taught in a Waldorf school where teachers are encouraged to create lessons that are tailored to their students and to spontaneously change plans to meet the needs of their students. A Gift of Wonder shows this creative freedom.A Gift of Wonder reveals the secret behind the academic successes and life satisfaction reported by both students and teachers in Waldorf schools worldwide. This secret cannot be found in novel reading programs, the latest math text or a new teaching methodology. Rather, the key to nurturing highly motivated students is simple: trust the judgement of creative professionals to know when to let go of the lesson plan, when to encourage an off topic discussion, when to substitute a more relevant presentation and when to let the students lead the way.  4.  How you can help and why your suport is vitalA Gift of Wonder  will be released by Lindisfarne Press on August 15, 2017. This means all of the work to create the book (writing, editing, design, layout and cover) has been accomplished. While many crowdfunding campaigns to support books seek funds to finish an incomplete project, A Gift of Wonder  has been brought to the publication stage without outside support.  Your help is needed to take the last, big step -- finding readers. it is easy to help by sharing this campaign on social media and telling your friends about the A Gift of Wonder.I would so appreciate for review  on Amazon, Goodreads and other sites. Please be among the first readers of A Gift of Wonder. Your purchase of the book through this campaign and your donations to the campaign will fund a professional publicist and advertising.Children's experience at school can be wondrous. A Gift of Wonder can help create the paradigm shift that our children need and deserve, but this vision of schooling will reach its potential as a force for change only if readers find it.  Please help A Gift of Wonder find its readers. On behalf of the children of tomorrow, I thank you for being part of this mission to support a vision of the healthy blossoming of children at school.

story:
TV, Eh?: The Next Step

Two years ago, you were gracious and supportive enough to help launch TV, Eh? 2.0. Now we're back and looking to move to the next level of Canadian television coverage!

Greg David has been covering the Canadian television industry for two decades, first at TV Guide Canada and then over the last two years at TV, eh? After two years of interviews, set visits, episode reviews, feature stories, podcast recordings, live tweets and off-the-record chats, he's ready to take TV, eh? to the next level.

With your help, we can continue to showcase Canadian television, a true labour of love. 

What are Greg's plans?

Glad you asked! Greg's plans include:

  • Upgrade technology to shoot video and audio with updated equipment. That means a dedicated camera that isn't just an iPhone and Snowball microphone.
  • Enroll in production and photography courses and learn to make our videos look professional.
  • Travel to Canadian television industry events and attend government hearings to give readers more intensive reporting on the Canadian television industry.
  • Build a travel budget for set visits. We want to expand our reach outside of Southern Ontario and get exclusive access to homegrown television projects filming beyond the 416 and 905.
  • Pay freelancers who are currently contributing to the website for free.

We're looking for $5,000 to help us reach these goals within the next year. All funds raised will go towards the goals listed above and sustaining the current content you enjoy. We want TV, eh? to succeed and with your help, we can!

Why do we want to do this?

Quite simply, we're the only website in Canada or around the world where the mandate is to ONLY focus on this country's television industry. We're fiercely proud of this fact and want to continue to do it. 

Other ways you can help

Any amount is appreciated and will go toward running the site and funding original content. We also appreciate anything you can do to help spread the word ... about this fundraising campaign, TV, eh?  or even your joy in Canadian programming.

story:
For over 40 years, Stelarc has been pushing the physical, conceptual, and technological boundaries of the body. His work has inspired and awed people the world over, and given many a new perspective on what the body means, where it begins and, indeed, ends. His first book Obsolete Body was published in 1984 as a compilation of Stelarc's suspension performances, it is now a very rare and expensive book to come by. But Obsolete Body, while the source of many people's inspiration, does not tell the whole story or contain a complete record of Stelarc's suspension performances. After its publication, Stelarc continued and expanded his work, and those performances have never been seen in print.

Aquí puedes leer el texto en Español: Stretched Skin – un libro de Stelarc.

When PS Media approached Stelarc to suggest that we could run a new edition of Obsolete Body, his immediate response was that it would be more interesting to publish a new book that contains a complete presentation of his suspension performances, as well as new articles and a different selection of images. We agreed immediately! It is with great pride and joy that we can now announce that PS Media will publish Stelarc's new book: Stretched Skin—Obsolete, Uncertain and Indifferent Body.

Stretched Skin will focus on Stelarc's suspension performances—from the very first in 1976 to the most recent in in 2012, including the collaborations with Håvve Fjell and Wings of Desire in 2012 and 2013. The book will also contain some of Stelarc's other performances; where they have direct relevance to, or lead up to, the suspension series.

Stretched Skin will be a work of art in itself. It is a book on art by an artist, with layout and design by our award winning team. PS Media takes great pride in publishing high quality books. Our choice of printer and materials is made with careful consideration to professional and ethical standards, so that our customers receive a high quality work that they will be proud to own and display in the years to come.  

 

Who are PS Media

PS Media was established to publish documentation on the work of Pain Solution and Wings of Desire. As it has become an established part of the Pain Solution enterprise, ambitions have grown and we are broadening our scope to include future publications within the realm of Body Modification, Body Art, Sideshow, and Body Suspension. Our aim is to keep our focus on our own communities first and let our reach spread organically from there. As an independent and passionate publisher with little capital, we rely on support from our community to help us create works that we and our readers want to own.

Håvve Fjell is the founder of PS Media and Pain Solution, the renowned performance troupe in which he has been the driving force, performing all over the world, for 25 years. Håvve is a pioneer in the European Suspension community and has contributed to the education of body suspension practitioners on five continents.

Helene Fjell is the co-founder of PS Media and award winning photographer. Without her photography, there would not have been a viable starting point for our publications. While not all of the future publications will be based on her photos, Helene provides quality assurance for all of our photos—both in publications and for promotion.

June Ailin Bonsaksen is PS Media’s backbone. As our production manager, June keeps everything together and make sure that order prevails. In addition to keeping our metaphorical wheels on the rails, June is the administrative engine at the heart of Pain Solution where she manages websites, merchandise, book orders, volunteer crews, Wings of Desire suspension events and PS Media projects with style and grace.

Alan Louis Belardinelli is an American expatriate living in Oslo who has long and varied experience working with communications. Alan edited our previous books: Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly and To Bleed or Not To Bleed, and has a knack for leaving the author’s voice as intact as possible while making sure that grammar is being reasonably respected and that sense is still being made.

Trine + Kim Design Studio have been working with Pain Solution since 2007 using their exceptional talent and creativity to carve out a distinct visual profile for the company. Since their start in 1999, they have worked tirelessly producing work for some of Norway’s most notable bands, artists, theaters, galleries, and publishers. 

Marte Maritdatter is the newest member of PS Media, hired as campaign coordinator for this pre-sale campaign. Marte has been a performing artist in Pain Solution since 2007, where her tasks besides presenting staggering stunts on stage, are anything from accounting to producing events. She is also a competent seamstress, creating costumes, props and merchandise.

 

Perks!

The perks will naturally focus on the book itself. In this campaign, you will get great discounts compared to the retail price after the campaign ends. The discounts are even better if you choose to buy in bulk; depending on quantity, you can get up to a 35% discount! We will send out all the perks without any added shipping cost! How is this an offer you can refuse?

In addition to signed and numbered copies of Stretched Skin you can get your hands on our previous publications by PS Media at reduced rates, neat Stelarc postcards and signed posters! Who knows, we might have some special items saved for later so stay tuned! And remember, you can get more than one Perk! All Perks will be shipped by December 2017.

Why we need you

We need you because you need us! It’s a give and get relationship, where you give us what we need so you can get what you want! In other words, supporting our campaign allows us to produce this beautiful book.

How you can help us

There are many ways to help us out besides the obvious financial support! Spreading the word is crucial. We need all the help we can get reaching out to all the right people. We are over the moon excited about this book—maybe you are too? Let's let the world know it! Share the campaign, write a blog post, or leave us a comment here!

Book release

Stretched Skin will be released on November 18th 2017 at the 3rd International Body Suspension Symposium in Berlin

The Symposium will have a full program of lectures, classes, exhibitions, and performances over three days. Saturday, November 18th will be mainly devoted to Stelarc—featuring an open lecture, the official book release, and a performance collaboration by Stelarc and Håvve Fjell.

story:
Making The Case for the NEA and NEH

President Donald Trump stands ready to eliminate the National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) and the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH), those two grand old battleships which have supported a broad range of arts and humanities projects since 1965. The combined 2016 budget of the NEA and NEH stood at just $296 million in 2016 – a mere fraction (to be precise, .003 %) of the $3.8 trillion federal budget, the latter incorporating more than $600 billion in military spending.

Although cutting funds to the NEA and NEH won't make the slightest difference when it comes to balancing the federal budget, it will make an enormous – in many ways, crippling – difference when it comes to many vital cultural institutions.

My friend Claiborne Pell – then Senator from my adopted home state of Rhode Island – was the principal sponsor of the bill which created the NEA and NEH in 1965. It is with Clai in mind that I am now writing, on a fast schedule, a full history of the NEA and NEH since their founding. The book is to be a chronicle of how much has been achieved and created which would not have ever existed had the NEA and NEH not been there to provide support.

The book will include testimonials from artists and scholars at instiutions and organizations large and small for whom NEA and NEH funding has proved vital to the origination of truly great work.

When the book is done, I will have 100 copies earmarked as gifts for each and every member of the Senate. This is what the $1000 is for. Any additional sum raised will be used  for free distribution to policy makers beyond the Senate. I will also make the eBook edition available for free download to anyone who might wish to read the text (and hopefully redistribute it to friends, colleagues, and local political leaders).

The need is urgent. Time is of the essence. I intend to have the book out by the end of May.

I'll be dedicating the book to the memory of Claiborne and Nuala Pell.

 

My Credentials

I am the author of numerous books including The Kennedys at War (Doubleday), Dark Genius of Wall Street (Basic), The Secret Six (Crown), and The Lion's Pride (Oxford University Press). I am also the proprietor of a [very] small publishing company, New Street Communications, through which I shall publish the NEA/NEH book. Additionally, I have written for the Wall Street Journal, the San Francisco Chronicle, Hearst's Veranda, and other publications.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the rudiments:

  • I'm looking for $1000 to fund the distribution of 100 copies to members of the United States Senate.
  • There are some cool perks. Check 'em out.
  • Should we not reach the $1000 goal, we'll use whatever funds gained to distribute as as many copies of the book as possible.  ;-)

 

The Impact

Information is powerful. Truth is a hammer. There is no better argument for continued funding of the NEA and NEH than a full chronicle of these organizations' successes in providing indispensable funding to thousands of  crucial arts and humanities endeavors through the years.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pass on word of this effort to friends and colleagues.
  • If you are an artist, writer, scholar, dancer, sculptor, or painter who has benefited from NEA or NEH funding, consider writing a brief testimonial for inclusion in the book. The same invitation stands for representatives and employees of institutions who have benefited.

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for reading!

story:
Hi, I’m Dave Rasnick, PhD

The past 21 years I have studied cancer from a completely new perspective. Prior to that, I worked in the pharmaceutical/biotech industries developing drugs against cancer, emphysema, arthritis, and parasites. 

Background

Almost everyone has some relationship to cancer. The public’s dread of cancer today is equal to the fear of plague in the Middle Ages. This is not surprising given the history of scientific research in this area. It is critically important for all of us to have the ability to make sense of a disease that afflicts our lives. My aim is to provide clarity to a topic that can be overwhelming—even to scientists—and, in the process, replace fear (as much as possible) with the power of knowledge. The only way to do this is to truly understand how cancer starts and develops in order to prevent it and come up with effective treatments that are not harmful.

Six years ago I published a highly technical book on cancer

Click the link below to access the Table of Contents, Preface (which discusses the war on cancer and the problems with cancer research in the United States since 1970), and the Index.

http://www.davidrasnick.com/ewExternalFiles/Ras...

Now I'm making this information accessible to the public by ‘translating’ it into common language.

Precarious Balance—What cancer REALLY IS!

My new book is a version for you, the general reader. When I began writing in 2014, it was fairly simple to put into plain language this new understanding of cancer and how to deal with this dreaded disease. This is certainly of immense importance, but a friend and highly regarded author recently told me it is only half the story. He bluntly said I had to put more of my story in the book. Following what turned out to be great advice, I rewrote Chapter 1. It was a magical, transformative experience—the chapter seemed to write itself!

To get the flavor of what’s in store, you can download a draft of CHAPTER 1—THE MAKING OF AN OUTSIDER by clicking on the link below.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/idkwieawhn88wfg/Chapt...

During the first half of my professional life I was as mainstream a chemist as one can be. That began to change in the mid 1980s when I started asking questions about AIDS. The result was a slow, but ever declining confidence in the institutions of science. My book begins by telling how I became an outsider in my profession, and how joining forces with an equally independent minded and very distinguished scientist led to this most important scientific discovery: the progression of chromosomal imbalance is, in fact, cancer! This understanding continues to clarify everything we know about cancer!

Here’s a sampling from the book:

  1. Only massive unbalanced changes in chromosomes have the power to cause cancer.
  2. Anything that produces unbalanced chromosomes in living cells is a carcinogen. 
  3. The book explains why it can take many years to several decades for a tumor to appear after exposure to carcinogens, with ‘fast’ cancer being diagnosed after it has already been progressing for a long time. Fast, in this sense, is like watching only the last mile of a marathon race.
  4. Unbalanced chromosomes are unstable, which explains why no two cancer cells have the same assortment of chromosomes. In this regard, cancer cells are like snow flakes: no two are identical. This poses an insurmountable problem for drug development since there is no typical cancer cell for drugs to target.
  5. Unbalanced chromosomes provide an objective and quantitative measure for the detection of cancer, enabling the accurate monitoring of its progression and regression.
  6. The book explains why on occasion cancer can go away without any treatment at all. (Spontaneous remission is major interest of mine I hope to research in the future.)
  7. The book also explains the well documented cases of high fever curing people of different types of cancer. 
  8. This new understanding of cancer strongly supports treatment alternatives to radiation and chemotherapy.

In short, the chromosomal imbalance theory is the most comprehensive, productive, and satisfying explanation of cancer and all its characteristics.

As you can see, this is not just another cancer book! It really is a new, all encompassing way of understanding cancer and what to do about it. It can help you, your family, and your friends make better informed choices. It can be beneficial even if cancer does not enter your life.

Use of Funds

I have completed a full draft of this new book. With your support, I will be able to refine the manuscript to make sure it has the widest possible appeal and readership by livening it up with anecdotes and personal stories. I estimate this will take no more than 6 months.

Since illustrations will be key to understanding, I also need support for an artist who can not only add ‘fun’ to ‘facts’ but, more importantly, make difficult concepts transparent through the use of images.  

Risks & Challenges

My book clarifies everything about cancer. We accomplished this by reviving, elaborating, and finally proving an old theory that cancer is a disease of the chromosomes. Everything follows from that. Consequently, as this new understanding is different from the current theory of cancer, there will be people who might find it difficult to appreciate. 

BUT, THIS BOOK IS MEANT FOR YOU!

Since my new book challenges current ideas, the manuscript must be as lucid, compelling and perfectly illustrated as possible for a publisher to easily understand it and confidently support it. I have contacted potential agents who are interested. At this point, I cannot give a precise date as to when the book will be published. I already have two published books under my belt so I know what it takes. My goal is to get Precarious Balance— What cancer REALLY IS! into your hands before the end of this year. 

Additional Information

If you would like to learn more about me, the concepts discussed above, and much more, please visit my website http://www.davidrasnick.com/index.html. There is a ton of information on it. Just so you know, I’m in the process of rebuilding it, so please have patience. It will have a new and improved look soon.

Also    https://www.facebook.com/thenatureofcancer/

Finally, if you made it this far and find yourself moved to spread the word, please pass along the link of this crowd funding campaign to anyone you think could be interested.

Thanks from a Grateful Outsider,

Dave

story:
A Quick Look at the Accordion Babes

This is a fun project to support if you have an accordion lover in your life or if the accordion is the love of your life. It's a 2019 calendar perfect for music rooms and music-themed homes. The photos are not just sexy, they are shot in a classic pin-up style which invites you to imagine the stories behind the images.  Each month of the calendar features an accordion and a beautiful woman.

There are clips of all the photos in the 2019 Accordion Babes Calendar in the campaign video so you can see how we portray ourselves in our pin-ups. You can also check out the thumbnail preview below. I went for a pink-haired, gritty superhero image this year.

I've been a professional accordionist since 2001, playing everything from street shows to big festivals, solo and with bands. I love organizing this calendar because accordion has brought so much fun into my life and it feels good to spread the word that this instrument still thrives in the modern world. Publishing the Accordion Babes Pin-Up Calendar has brought me in touch with many talented indie musicians, who inspire me to keep working hard at bringing more art into the world.

This calendar is a much-needed splash of culture and fun in crazy times. Every month our pictures remind people that life is still beautiful and pretty amusing, too. In a world that just seems to care if women look thin, rich, and pretty, we provide an important inspiration and counter-example of what real sexiness is, and how it's connected to joy, bravery, art... and accordions.

The Accordion Babes CD has fun music, from ska to electronic, to jazz and folk, Cajun, blues, rock, tango, polka, Brazilian pop, a big variety of styles which you don't usually hear on the radio. The album has a bunch of great grooves which are ideal for workouts.

The Prizes

You can get single calendars, or multiple calendars with a discount, or you can order a complete set of the 2010-2019 editions. There are also four advertising spots on the last page, where businesses can show their support... this type of sponsorship comes with ten free calendars.  For a smaller donation, you can get a poster of an Accordion Babe mailed to you from one of our back-issue calendars. We will give grateful shout-outs online to all of our backers, no donation is too small.

Social media shares are crucial to making this fundraiser work so don't feel bad if all you can give is a "share". The more people who share the campaign, in a short amount of time, the better our odds are at getting fully funded. Please post the link on your favorite social media platforms and accordion forums.

The Plan

We're aiming to print the 2019 Accordion Babes Calendar in early August. Costs to cover include: print cost of 1500 calendars, cost of 1500 CDs in white paper sleeves, fee for mastering the album, fee for graphics layout, taxes, postage, mailers, and wages for our mailing crew.

We need about $7000 for the print run and to cover the cost of mailing out the pre-ordered calendars. We need about $6,000 to cover the basic print cost.

If we are able to print the Accordion Babes 2019 calendar this summer, we are setting up for a wider distribution in record shops and bookstores in the fall. An August print date helps us spread our accordion-loving counter-culture message a lot farther. 

If we fall short of our financial goal, the plan is to still go to press in August, with reduced volume if necessary. In that case, we will raise the rest of the mailing money with calendar pre-sales to individuals and shops.  The calendar delivery date is set for September to allow us the time to organize the mail and to raise the needed funds to cover all costs (if needed). This project has been on-going since 2008... before crowdfunding platforms became popular. We were able to fund the entire Accordion Babes print-run with advertising and pre-sales in the first six years of production so this back-up plan is a well-tested one. If this fundraiser is 100% funded, we'll ship out the prizes in mid-August when the calendars are hot off the press. We will also toast our backers and celebrate into the wee hours with grateful accordion tunes.

Thanks for reading up on the project and thanks for your help. You can find out more about the Accordion Babes Pin-up Calendar on our website: accordionpinupcalendar.com

 

- by Accordion Babes Editor/Producer Renee de la Prade

story:
About Angst:

A lot of fantasy books are hero stories. Most of them are about young people with great power and potential but no direction. They meet an old wizard who sends them on a path to become a hero. Angst is the guy who got passed up for all of that. He's in his 40s, going through a midlife crisis, and knows the only way he can be happy is to be a hero - a knight in shining armor. This is a 'be careful what you wish for' story as Angst drags his reluctant friends on A Midlife Crisis in Medieval Times.

About this series:

Angst is a fantasy series for readers who enjoy good humor with relateable characters. Readers have posted over 250 reviews across Amazon and Goodreads, written songs, and created artwork based on this series. The final book in the Angst series will be published in 4th quarter of 2018.

About the audiobook:

Michael Troughton has agreed to be the narrator for Angst. Troughton’s acting career is impressive, appearing in over 70 shows and movies. He’s been an actor, writer, and teacher for over 35 years. Michael is also the son of Patrick Troughton, the 2nd Doctor Who. 

 

About funding:

Pre-ordering the audiobook, or any of the perks, is a great way to help fund production costs. Should funding go past goal, that money will be put towards producing the second Angst audiobook, Buried in Angst. By participating in this campaign, you are helping me fund the best narrator.

About timing:

Mr. Troughton plans on completing the Angst audiobook in December 2018.

About Parkinson's:

As many of you know, I was diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease in July 2017. Throughout the year, I've been donating a portion of my sales made at conventions to the Michael J. Fox Foundation. I truly believe they are working hard to come up with a cure, and honestly, I really want a cure. With that in mind, I will be donating 5% of every dollar received for this campaign to the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research. By participating in my indiegogo, you will be helping me in more ways than one.

About shipping:

Ugh! When are we getting teleporters, really? Shipping anything, especially overseas, is not cheap. For large shipments of books, the United States cost is based on media rate. International rates are USPS ground. Unfortunately that means waiting up to 21 days. I intend to ship everything at once, which means that you may have to wait until the fifth book is complete. A lot of items, like shirts and hats, should ship well before deadline. Several perks are set for December 2018, but that's not definitive if it's a perk that includes book 5. If you prefer something faster, or a split shipment, please ask. (See the Contact me section below.)

About downloadable content:

The Angst audiobook will be made available via a link that you can access on your computer or gifted to you through Audible; Amazon ebooks will be gifted to you for your Kindle.  If you purchase physical copies of the audiobook, domestic shipping is included with your order. Please feel free to message me with any questions. (See the Contact me section below.)

Contact me:

If you have any questions about perks, feel free to contact me at any time. Indiegogo is a great service, but there are limitations to the information I can share. Seriously, there are no stupid questions. You can email me at david at gotangst.com. You can also message me on Twitter or Facebook.

Thank you:

Thank you for your consideration, this wouldn't be possible without your suppport.

story:
STORY

Lola The Ladybug is the story of a young girl who is bullied because of her differences but with the help of her best friend, realizes that these differences aren’t bad and instead should be embraced and shared with the world! 

OVERVIEW

Lola The Ladybug aims to inspire children to recognize their own beauty, and to wholeheartedly embrace their individuality by taking pride in their differences. This book highlights positive thinking, reminding children to be caring and compassionate to one another; while encouraging kids to foster positive and supportive relationships.

The Lola Team wants to share this story with the world in hope that other parents and teachers can take a stand with us against bullying, and to promote positive environments for children inside and out of classroom.

MISSION

Your gift will go towards the Lola School Tour and multinational movement! We’re gearing up, with your help, to reach out to underprivileged children in elementary schools with our original music performance “Lola The Ladybug Live” starring J. Alex Brinson!

Take a stand against bullying and preorder your book today!

#ReadersAreLeaders

NOTE FROM THE AUTHOR

Hi! I'm Sarah Brinson and I believe that every child should know that what makes them different is what them powerful and beautiful.

When I was a kid, I was always trying to be what I thought other people wanted me to be in order to fit in – it led to a very stressful and damaging perspective of my self and self worth which took years to unlearn. Through the help of my amazing husband and the community of people we surrounded ourselves with, I was able to do it – I was able to embrace what made me quirky, socially awkward, empathetic, and caring.

Key 'Lola the Ladybug' Learning Points: 

  • Believe and own your differences and the right people will come into your life.
  • Shift your focus from trying to fit in to finding your own individual path. 
  • There is only one YOU! You are unique -- born an original.  
  • When you embrace what makes you different, you unleash a power within that effects the world around you.

Thank you for supporting and believing in me and in this story.

Join the movement! #BeDifferent

 

The 'LOLA' Performance School Tour

COST BREAKDOWN

All gifts above your $25.00 signed pre-order will go toward the creation of an original Hamilton like musical performance by J. Alex Brinson himself. This process will include the development and creation of an original script, score, lyrics, and choreography which will be taken into schools for FREE!!! 

  • 2 week creation residency - where the script and music will be written during this time. 
    • Musical Director + Composer. 
    • Director 
    • Tour Managers and production personel.
    • Cast + Tour Musicians.
    • Rehearsal Space. 
  • Lola School Tour LA office set up. 
    • 6 week administration for school bookings and logistics. 
    • Event Management + Coordination. 
    • Marketing + Design. 
    • Film Production Crew.
  • Lola the Ladybug LIVE Tour. 
    • Cast/Crew Transportation
    • Cast/Crew Hospitality
    • Cast/Crew Food
    • Cast/Crew Expenses.
  • Event Management Platform Fees. 

TIMELINE

Sept. 1st

Launching the Lola The Ladybug Campagin

Printing Lola The Ladybug

Setting Up Lola The Ladybug Tour

Oct. 1st

Close Campaign

Deliver/Ship Perks

Opening of the Lola The Ladybug LA Office

Rehearsals Begin for Lola The Ladybug Tour

Nov. 1st

Deliver Books to Backers!

Lola The Ladybug Tour Begins!

 

THE TEAM

J. Alex Brinson is an Executive Producer for GB Group Creative and an advocate for reading and life long learning. Brinson, a proud Juilliard alumni, stars in the hit series Netflix's “Travelers” and is thrilled to join the live action musical tour of "Lola the Ladybug." Entrenched in a West Philadelphia neighborhood riddled with prejudice, poverty, and passivity, J. Alex Brinson's single mother sought to give her dyslexic son the best life possible. J wants to help other children like himself embrace their individuality and share it with the world! 

Sarah Brinson is a proud graduate of New York University, has originated numerous successful businesses, and is the Author and creative mind behind all that is Lola the Ladybug. Lola is a story dear to her heart as she has found nothing is more imperative to one's journey than finding and embracing the uniqueness in oneself. Furthermore, Sarah aims to help create a safe environment for individuals to explore their individuality. With this in mind the Lola the Ladybug was created to help YOU find your greatness!

Joel Sturrock is an actor, dancer and award winning choreographer and producer. An alumnus of Canada's Royal Winnipeg Ballet School and the Canadian College of Performing Arts, he completed a choreography mentorship under Artistic Director Jacques Lemay (Artistic Director '88 Olympics & Creative Advisor 2011 Vancouver Olympics), and has since worked across North America and Europe as a writer, performer, choreographer, dance consultant and movement coach. He co-created, choreographed and production designed the award winning 'The True Heroines' web series (now streaming on Hulu Plus) being named 'What to Watch' in USA Today. Most recently he was the movement consultant for Start Trek: Beyond starring Idris Elba and Chris Pine. 


 

Philip Kuehn is a bassist, arranger, composer and educator who has performed professionally with Wynton Marsalis, Harry Connick Jr., Jonathan Batiste, Branford Marsalis, Carl Allen, Rodney Jones,  Khristian Dentley of Take 6, Cyrille Aimee, Anthony Hamilton, Dr. Billy Taylor and Roy Hargrove, among others. Formerly the regular bassist for Jonathan Batiste’s groups, including the “Stay Human” band, Philip has made several guest appearances on the Late Show with Steven Colbert. Five of Philip’s arrangements for strings and choir appear on “Christmas with Jon Batiste”, featuring artists such as Aloe Blacc, Judith Hill, Sean Jones, and Jason Marsalis. His arrangements have been featured on CBS. The album placed #3 on the Billboard Jazz chart, and #1 on the Heatseeker's chart. He has also recorded with Cyrille Aimee, Khristian Dentley, Kirk Whalum, Justin Kauflin. He carries Bachelor's and Master's Degrees from the Juilliard School in Jazz Studies, and currently lives in Ephraim, Utah with his wife and three children, where he is the Director of Jazz Studies at Snow College.

Annika Nyberg, born and raised in Singapore, she now calls Vancouver, BC home. Nyberg is an Associate Producer for GB Group Creative. A proud graduate of the University of British Columbia. She manages and facilitates all projects with all team members across North America to make "Lola The Ladybug" book and tour possible! She wants to see change in the world and believes that the message of Lola the Ladybug will empower young children to read, learn and to embrace their individuality.

Noel Knostman is an aspiring Creative Director, a recent graduate of Point Park University and a proud Acting For Dancers alumni! Noel was part of the team that brought the WinterMix and SummerMix events to life and could not be more excited about this new project. Noel with an eye for detail, a desire to help others and a passion for all things creative is our go to gal for all the logistics of spreading Lola's message. Undoubtedly, she feels passionately about the power of storytelling and hopes to help shape a new generation of caring and artistic thinkers with the Help of “Lola the Ladybug”.

Tasnia Siddique as the VP of People and Culture at GB Group Creative is an integral part of keeping the team cohesive, efficient while has a heart for helping others. On a daily basis Tasnia exemplifies the true meaning behind the story of the Lola the Ladybug, as she encourages the GB Group Creative team to be the best versions of themselves they can be. She is passionate about people; positive change and she can't wait to share the story of Lola with the world.

STORYLola The Ladybug is the story of a young girl who is bullied because of her differences but with the help of her best friend, realizes that these differences aren’t bad and instead should be embraced and shared with the world! OVERVIEWLola The Ladybug aims to inspire children to recognize their own beauty, and to wholeheartedly embrace their individuality by taking pride in their differences. This book highlights positive thinking, reminding children to be caring and compassionate to one another; while encouraging kids to foster positive and supportive relationships.The Lola Team wants to share this story with the world in hope that other parents and teachers can take a stand with us against bullying, and to promote positive environments for children inside and out of classroom.MISSIONYour gift will go towards the Lola School Tour and multinational movement! We’re gearing up, with your help, to reach out to underprivileged children in elementary schools with our original music performance “Lola The Ladybug Live” starring J. Alex Brinson!Take a stand against bullying and preorder your book today!#ReadersAreLeadersNOTE FROM THE AUTHORHi! I'm Sarah Brinson and I believe that every child should know that what makes them different is what them powerful and beautiful.When I was a kid, I was always trying to be what I thought other people wanted me to be in order to fit in – it led to a very stressful and damaging perspective of my self and self worth which took years to unlearn. Through the help of my amazing husband and the community of people we surrounded ourselves with, I was able to do it – I was able to embrace what made me quirky, socially awkward, empathetic, and caring.Key 'Lola the Ladybug' Learning Points: 
Believe and own your differences and the right people will come into your life.
Shift your focus from trying to fit in to finding your own individual path. 
There is only one YOU! You are unique -- born an original.  
When you embrace what makes you different, you unleash a power within that effects the world around you.
Thank you for supporting and believing in me and in this story.Join the movement! #BeDifferent

story:
En español más abajo. :)

Who am I?

Most people know me as Lucha. I have been living in several places throughout my life (UK, USA, Germany) and I have been fortunate to travel all around. Nowadays I work as translator/writer. I cannot put into words how much I love my job. 

What is this campaign about?

Palestine (as well as  Syria) holds a special place in my heart, hence I have decided to volunteer with Project Hope in beautiful Nablus (Northern region of the West Bank) in the Occupied Territories of Palestine for two months. I will be teaching English in some schools and refugee camps. As well as I will be doing some other workshops to improve the kids education. 

Project Hope is a NGO that have a long history of providing education and a window to the outer world for Palestinian young adults and children that cannot travel, and that have suffered greatly specially so during the 2012 attacks. Due to Israel´s restrictions volunteers are not allowed into occupied Palestine and neither is school supplies and educational equipment. That is the main reason why through fundraising we are able to buy all that is necessary once we are there. I personally will be buying the school supplies with the help of the NGO to provide the tools for these children. 

Here are the lists by Project Hope of some of the things they need:

English Program Wish List: http://amzn.com/w/3EJJ43V70YRGZ

French Program Wish List- http://amzn.com/w/7TNFYR8I727F

Art Program Wish List- http://amzn.com/w/3TTBE9BY4LHV

Here you have the NGO´s link if you would like more information http://projecthope.ps/

This is why I am asking you to help me raise the money to buy the educational equipment for the children and the schools. 

Anything that you can possibly donate is of great help and you can also share this and help me out spreading the word. 

 

Thank you! Mucho love!

Lucia

¿Quién soy?

Mucha gente me conoce como Lucha.  He vivido en distintos lugares durante mi vida (EEUU, Reino Unido, Alemania) y he tenido la gran fortuna de poder viajar sin parar. Trabajo como traductora/redactora. No puedo expresar con palabras lo mucho que disfruto de mi trabajo. Cuando no estoy trabajando o viajando, me dedico a llevar a cabo proyectos de voluntariado especialmente con niños. 

¿De qué trata esta campaña?

Palestina (al igual que Siria) ocupa un lugar especial en mi corazón, es por ello que he decidido trabajar como voluntaria en Nablus (al norte de Cisjordania) en los Territorios Ocupados de Palestina, durante dos meses. Con la ONG Project Hope. Mi labor será la de dar clases de inglés, en colegios y campos de refugiados así como llevar a cabo otros talleres que fomenten el desarrollo y la educación de los chavales. 

Project Hope es una ONG tiene una larga y reconocida historia en Cisjordania, y en toda Palestina por proporcionar no sólo educación a muchas chicas y chicos, si no también de ofrecerles una ventana cultural al mundo, puesto que ellos no pueden viajar. De ahí su importancia y más desde los ataques de 2012. Debido a las restricciones israelíes, los voluntarios y cooperantes no tienen acceso a Gaza y Cisjordania, y tampoco se puede transportar material escolar hasta estos puntos. 

Es por esto que a través de campañas de recaudación de fondos, como ésta, se consigue el dinero para que una vez consiga llegar a Nablus, pueda con ayuda de Project Hope comprar todos los materiales didácticos necesarios. 

Aquí os adjunto unas listas que PH ha puesto a disposición en su página web http://projecthope.ps/

English Program Wish List: http://amzn.com/w/3EJJ43V70YRGZ

French Program Wish List- http://amzn.com/w/7TNFYR8I727F

Art Program Wish List- http://amzn.com/w/3TTBE9BY4LHV

Por eso os pido vuestra ayuda con cualquier aportación, grande o pequeña, para poder ayudar a estos chicos, porque creo fehacientemente que la única forma de erradicar los conflictos con sus consabidos flujos de mareas humanas y crisis humanitarias; es a través de la EDUCACIÓN.

Podéis también  compartir en vuestras redes sociales esta campaña...y conseguir que más gente se una con un fin común. 

Os estoy eternamente agradecida. 

 

Lucha

story:
The Story

Inspired by true events, 'The Memory of Chiffon' is a poignant story of discovery and loss, family and forgetting, mythical creatures and travel adventures. But mostly it is a story of recipes and love. 

'The Memory of Chiffon' tells the story of Cate, whose personal life is in crisis. Recently divorced and having just lost her job, Cate decides to take her daughter, who believes in mythical creatures, and her mother who has Alzheimer's, on a journey to interesting and alluring countries around  the world, retracing a trip she took with her parents when she was a little girl. Along the way, Cate discovers her past and finds herself, through her adventures and her mother's old recipe books.

As an author, and having lost my mother to Alzheimers, writing 'The Memory of Chiffon' is going to be one of the most important things I will ever do in my life. It is a personal journey but also fictional tale of exploration, hope and the 'ugly-beautiful' that comes with living with someone with Alzheimers. And it's one I know I need to share - because while there is a lot of information about Alzheimer's disease out there, none of it really tell you how it feels. How it feels for you, the person whose mother has Alzheimer's. Or how it feels for her, the woman whose life has become a deeply disturbing and unfathomable place. A mother whose mind has become unrecognisable to her. None of them tell you what to do with those feelings. None of them tell you how harrowing Alzheimer's really is, how much time and patience it takes, how deeply it impacts the lives of everyone in a family. How heartbreakingly destructive it is.  

So thank you for sharing my writing and this experience with me. Your support will help me help others who need hope in their journey to love and live with someone with Alzheimers. 

 

The Rewards

The pre-orders of the book that you make will help fund my research and writing process over the next 10 months, and give the book the distribution demand it requires to be taken up by a publishing house. By supporting this campaign, you will get the pre-release to the book before its official launch date. And you could even get involved in the novel by participating in choosing the name of a character.

As the campaign is based on pre-orders, the funding limit doesn't impact the success of the campaign. I will write this book, no matter what happens with this funding campaign - it just may take me a bit longer without the funding required for research and writing. But you can be assured that you will always get the rewards you choose, and I will keep you updated every step of the way!

 

Ways I Need Your Help

Apart from the funding, 'The Memory of Chiffon' also needs awareness and support in so many other ways. So, I would really appreciate your help in sharing this campaign with your friends and family who love adventure, travel, baking - or anyone you know who loves someone who is suffering from Alzheimers - through this Indiegogo campaign, our Facebook page or website.

story:
Short Summary

Inspirience is a unique book on unbound meditation that takes us beyond our ideas of meditation, what we have inherited through teachings, and brings us to the body's perspective. Ultimately, meditation is born of the body, and when the principle of the is followed meditation takes on a whole new depth, becoming the vehicle that takes us to the place of transformation.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Inspirience  needs $2000 for copy-editing, proofing, cover design, and launch promotion.
  • Perks include the inclusion of your name as a contributor in the published work, autographed hard copies, kindle, and audio editions of Isness Meditation as well as the current best selling title, The Unbound Soul, seminars by author, and personal mentoring to name a few.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will prioritize funds for copy-editing, proofing, and cover design, with launch promotion coming in last. By contributing, you are including your energy in a positive, transformative project.

The Impact

  • Finally there will be a simple, direct, non-dogmatic, non-traditional, approach to awakening that is only about you and the transcendent. It is simple, practical and extremely transformative. There is simply no other book like it.
  • My first campaign was in 2015, which resulted in the overwhelmingly successful title The Unbound Soul: A spiritual memoir for personal transformation and enlightenment. It a best seller in more than 10 spirituality categories on Amazon, and has over 75 percent rave reviews.
  • This project will transform your life, and through you, it will touch everyone around you. Personal transformation is the only true, lasting way to make a positive change in the world. Let's make a change!

Risks & Challenges

The rough draft of the manuscript is complete. I just need to refine it and get it to the editor. This book is happening as soon as the funds are in! If the funds are slow coming in, the book will just take a little longer to be published. This is happening!

Other Ways You Can Help

    If you would like to support this project, but do not have the financial means to do so, there are lots of other great ways to help. Indiegogo has lots of share tools to help you make some noise about this project. Shares and likes are extremely helpful. Let's make this happen!

story:
Köszönjük mindazoknak akik hozzájárultak a kampányunkhoz! A könyvek elkészültek, akik itt rendeltek belőlük már mind megkapták, viszont továbbra is van lehetőség vásárolni a Szilánkokból. Ehhez nem kell mást tennetek, mint a facebook oldalunkon írni egy üzenetet melyben leírjátok hány darabot szeretnétek, és hova postázzuk a köteteket!

A könyv ára 2790Ft + postaköltség.

Lelkes csapatunk munkájával decemberben készülünk kiadni antológiánkat az Unseen Domains világáról. A könyv történetei bejárják szinte az egész élőholtak által sújtotta Európát. Megjelenik benne a vérfarkasok uralta Német Fejedelemségek, a régi dicsőségére áhítozó Frankhon, az élőholtak által védett Vatikán, vagy a föld alá visszahúzódó, gőztechnológiát használó Kanton.

Mi is az az Unseen Domains?

"A régi világ elpusztult, s romjain döghadak lejtettek haláltáncot."

1648-ban az ismert világ darabjaira hullik. Elszabadul a boszorkánypestis, a halottak pedig nem nyughatnak többé a sírjaikban. Az élőholtak mellett olyan szörnyek is felütik a fejüket, melyek korábban csak a rémtörténetekben léteztek. Az országokat átjárja a mindent elsöprő félelem. Egyesek teljesen elzárkóznak a világtól, mások a föld alá kényszerülnek, de akadnak olyan államok is, melyek létezéséről már csak mendemondákban hallani. A világba visszatér a mágia, a remény mégis szertefoszlóban… Ám akadnak olyanok, akik ezekben a sötét órákban is felülkerekednek a rettegésen, hogy túléljék az apokalipszist, és rendet teremtsenek a mindent átjáró káoszban.

A finanszírozásról

Az előkészületek gőzerővel folynak, a Szilánkok hamarosan nyomdába kerül. A karácsony közeledtével szeretnénk ezt minél hamarabb megtenni, hogy biztosan eljusson mindenkinek a fája alá. Ahhoz, hogy ez minél nagyobb példányszámban megvalósulhasson, szükségünk van a segítségetekre, és anyagi támogatásotokra, de hálával fogadunk minden lájkot vagy megosztást is.

Célkitűzés

A kötetről

Kötetünk 14 művet foglal magába, melyek irodalmi igényességgel íródtak, tisztelegve a hagyományos fantasy írások előtt, mégis valami újat, egyedit alkotva.

Amennyiben munkásságunk felkeltette az érdeklődésedet és többet szeretnél tudni rólunk, látogass el facebook-oldalunkra:

https://www.facebook.com/UnseenDomains/
story_txt:
Köszönjük mindazoknak akik hozzájárultak a kampányunkhoz! A könyvek elkészültek, akik itt rendeltek belőlük már mind megkapták, viszont továbbra is van lehetőség vásárolni a Szilánkokból. Ehhez nem kell mást tennetek, mint a facebook oldalunkon írni egy üzenetet melyben leírjátok hány darabot szeretnétek, és hova postázzuk a köteteket!A könyv ára 2790Ft + postaköltség.Lelkes csapatunk munkájával decemberben készülünk kiadni antológiánkat az Unseen Domains világáról. A könyv történetei bejárják szinte az egész élőholtak által sújtotta Európát. Megjelenik benne a vérfarkasok uralta Német Fejedelemségek, a régi dicsőségére áhítozó Frankhon, az élőholtak által védett Vatikán, vagy a föld alá visszahúzódó, gőztechnológiát használó Kanton.Mi is az az Unseen Domains?"A régi világ elpusztult, s romjain döghadak lejtettek haláltáncot."1648-ban az ismert világ darabjaira hullik. Elszabadul a boszorkánypestis, a halottak pedig nem nyughatnak többé a sírjaikban. Az élőholtak mellett olyan szörnyek is felütik a fejüket, melyek korábban csak a rémtörténetekben léteztek. Az országokat átjárja a mindent elsöprő félelem. Egyesek teljesen elzárkóznak a világtól, mások a föld alá kényszerülnek, de akadnak olyan államok is, melyek létezéséről már csak mendemondákban hallani. A világba visszatér a mágia, a remény mégis szertefoszlóban… Ám akadnak olyanok, akik ezekben a sötét órákban is felülkerekednek a rettegésen, hogy túléljék az apokalipszist, és rendet teremtsenek a mindent átjáró káoszban.A finanszírozásról
Az előkészületek gőzerővel folynak, a Szilánkok hamarosan nyomdába kerül. A karácsony közeledtével szeretnénk ezt minél hamarabb megtenni, hogy biztosan eljusson mindenkinek a fája alá. Ahhoz, hogy ez minél nagyobb példányszámban megvalósulhasson, szükségünk van a segítségetekre, és anyagi támogatásotokra, de hálával fogadunk minden lájkot vagy megosztást is.CélkitűzésA kötetrőlKötetünk 14 művet foglal magába, melyek irodalmi igényességgel íródtak, tisztelegve a hagyományos fantasy írások előtt, mégis valami újat, egyedit alkotva.Amennyiben munkásságunk felkeltette az érdeklődésedet és többet szeretnél tudni rólunk, látogass el facebook-oldalunkra:https://www.facebook.com/UnseenDomains/

story:
Finding My Cool

Hello everyone. My name is Aja King and I am a licensed professional clinical counselor, and counseling psychologist. I educate the community, organizations, and my patients about the importance of mental wellness. Although I am able to help strangers, my personal struggle with helping my 7 year-old-son find his peace within school was a tremendous heartache for my family.

Being a single mother of two boys is not easy. Every parent hopes their child has success and happiness within their lives. Far too often, parents have to watch their children struggle as they find their way within this chaotic world. I was prompted to write my first children's book based on my son's struggle within school.

When Austin entered into kindergarten, everyone was hopeful and excited for him. As the school year started, the calls from the school became more frequent. We managed to get through kindergarten with several tears, fears, and eventually, his graduation. Then we entered into first grade. With our fingers crossed, we both hoped for the best. Yet, the calls begin to come more frequent, and even more urgent. Austin struggled, but not due to any mental health or behavioral issues, but rather, trying to understand how to find his cool in the mist of chaos within the classroom. Austin is doing much better, but he had to find ways to help him relax when the educational experience became overwhelming.

As a mental health therapist, I have heard the stories of other parents whose children have also struggled within the classroom, and the heartache this has caused. Many parents do not have the opportunity to volunteer within their child's classroom, or conduct a team collaboration to ease the tension of learning.

"Finding My Cool" is a book based on Austin's experience, and how he learned to become more centered. With the help from others ($5,000), I will be able to get the illustration, an editor, and the proper packaging to get my books into the hands of parents and teachers who want to enhance the educational experience.I have a team of people who are going to help with this experience. If the goal is not reached, I will still use the proceeds to fund the project. This has to happen, because far too often children are becoming discouraged, and believe they are a problem. The book will also include a link for more resources, and a Youtube channel where they can watch Austin practice his "cool". Please help me reach my goal to get this important message to those who want to help their child find their cool.
