story:
Ray Harryhausen - Master of the Majicks
Special DeLuxe Limited Edition Boxed Set
of Volumes 1, 2, and 3

Written by Mike Hankin

Vol. 1 - Foreword by Tom Hanks
              Introduction by Sir Christopher Frayling
Vol. 2 - Foreword by Jim Danforth
Vol. 3 - Foreword by Caroline Munro
               Preface by Guillermo del Toro

______________________________
 

• PROJECT FINISHING UP
FINAL COMPLETION CAMPAIGN

    My name is Ernest Farino and I am the publisher/designer of the 3-volume hardcover book set Ray Harryhausen - Master of the Majicks. Previously I worked extensively in the film business in the visual effects field on films like The Terminator, The Abyss, the HBO miniseries From the Earth to the Moon, and the Dune and Children of Dune miniseries, for which I won consecutive Emmy awards for the visual effects.

• THE PROJECT

Ray Harryhausen (1920-2013) created the stop motion animation and visual effects for some of the greatest and most fondly-remembered fantasy films of the past 50 years, including The Beast From 20,000 Fathoms, The 7th Voyage of Sinbad, One Million Years B.C., The Golden Voyage of Sinbad, Clash of the Titans (the original), and Jason and the Argonauts (remember the classic battle with seven sword-wielding skeletons?).

This campaign seeks to finance the final production costs of an updated and revised 3-volume, hardcover, special “boxed set” edition of
Ray Harryhausen - Master of the Majicks by Mike Hankin.

______________________________

• HAVEN'T I SEEN THIS SOMEWHERE BEFORE…?

Quite possibly! This campaign supplements a previous crowd funding campaign. Don't panic— if you have already pledged to the previous campaign, or pre-ordered directly from our website, rest assured that your order is in place, safe and sound. You do not need to pledge again (unless you want additional copies).

The purpose of this followup campaign is to spread the word one last time before we go to press for those who may not have been aware of the project.

______________________________

    Written and produced over the past 15 years with Ray Harryhausen's cooperation and support, the complete, definitive 3-volume 1,423-page 300,000-word career/biography features interviews with Ray and his colleagues and is profusely illustrated with over eight thousand rare photographs, artwork, and illustrations (many of which have never been previously published).

    All three volumes of the First Edition have been previously published: Volume 2 ("The American Films") came first in 2008, then Volume 3 ("The British Films") in 2010, and finally Volume 1 (“Beginnings and Endings”) in 2013 (detailed descriptions of each volume are linked below).

    All three volumes have sold out. Volume 2 took about a year to sell out, then word got out and Volume 3 took only about 3 months to sell out, and finally the demand by then was such that Vol. 1 sold out before the books themselves arrived from the printer!

    Once sold out, each of the three volumes immediately commanded extraordinary after-market prices on Amazon and eBay, ranging from $550.00 to $777.00 per copy and up. (Incredibly, copies of Vol. 2 on Amazon are currently listed at $1,900.00, and copies of Vol. 3 range from $750.00-$1,279.00). 

    Almost immediately readers began clamoring for reprints. However, since new films and plates have to be made from the original page layout files, the cost is just like starting over (it’s not a case of print-on-demand to get a single copy or a few copies).

    I have been very excited about the opportunity to update and upgrade each volume and reprint all three as a limited edition “boxed set” (with each volume also sold separately for those who don’t need all three volumes to complete their set).

    Ever since these books were originally published I have maintained an ongoing, detailed list of corrections and fixes, right down to notating individual typos and minor layout flaws.

    But —more importantly— I have collected a list of informational corrections, new information, additional quotes and references, additional photos, and, in some cases, I have been able to upgrade the image quality of some of the vintage photos. All of this will be incorporated into the new editions, making the reprint volumes all the more complete and comprehensive.

• WILL THIS NEW EDITION BE
AVAILABLE IN BOOKSTORES…?

No. Dealers can purchase the books here or later at full “retail” price and mark them up even more, of course, but this new limited edition reprint, including the boxed set and the individual volumes, will not be made available to bookstores or dealers in the conventional wholesale manner, nor will the reprint edition be listed on Amazon or eBay. 

    The ensures that you will be receiving an edition that is all the more exclusive.

• STATUS

It has been a long journey putting together this reprint edition, and I extend my thanks and appreciation to those who have already pre-ordered for your patience. Originally, I thought it would be a matter of updating some information, correcting some typos, and adding a handful of new photos. But the project escalated considerably, and new, exciting material started pouring in.

But now the content of the revised edition and the enhanced layout and graphic design is complete. I am in the process of going through final technical prep before outputting files to the printer. With 1,423 pages, over 8,000 photos, three dust jackets, the slipcases, etc., you can image the workload. But it's getting there, with steady progress every day, and there have been no problems on that front, so I expect to have this process finished very soon.

Click HERE to review the detailed checklist/chart of the status of the work.

Once all of these technical processes are completed I will output the files (a considerable endeavor in itself) and we will commence the proofing process. We will also be able to lock down a final printing/shipping calendar, and this information will be passed along to all customers. After that, regular updates will be posted to keep everyone informed of the progress.

• WHAT’S THE TOTAL COST?

The complete, direct cost of production will be $75,000. However, a previous crowd funding campaign and pre-orders through my website has covered most of that direct cost. This campaign goal is smaller and is intended to cap the final costs, as well as spread the word to (hopefully) a fresh audience. I hope that you will support what promises to be a spectacular limited edition boxed-set.

• HOW WILL THE PROCEEDS BE USED?

As stated, the layouts themselves are complete, and the previous campaign covered software updates and other interim expenses. This “supplemental” campaign is one final effort to make the project available to those who may not have known about it, and thus help round off final costs.

• WHAT DO YOU GET?

Each copy of each volume will be accompanied by an attractive Bookplate signed by both the Author, Mike Hankin, and the Publisher, Ernest Farino (shown directly below, with temporary printed signature for display purposes).


• WHAT IF YOU ALREADY HAVE ONE OR MORE
OF THE VOLUMES…?

Don’t you hate it when you feel like you have to buy a new edition of a movie on DVD because there is one more special feature...? Me, too. So, to that end, an attractive, fully laid-out perfect-bound softcover book will be made available containing all of the corrections and new information and photos for those people who already have one or more of the volumes. In other words, you don’t have to buy the complete books all over again just to get the new material and corrections.

    (*Note: On the website chart, this book is referred to as “the PDF” as it was originally planned as a downloadable document.)

    The new “boxed set” will come in an attractive slip case. This, too, will be offered separately if you already have one or more of the volumes.

• HOW DOES ALL THAT WORK IN THIS CAMPAIGN?

What if, say, you only need Vol. 2? Or Vol. 3?  Can you get just the individual volume you need…?

    Yes— you can just Pledge at a level that includes a “Perk” of any single volume or two volumes (without buying the whole set). Of this limited edition, the final print run will be determined by the exact number of preorders (for the box set or individual volumes). 

    If you already have all three books (the original editions)—
    • Can you get just the slip case…?
    • Can you get just the Supplement book of corrections and updates…?

    “Yes” to both questions, and the “Perks” have been structured accordingly. If you already have all 3 volumes, you can pledge at a level that gets you:
    • Only the slip case
              —or—
    • Only the Supplement book of corrections and updates
              —or—
    • Both the slip case and the Supplement.

In order to keep this presentation as concise as possible, I have provided links (below - scroll down further) to pages hosted on my website for further reading:

    • Reviews, Customer Comments, and Interviews. 
    • Slideshows of sample photos

Below those links are additional links to the exciting photo-montage trailers I created for Volumes 1 and 3, posted on YouTube.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this project, and I hope you will support this endeavor with your pledge!

Please share this campaign with your Facebook and Twitter followers. You can also e-mail the campaign URL to your friends to invite support of this project.

And be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Best wishes,

Ernest Farino

Ray Harryhausen - Master of the MajicksSpecial DeLuxe Limited Edition Boxed Setof Volumes 1, 2, and 3Written by Mike HankinVol. 1 - Foreword by Tom Hanks              Introduction by Sir Christopher FraylingVol. 2 - Foreword by Jim DanforthVol. 3 - Foreword by Caroline Munro               Preface by Guillermo del Toro______________________________ • PROJECT FINISHING UPFINAL COMPLETION CAMPAIGN    My name is Ernest Farino and I am the publisher/designer of the 3-volume hardcover book set Ray Harryhausen - Master of the Majicks. Previously I worked extensively in the film business in the visual effects field on films like The Terminator, The Abyss, the HBO miniseries From the Earth to the Moon, and the Dune and Children of Dune miniseries, for which I won consecutive Emmy awards for the visual effects.• THE PROJECTRay Harryhausen (1920-2013) created the stop motion animation and visual effects for some of the greatest and most fondly-remembered fantasy films of the past 50 years, including The Beast From 20,000 Fathoms, The 7th Voyage of Sinbad, One Million Years B.C., The Golden Voyage of Sinbad, Clash of the Titans (the original), and Jason and the Argonauts (remember the classic battle with seven sword-wielding skeletons?).This campaign seeks to finance the final production costs of an updated and revised 3-volume, hardcover, special “boxed set” edition ofRay Harryhausen - Master of the Majicks by Mike Hankin.______________________________• HAVEN'T I SEEN THIS SOMEWHERE BEFORE…?Quite possibly! This campaign supplements a previous crowd funding campaign. Don't panic— if you have already pledged to the previous campaign, or pre-ordered directly from our website, rest assured that your order is in place, safe and sound. You do not need to pledge again (unless you want additional copies).The purpose of this followup campaign is to spread the word one last time before we go to press for those who may not have been aware of the project.______________________________    Written and produced over the past 15 years with Ray Harryhausen's cooperation and support, the complete, definitive 3-volume 1,423-page 300,000-word career/biography features interviews with Ray and his colleagues and is profusely illustrated with over eight thousand rare photographs, artwork, and illustrations (many of which have never been previously published).    All three volumes of the First Edition have been previously published: Volume 2 ("The American Films") came first in 2008, then Volume 3 ("The British Films") in 2010, and finally Volume 1 (“Beginnings and Endings”) in 2013 (detailed descriptions of each volume are linked below).    All three volumes have sold out. Volume 2 took about a year to sell out, then word got out and Volume 3 took only about 3 months to sell out, and finally the demand by then was such that Vol. 1 sold out before the books themselves arrived from the printer!    Once sold out, each of the three volumes immediately commanded extraordinary after-market prices on Amazon and eBay, ranging from $550.00 to $777.00 per copy and up. (Incredibly, copies of Vol. 2 on Amazon are currently listed at $1,900.00, and copies of Vol. 3 range from $750.00-$1,279.00).     Almost immediately readers began clamoring for reprints. However, since new films and plates have to be made from the original page layout files, the cost is just like starting over (it’s not a case of print-on-demand to get a single copy or a few copies).    I have been very excited about the opportunity to update and upgrade each volume and reprint all three as a limited edition “boxed set” (with each volume also sold separately for those who don’t need all three volumes to complete their set).    Ever since these books were originally published I have maintained an ongoing, detailed list of corrections and fixes, right down to notating individual typos and minor layout flaws.    But —more importantly— I have collected a list of informational corrections, new information, additional quotes and references, additional photos, and, in some cases, I have been able to upgrade the image quality of some of the vintage photos. All of this will be incorporated into the new editions, making the reprint volumes all the more complete and comprehensive.• WILL THIS NEW EDITION BEAVAILABLE IN BOOKSTORES…?No. Dealers can purchase the books here or later at full “retail” price and mark them up even more, of course, but this new limited edition reprint, including the boxed set and the individual volumes, will not be made available to bookstores or dealers in the conventional wholesale manner, nor will the reprint edition be listed on Amazon or eBay.     The ensures that you will be receiving an edition that is all the more exclusive.• STATUSIt has been a long journey putting together this reprint edition, and I extend my thanks and appreciation to those who have already pre-ordered for your patience. Originally, I thought it would be a matter of updating some information, correcting some typos, and adding a handful of new photos. But the project escalated considerably, and new, exciting material started pouring in.But now the content of the revised edition and the enhanced layout and graphic design is complete. I am in the process of going through final technical prep before outputting files to the printer. With 1,423 pages, over 8,000 photos, three dust jackets, the slipcases, etc., you can image the workload. But it's getting there, with steady progress every day, and there have been no problems on that front, so I expect to have this process finished very soon.Click HERE to review the detailed checklist/chart of the status of the work.Once all of these technical processes are completed I will output the files (a considerable endeavor in itself) and we will commence the proofing process. We will also be able to lock down a final printing/shipping calendar, and this information will be passed along to all customers. After that, regular updates will be posted to keep everyone informed of the progress.• WHAT’S THE TOTAL COST?The complete, direct cost of production will be $75,000. However, a previous crowd funding campaign and pre-orders through my website has covered most of that direct cost. This campaign goal is smaller and is intended to cap the final costs, as well as spread the word to (hopefully) a fresh audience. I hope that you will support what promises to be a spectacular limited edition boxed-set.• HOW WILL THE PROCEEDS BE USED?As stated, the layouts themselves are complete, and the previous campaign covered software updates and other interim expenses. This “supplemental” campaign is one final effort to make the project available to those who may not have known about it, and thus help round off final costs.• WHAT DO YOU GET?Each copy of each volume will be accompanied by an attractive Bookplate signed by both the Author, Mike Hankin, and the Publisher, Ernest Farino (shown directly below, with temporary printed signature for display purposes).
• WHAT IF YOU ALREADY HAVE ONE OR MOREOF THE VOLUMES…?
Don’t you hate it when you feel like you have to buy a new edition of a movie on DVD because there is one more special feature...? Me, too. So, to that end, an attractive, fully laid-out perfect-bound softcover book will be made available containing all of the corrections and new information and photos for those people who already have one or more of the volumes. In other words, you don’t have to buy the complete books all over again just to get the new material and corrections.    (*Note: On the website chart, this book is referred to as “the PDF” as it was originally planned as a downloadable document.)    The new “boxed set” will come in an attractive slip case. This, too, will be offered separately if you already have one or more of the volumes.• HOW DOES ALL THAT WORK IN THIS CAMPAIGN?What if, say, you only need Vol. 2? Or Vol. 3?  Can you get just the individual volume you need…?    Yes— you can just Pledge at a level that includes a “Perk” of any single volume or two volumes (without buying the whole set). If you already have all 3 volumes, you can pledge at a level that gets you:    • Only the slip case              —or—    • Only the Supplement book of corrections and updates              —or—    • Both the slip case and the Supplement.---------------------------------------• FURTHER REFERENCE (LINKS)In order to keep this presentation as concise as possible, I have provided links (below - scroll down further) to pages hosted on my website for further reading:    • A detailed overview of the contents and features of each of the 3 volumes    • Reviews, Customer Comments, and Interviews.     • Slideshows of sample photos    • Samples of page layoutsBelow those links are additional links to the exciting photo-montage trailers I created for Volumes 1 and 3, posted on YouTube.Thank you for taking the time to consider this project, and I hope you will support this endeavor with your pledge!Please share this campaign with your Facebook and Twitter followers. story:
What's Up?!

My name is Steven Jones and I'm Co-Founder of Pleasure's Journal.

Pleasure's Journal?  

Well, In short we're a digital magazine/creative agency that creates and curates daily editorial, fashion, art, and music content. We strive to share material inspired by euphoria. Public and private indulgences. Weird, sexy, and a little sassy, we want to ignite adventure, youth, and voyeurism in a unique and bold way. 

So why are we launching a campaign?

We love our digital platforms, and what it allows us to do. We love being able to give you guys daily content and communicate and collaborate with our audience in an intimate way.

It's the whole reason we are what we are I believe.

That being said: We want to give you guys more!

We're hard workers with big goals, and a biannual print magazine has been our goal since the beginning. This campaign will allow us to create something really special, and honestly, something that you haven't seen before. I promise you that

Talking Turkey.

Let's break it down:

  • We are asking for  $2,500 in funding. This is to pay for: 
  • Actual printing of the magazine!
  • Equipment we need to give you the superb content you deserve!
  • Micro-costs such as, stickers, merchandise, instant film (Which you will get in the actual book!) business cards, etc.
  • That's it! We hope to use these funds to build our startup and eventually fund our own content for you beautiful people!
 

Risks & Challenges

Making a magazine takes a lot of work.  We know that. Making the art is only half of the battle and we will need to pour our heart and soul into this for this to have any success. Trust me when I say that even if we don't make our entire goal, I'll will give everything I have to making this magazine a reality for you. We want to give you something we can be really proud of,  All we're asking for is a little help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Even if you can't spare any money, we would love if you could share this campaign to your friends and family (strangers and enemies, hell, ANYBODY really.)
  • Follow us on instagram @pleasuresjournal
  • check out our site pleasuresjournal.com!
  • We will always post content regardless of how this campaign turns out, because at the end of the day, we want to do all of this with and for you <3

story:
Our Goal

The goal of these campaign is to give birth to the new independent photography magazine. With your help we strive to make possible the print run for the second edition of our Zoopark Magazine #1.  You're invited to take part in our project by making a pre-order of the publication and to choose one of our unique perks which also include our previous books and fine art prints. We've put a lot of work and love in our product, let's make it real together!

 

To print Zoopark #1 without too much stress and compromises we need about 50 supporters at the very least. Let's give it a push by sharing this campaign and spreading the word, wherever possible!

The #1

What Is Under The Cover:

32 photos / 34 pages /  uncoated paper 160 g/ metal spring binding / A4 size / digital offset printing / unique text by the anonymous and passionate author from Russian Wikipedia / and a lot of fun we had in the process

 

  


Planned Edition:

100 copies with the texts in English + 50 copies with the texts in Russian,                   all signed and numbered by the authors.

Planned Deadline for shipping pre-ordered copies and perks:

May 2016.


The Team

Zoopark Publishing is a team of two Russian photographers, Tatyana Palyga and Alexander Bondar. We share the same passion for photography and bookmaking and while being independent authors we still have many things in common, share similar views and feel the need to act collectively to push through our vision on photography and modes of its circulation.

 


Tatyana Palyga (b. 1982)

After graduating from a press photography school in Saint Petersburg, Russia in 2010 started to develop personal artistic projects and actively engaged in the field of photobooks and self-publishing. Since 2013 studying in the Master of Arts program in J.E. Purkyne University in Usti nad Labem, Czech republic. Currently based in Paris, France, studying photography in the University Paris 8. Her works took part in exhibitions in Russia, Great Britain, Italy, Czech Republic and photobooks were shown in the festivals and exhibitions all around the world.

Alexander Bondar (b. 1982)

Since 2007 works on personal photography projects. Studied in a press photography school in Saint Petersburg. In 2013 entered MA program in J.E. Purkyne University in Usti and Labem, Czech Republic. In 2014-15 studied in Warsaw Academy of Fine Arts in Poland. His personal interests lie in the field of photography, bookmaking, graphic arst and graphic design. Currently based in Usti nad Labem, Czech Republic.


Previously, even before officially united as the Zoopark Publishing collective we've been actively engaged in the creating and producing self-published photobooks which took part in numerous festivals, competitions and book fairs all over the world.

The Concept of the Magazine

The key idea of the Zoopark Magazine - to take very diverse pictures belonging to both of us and to put them in a new context of the magazine, mixing them up with each other and also with text, illustration, drawing, whatever - you name it!

During the years of our photography practice we have accumulated a truly huge amount of pictures that do not necessarily belong to any specific project or series. We felt it is time to share some part of it with the world, and that's how the magazine was born.


The Process of Creating the #1 Issue

As a starting point we took the last batch of films we developed and scanned at some moment and started to compose the spreads of the future magazine.
In the process we felt something started to happen, pictures started to interact with each other - by shapes, colors, meanings - some kind of weird narrative began to unroll. We finalized the sequence and we had a title, invented some funky design and put it together by our own hands. We even printed some number of copies and managed to sell some.

After a while we started to wonder if something was missing, we felt the urge to give it a fresh form. In the process of reworking the issue we stumbled on the Russian Wikipedia article on Zoos, which dazzled us with its incompleteness and immaturity, but had this very moving and naive touch to it, and surprisingly, it perfectly matched our photos.

Now we are excited and eager to share the results with you!

We start this campaign to print our special limited edition Zoopark Magazine #1. You have a chance to become a part of our team and at the same time acquire a very special object. Let’s be partners! And of course don't miss a chance to get our unique perks.

Perks

Take a look and find your favorite one!

Note for our Russian-speaking friends:

Если вам приглянулся какой-то перк, но вы предпочли бы иметь журнал на русском, просто введите "РУССКАЯ ВЕРСИЯ" во втором опциональном поле адреса доставки. 

If you would like your perk to include the magazine with the text in Russian instead of English, please type 'RUSSIAN VERSION' into the '2nd Address line' field.

Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Postcard

 

Become one of the first lucky owners of a printed copy of our magazine, signed and numbered by the authors! As an early bird supporter you will receive a specially produced photo-postcard with our heartfelt 'Thank you' on it!

Zoopark #1 Second Edition (IN RUSSIAN LANGUAGE) + Postcard

 

Любите русский язык? Мы тоже! Мы сделали специально для вас русскую версию журнала. Закажите русский номер Зоопарк №1, вручную пронумерованный и подписанный авторами, и наслаждайтесь аутентичной версией текста! В качестве приятного бонуса - открытка с нашей благодарностью.

Get a printed copy of the magazine (WITH RUSSIAN ORIGINAL TEXT) signed and numbered by the authors. As an early bird supporter you will receive a specially produced photo-postcard with our heartfelt 'Спасибо' on it!

Poster

Get a beautiful photo poster A4 format with a photo from Zoopark #1 and a photo postcard!

Photo by Tatyana Palyga

Zoopark #1 Support Zine

 

Especially for this campaign we release a unique support zine. Edition is limited by 50 copies only.

  

Size: A5. 16 photographs. 16 pages. Inkjet printing on matte photographic paper 170 g. Cover: tracing paper . Staple binding. Printed, bound, numbered and signed by our loving hands.

 

Hurry up and get your copy now only for $10. (special price only for the campaign).

Fine Art Prints

For our campaign we made a special limited edition of fine art prints from the pictures you can find in the magazine. For printing we use high quality pigment inks on a photographic archival paper. All prints are made from the film negatives scanned with a professional film scanner.

Pigment Archival Print (14x21 cm) by Tatyana Palyga.
Edition 50, Signed, Numbered

 

Please find as a perk on the right side of the page.

Pigment Archival Print (12.3x18.3 cm) by Alexander Bondar.
Edition 50, Signed, Numbered

 

Please find as a perk on the right side of the page.

Bigger prints by the authors

Please find as a perk on the right side of the page, when ordering please type the number of the chosen print in the 'Address Line 2' field.

#1 Pigment Archival Print (18.7x24 cm) by Tatyana Palyga.
Edition 50, Signed, Numbered

 


#2 Pigment Archival Print (17x26cm) by Alexander Bondar.
Edition 50, Signed, Numbered

 


#3 Lambda-print 18,7x24  by Alexander Bondar

Kodak Endura paper, Edition 75, Signed, Numbered

 


#4 Lambda-print 18,7x24 by Alexander Bondar

Kodak Endura paper, Edition 75, Signed Numbered

 




Magazine + Book!

As perks we include also our dummies and previously published books.

'Warm inside' (Тепло внутри) by Alexander Bondar

As a last minute perk in our campaing we present the dummy of a future title by Zoopark Publishing. 'Warm inside' (Тепло внутри) by Alexander Bondar. 30 photo illustrations. 60 pages. Soft cover. Staple bound. Signed by the author.

 



Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Postcard + the 'Milk-and-Water' book by Tatyana Palyga

    

 

Use your chance to save on the shipping cost and receive a signed copy of Zoopark #1, Second Edition in a package with the postcard and the previously self-published 'Milk-and-Water' book by Tatyana Palyga, signed by the author.

More about the book

Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Postcard + the 'One Way Or Another' book by Alexander Bondar

   

   

Receive a signed copy of Zoopark #1, Second Edition in a package with the postcard and the previously self-published 'One Way Or Another' book by Alexander Bondar, signed by the author.
More about the book

Magazine + Print!

For our campaign we made a special limited edition of fine art prints from the pictures you can find in the magazine. For printing we use high quality pigment inks on a photographic archival paper. All prints are made from the film negatives scanned with a professional film scanner.

Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Postcard +  Fine Art Print (14x21 cm) by Tatyana Palyga, edition 50, signed, numbered

Receive your signed copy of the Zoopark #1 Second Edition, a postcard with our 'Thank you' and a professionally produced pigment archival print of the author.

 


Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Postcard +  Fine Art Print (12.3x18.3 cm) by Alexander Bondar, edition 50, signed, numbered

Receive your signed copy of the Zoopark #1 Second Edition, a postcard with our 'Thank you' and a professionally produced Pigment Archival Print by the author.

 


Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Postcard +  Fine Art Print (18.7x24 cm) by Tatana Palyga, edition 50, signed, numbered

Receive your signed copy of the Zoopark #1 Second Edition, a postcard with our 'Thank you' and a professionally produced Pigment Archival Print by the author.

 


Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Postcard +  Fine Art Print (17x26cm) by Alexander Bondar, edition 50, signed, numbered

Receive your signed copy of the Zoopark #1 Second Edition, a postcard with our 'Thank you' and a professionally produced Pigment Archival Print by the author.

 


Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Zoopark #2 Early Bird Pre-order

 

Receive your signed copy of the Zoopark #1 Second Edition and be one of the first to pre-order our upcoming #2 for a favorable price. This issue is going to be noticeably bigger, it is dedicated to the Czech Republic and made in collaboration with the illustration artist Monika Dolezalova. You'll receive #1 in the beginning of May 2016 and #2 is planned for the mid-fall of 2016.


Special Perks


Zoopark #1 Second Edition + Your Name in the 'Thank You' section on the Back Cover

Become our official sponsor and receive a copy of Zoopark #1, 2nd edition with your name mentioned in our special 'Thank You' section!


Zoopark Early Years Collector's Box, edition 15

For those who wants 'to take it all' we have prepared a very special offer!

Beautifully produced box which comprises:
- the 'Coloress Days' photobook by Tatyana Palyga
- the 'Milk-and-Water' photobook by Tatyana Palyga 
- the 'One Way or Another' photobook by Alexanber Bondar
- Zoopark #1 Second Edition,
- a fine art print 18.7x24 cm by Tatyana Palyga, edition 50
- a fine art print 17x26cm by Alexander Bondar, edition 50
All the books and a magazine are signed by the authours.

The Box has limited edition of 15, all books and prints are additionally signed with the Collectors' Box's unique number.  Become one of the first owners fo the whole collection! Delivery is planned for June 2016.

Note : the Box will include the last unsold 15 copies of the 'Coloress Days' photobook by Tatyana Palyga!

Photography/bookmaking Workshop by the Zoopark Publishing collective

See you in Prague on your 4 hour individual workshop with us!
We promise to share with you all the knowledge and skill that we have. In addition you will  receive your signed copy of the Zoopark #1 Second Edition and a postcard with our 'Thank you'.
Date is to be discussed individually, the place is also up to mutual agreement. Please get in touch with us to discuss the details.

 

Unique offer: Zoopark Designs Your Zine!

Are you dreaming to publish your own photography zine/small book?
Have it edited and designed by the Zoopark Publishing Team!
All you have to do is just to send us around 200 of your photos, share your ideas and wishes with us and by July you'll get a printed dummy, the PDF and all the source files for your publication together with your beautiful printed copy of the Zoopark #1 Second Edition! Everything will be delivered to you by the end of July 2016. 

 


How Else You Can Contribute

If you‘re not ready to contribute now but eager to help us to get the magazine out into the world, please feel free to share this campaign in your social networks and tell your friends about it. We hold our fingers crossed for our future collaboration and  thank you sincerely in advance!


Production of the Zoopark #1 Second Editon

The edition will be printed in Usti nad Labem, Czech Republic in a collaboration with the CDSM printing press company using high quality materials. Our collaboration with the printer started several years ago with the production of our personal books and dummies and we were always very happy with the results.


Risks and dates

What if we don’t reach the goal by the end of the campaign period? Don't worry!
We will print our magazine anyway, and each of you who contributed will get his or her copy as well as the perks! We will just rethink the number of copies in the edition. For our supporters it will mean that they will own even more unique and precious object.

At this moment we are ready to print as soon as we have enough funds to cover printing costs. The files are ready, the sample copy is beautiful and the printer is just waiting for a message from us to start the production. All we need to do - is to add more names into the 'Thank You' section, of course!

The printed magazines, postcards, prints and other perks will be shipped to you by the beginning of May 2016.


Zoopark Publishing

Zoopark Magazine #1 is to become a first title published by our own brand new Zoopark Publishing Collective, organization consisting of two of us and aiming towards publishing our own works. During the years we were working on our independent personal projects and after some accounting was done we realized that we have about 15 titles for which we have printed dummies already, not even speaking about the ideas for the future ones. So our goal is to realize them step by step, hopefully, also with your support.

The next one, Zoopark #2, is being made in collaboration with the illustration artist Monika Dolezalova and tells the story about our everyday life in Czech Republic. Please follow our website and the Facebook page to stay in touch with our future releases.

story:
Independent, Objective Journalism

This is your chance to make a real difference to the reportage the world receives, support my journalism, viewed by millions across the world, breaking through the barriers put up by corporations, and organisations. 

We live in a world of information wars perpetuating real wars. This is your chance to make a difference, to make a contribution to real information, and breaking down information walls, and wars. 

This is your opportunity to - 

  • Contribute to real journalism, no agendas or narratives - just news as it is
  • Get the truth out to wide, and ever-growing audience
  • Support original projects, and innovative, exciting journalism

From my site, be sure, I'll reciprocate your support in full, by doing as much as I can for your support, working as hard as I can, working with you to make something amazing happen!

This project covers reportage, films, articles, and more! And, I cover every side of events in Donbass, and everywhere I cover, war, peace, a completely balanced, unbiased picture.

story:
Hey y'all, hey!  I am Alise Leslie, a poet, author, blogger and mental health advocate residing in Durham, NC.  My current labor of love is an original poetry book, guided self-care/reflection journal, and implementation of a series of  poetry and writing workshops focusing on self-care, community building, and mental health awareness.  

The title "This Makes Sense" came from a phrase I found myself jokingly saying when describing my feelings that felt a little strange or disjointed.  Funny thing is, every time I nervously said that, someone related.  I felt that was a powerful realization and connection and began putting together poetry around that concept.

As someone who has overcome many trials and pitfalls through their own mental health journey, I want to help create support, visibility, and provide safe spaces of expression to those in need.  So many people did that for me and I want to honor them by paying the generosity, awareness, and tools forward.  


Your help will make the process of self-publishing a lot less rocky and stressful.  It will also allow me to expand my brand and product offerings, that in turn will allow me to advocate to a wider audience and be a support system to those trying to find their way through rough times and mental illness diagnoses.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $1500+.  Funds will be going towards printing costs for both the book and journal.  Remaining funds will go towards book/journal marketing and to start purchasing supplies/materials and secure locations to begin poetry and writing workshops.  

Perks include personal thank yous, books, journals, and tote bags!  You are not just donating, you are getting the REAL DEAL product before anyone else!

 

Book official release is Wednesday, October 25th, 2017!  Perks will be shipped prior to this date!

 

If you can't contribute now, please help by sharing this campaign with your friends and social network and please consider buying a book and/or journal after the end of the campaign.  I'm easy to find: naturallyalise.com

story:
What is Music Theory You Can Use?

In sitting down to find a way to properly introduce this book I am finding that, for the most part, my words escape me.  For those of you who watched me grow up under my father's instruction and care you may find this, shall we say, unusual.  I have long been known as a woman of many words.  So I will speak a bit about my family, and why we have come to fall in love with the guitar.

I began playing the guitar in 1989, at the age of seven.  To this day, it remains the most exciting and magical thing I have ever seen.  The first time I picked the instrument up, it became an essential part of who I am, and who I will be for the rest of my life.  As young as I was, I had to have one, I had to learn to play, and I had to be GREAT.

My name is Lily Maase.  I am a guitarist and educator who has made a lifelong commitment to the craft of not just playing the guitar, but teaching it.  But beyond this, I am Steve Maase's daughter.  And as a result I am coming humbly to you, my fellow guitarist and student of music, with the legacy of a truly brilliant human being.

I spoke to my father for the last time on the afternoon of September 30, 2016, when he called to let me know he was about to hand in the final details for this book: various photographs, album covers and newspaper clippings that comprised the personal details of Steve's early life and career as a guitarist.  We chatted briefly about his health (finally stable, after a brief bout with cancer three years prior) and next steps for the book (over twenty years in the making, it was almost done!), and made plans to speak the following day.  This was the last conversation we ever had.

My father had turned 70 just two weeks prior, and had gotten in the habit of telling just about anyone who would listen that he intended to have his hands on his instrument until the day he died.  I am happy to report to the people that knew and admired him that this was in fact the case; we learned of his passing because he was expected to perform at a club in downtown Albuquerque the evening of October 1st and never arrived.  He had gone quietly in his sleep early that morning, his life's work finally finished and ready to share with the world.

Steve was the hardest-working person I have ever known, and yet he maintained that he had never worked a day in his life.  At the peak of his career, I shadowed him at his studio as he taught 85-90 weekly students in half-hour increments; worked as a session guitarist recording jingles for national ad agencies and guitar solos for regional pop and gospel groups; spent hours in his workshop repairing electric and acoustic versions of the instrument; and, after all that, spent most weekend evenings onstage with a variety of bands, each of which rounded out the night at a local club with a minimum of three 60-minute sets.

My father is perhaps the most perfect representation of what the guitar means in every way.  Here is a man who never went to music school--a man who taught himself to play beautifully and then, looking at what he learned, figured out how to take this information and share it with others.  He did this selflessly, joyfully, and arguably at the expense of his own recognition and fame.  Here, also, is a man who came up through the tradition of the instrument as that tradition was created, who had brushes with fame alongside Buddy Holly, who remembered the earliest Fender amplifiers and guitars, who took the time to look at the guitar as it ascended into the pantheons of popular culture and ask an essential question: how does all this really work, and why?

When he was behind his instrument, Steve was a force of nature.  But the thing that strikes me most upon reflection is the fact that, in his daily life, he was a flawlessly gentle and giving human being.  He is unique, perhaps, in his conviction that the information that led to his successes also belonged to everyone he met along the way.

This book is a representation of all these things.  In it you will find the beginnings of a personal memoir, not just of Steve's life but of the humble beginnings of popular music in the 1950s and 1960s.  You will find an explanation of music theory so simple and so complete that, once you have worked your way through the material in the order that Steve suggested, it will seem bizarre that you did not have a mastery of this information all along.  You will also find, in pursuing this knowledge, that you are left with more questions than answers, and that Steve's story leaves off at a point where it is certain there are still many things ahead.

This is where I come into the picture, for this book was intended not to be the completion of a story but the beginning.  Steve left behind copious notes for a second book, and outlines for several books to follow.  I fully intend to use these notes and the success of this first publication to complete Steve's unfinished sequels and help them see the light of day.  As you come to know me, I trust that you will see beyond a doubt that my father has taught me well.

One of the last things Steve said to me was this: "I am interested in teaching students, but at this point in my life I am more interested in teaching teachers how to teach."  If you are a student of the instrument, I am convinced beyond a doubt that this book and its successors will give you access to the tools you need to continue on your personal journey of discovery.  If you are a teacher like myself, it is my hope that you will come to see my father's work as the foundation for a tried-and-true method that will assist you as you endeavor to guide your students toward success.

Sincerest thanks to all of you who knew the inimitable Steve Maase and have entrusted me with the task of honoring the legacy of a truly remarkable man.  I look forward to continuing to share a life of music and learning with you all.

With love,

Lily Maase, guitarist

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • 20 years after the first draft of this book saw the light of day, Music Theory You Can Use is finished, laid out and ready to print!  Presales for the first edition of this amazing guitarists' manual will go toward providing a stipend for the design team who donated their time and expertise in order to save this project after my father's untimely passing left my own life in a bit of disarray.  Additional funds will go toward a publicity campaign designed to share Steve's method and enthusiasm for the instrument with the world, and toward staffing and infrastructure to develop the plans Steve left behind--two followup books and two apps to help guide emerging guitarists as they grow.

 

  • This campaign is the only place to pre-order Music Theory You Can Use before it becomes available to the public in mid-September.  We will do everything within our power to get you a physical copy before the official release date.

 

  • In addition to "early bird" access to the book, we are also providing exclusive access to the following things from the family "guitar vault":
    • some or all of Steve's extensive transcription catalogue, amassed over decades of teaching private students.  Steve had an incredible ear and we have well over 2,000 pieces of music digitally archived and ready to make available
    • previously-unreleased live and studio recordings, as well as demos and lead sheets for some of Steve's original tunes
    • signed prints of the cover artwork, which was hand-drawn on commission by New Mexico-based illustrator Marcelo Gallegos
    • enrollment in Steve's classic theory class, taught by yours truly (New York only)
    • a limited number of private lessons (available in New Mexico, New York, or via Skype)
    •  a limited number of private house concerts (available in New Mexico and New York only)

 

The Impact

One of my father's students recently said to me, "Your dad stands head and shoulders above the entire planet."  As the weeks and months have passed, I have become increasingly aware of the incredibly personal impact my father had on just about everyone his music touched.

One thing that each of us who were lucky enough to study with Steve will tell you--the method works!  It really, truly does.  I have seen his approach unlock the mysteries of the instrument for SO MANY guitarists!  I am truly inspired by the notion that this information might be able to aid emerging players for generations to come.

If this book reaches a wide enough audience, I will be able to set aside the time and resources to complete the rest of his unfinished work.  It would mean the world to me to be able to dedicate this phase of my adult life to finishing the things my father couldn't.

 

Risks & Challenges

I have been in the music business as a performer, bandleader, venue manager, educator, tour manager, booking agent, recording artist and proprietor of a school.  This is my first time releasing a print book, but not my first time growing a beautiful project from the seeds of an idea into something capable of reaching thousands.  In the nine months since I inherited this project, I have learned just how resourceful I can be at this point in my career.  I did not expect to be the sole proprietor of a publishing company, a guitar school, and a tribute band at this point in my career.  Yet, I am looking past the sadness of this sudden loss with a certain amount of joy--20 years after I saw the first draft of this book, the rest of the world is finally going to be able to meet my amazing, infinitely capable, incredibly brilliant father.  I am turning to the village of people who knew Steve for support so we can work together to preserve his work and share it with the community of guitarists across the globe.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you don't have the financial means to pre-order the book, never fear!  Help get the word out by visiting our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/GuitarDadPublications and sharing any of the student testimonials in the Video section.

 

  • Or, share this campaign from this page, and help us reach the thousands of guitar enthusiasts that will benefit from my father's knowledge, that have yet to hear his name.

My father had turned 70 just two weeks prior, and had gotten in the habit of telling just about anyone who would listen that he intended to have his hands on his instrument until the day he died.  I am happy to report to the people that knew and admired him that this was in fact the case; we learned of his passing because he was expected to perform at a club in downtown Albuquerque the evening of October 1st and never arrived.  He had gone quietly in his sleep early that morning, his life's work finally finished and ready to share with the world.
Steve was the hardest-working person I have ever known, and yet he maintained that he had never worked a day in his life.  At the peak of his career, I shadowed him at his studio as he taught 85-90 weekly students in half-hour increments; worked as a session guitarist recording jingles for national ad agencies and guitar solos for regional pop and gospel groups; spent hours in his workshop repairing electric and acoustic versions of the instrument; and, after all that, spent most weekend evenings onstage with a variety of bands, each of which rounded out the night at a local club with a minimum of three 60-minute sets.
My father is perhaps the most perfect representation of what the guitar means in every way.  Here is a man who never went to music school--a man who taught himself to play beautifully and then, looking at what he learned, figured out how to take this information and share it with others.  He did this selflessly, joyfully, and arguably at the expense of his own recognition and fame.  Here, also, is a man who came up through the tradition of the instrument as that tradition was created, who had brushes with fame alongside Buddy Holly, who remembered the earliest Fender amplifiers and guitars, who took the time to look at the guitar as it ascended into the pantheons of popular culture and ask an essential question: how does all this really work, and why?
When he was behind his instrument, Steve was a force of nature.  But the thing that strikes me most upon reflection is the fact that, in his daily life, he was a flawlessly gentle and giving human being.  He is unique, perhaps, in his conviction that the information that led to his successes also belonged to everyone he met along the way.
This book is a representation of all these things.  In it you will find the beginnings of a personal memoir, not just of Steve's life but of the humble beginnings of popular music in the 1950s and 1960s.  You will find an explanation of music theory so simple and so complete that, once you have worked your way through the material in the order that Steve suggested, it will seem bizarre that you did not have a mastery of this information all along.  You will also find, in pursuing this knowledge, that you are left with more questions than answers, and that Steve's story leaves off at a point where it is certain there are still many things ahead.
This is where I come into the picture, for this book was intended not to be the completion of a story but the beginning.  Steve left behind copious notes for a second book, and outlines for several books to follow.  I fully intend to use these notes and the success of this first publication to complete Steve's unfinished sequels and help them see the light of day.  As you come to know me, I trust that you will see beyond a doubt that my father has taught me well.
One of the last things Steve said to me was this: "I am interested in teaching students, but at this point in my life I am more interested in teaching teachers how to teach."  If you are a student of the instrument, I am convinced beyond a doubt that this book and its successors will give you access to the tools you need to continue on your personal journey of discovery.  If you are a teacher like myself, it is my hope that you will come to see my father's work as the foundation for a tried-and-true method that will assist you as you endeavor to guide your students toward success.
Sincerest thanks to all of you who knew the inimitable Steve Maase and have entrusted me with the task of honoring the legacy of a truly remarkable man.  I look forward to continuing to share a life of music and learning with you all.
With love,
Lily Maase, guitarist
 

What We Need & What You Get
20 years after the first draft of this book saw the light of day, Music Theory You Can Use is finished, laid out and ready to print!  Presales for the first edition of this amazing guitarists' manual will go toward providing a stipend for the design team who donated their time and expertise in order to save this project after my father's untimely passing left my own life in a bit of disarray.  Additional funds will go toward a publicity campaign designed to share Steve's method and enthusiasm for the instrument with the world, and toward staffing and infrastructure to develop the plans Steve left behind--two followup books and two apps to help guide emerging guitarists as they grow.
 
This campaign is the only place to pre-order Music Theory You Can Use before it becomes available to the public in mid-September.  We will do everything within our power to get you a physical copy before the official release date.
 
In addition to "early bird" access to the book, we are also providing exclusive access to the following things from the family "guitar vault":
some or all of Steve's extensive transcription catalogue, amassed over decades of teaching private students.  Steve had an incredible ear and we have well over 2,000 pieces of music digitally archived and ready to make available
previously-unreleased live and studio recordings, as well as demos and lead sheets for some of Steve's original tunes
signed prints of the cover artwork, which was hand-drawn on commission by New Mexico-based illustrator Marcelo Gallegos
enrollment in Steve's classic theory class, taught by yours truly (New York only)
a limited number of private lessons (available in New Mexico, New York, or via Skype)
 a limited number of private house concerts (available in New Mexico and New York only)


 

The Impact
One of my father's students recently said to me, "Your dad stands head and shoulders above the entire planet."  As the weeks and months have passed, I have become increasingly aware of the incredibly personal impact my father had on just about everyone his music touched.
One thing that each of us who were lucky enough to study with Steve will tell you--the method works!  It really, truly does.  I have seen his approach unlock the mysteries of the instrument for SO MANY guitarists!  I am truly inspired by the notion that this information might be able to aid emerging players for generations to come.
If this book reaches a wide enough audience, I will be able to set aside the time and resources to complete the rest of his unfinished work.  It would mean the world to me to be able to dedicate this phase of my adult life to finishing the things my father couldn't.
 

Risks & Challenges
I have been in the music business as a performer, bandleader, venue manager, educator, tour manager, booking agent, recording artist and proprietor of a school.  This is my first time releasing a print book, but not my first time growing a beautiful project from the seeds of an idea into something capable of reaching thousands.  In the nine months since I inherited this project, I have learned just how resourceful I can be at this point in my career.  I did not expect to be the sole proprietor of a publishing company, a guitar school, and a tribute band at this point in my career.  Yet, I am looking past the sadness of this sudden loss with a certain amount of joy--20 years after I saw the first draft of this book, the rest of the world is finally going to be able to meet my amazing, infinitely capable, incredibly brilliant father.  I am turning to the village of people who knew Steve for support so we can work together to preserve his work and share it with the community of guitarists across the globe.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't have the financial means to pre-order the book, never fear!  Help get the word out by visiting our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/GuitarDadPublications and sharing any of the student testimonials in the Video section.
 
Or, share this campaign from this page, and help us reach the thousands of guitar enthusiasts that will benefit from my father's knowledge, that have yet to hear his name.

story:
There is a silent killer that most of us seem to ignore. It’s spread knows no earthly bound, and it’s reach stretches back beyond measurable time. It comes in many varieties, and afflicts all types of people. And despite its danger, and despite its incredible age, we are still studying it, and changing our opinions on what it is, and how to prevent and cure it. This silent killer is mental illness, and chances are you or someone you know is familiar with it.

 

My name is J. Vonn Fritz, a Metro Detroit born activist, and this is the social edition of 105 Haiku. In a similar fashion to our labor focused editions, I searched across America, physically and digitally, to do interviews with those afflicted with mental illness, and asked as many as I can to write haiku about what frustrates them the most, and what they’d like to see changed (for frustration is the first step towards change). The point of this series is to give people a louder voice, especially those we often take for granted. Within this book is all the haiku that I’ve collected, separated by mental illness, and illustrated by Richy Benson. At the very end I have advice, based on my interviews, on how to make life better for those afflicted by mental illness.

In making this project a reality you will help in spreading awareness about issues that people face with mental health. There are a lot of obstacles that they face, and they have a lot to say about how tings could get better. This book will give 20% of all future profit to Mental Health Charities, so you will be changing the world.
